Title: Peach Cobbler Cookies
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/peach-cobbler-cookies-recipe-11784130
Ingredients:
- 1cupsdiced, pitted, peeledfresh peaches
- 1/3cupfirmly packedbrown sugar
- 1tablespoonunsalted butter
- 1/2teaspoonvanilla extract
- 1/4teaspoonground cinnamon
- 1/8teaspoonground nutmeg
- 1pinchsalt
- 2teaspoonsfresh lemon juice
- 1 1/2teaspoonscornstarch
- 1cupunsalted butter, softened
- 3/4cupfirmly packedbrown sugar
- 3/4cupwhite sugar, divided
- 1teaspoonsalt
- 1teaspoonground cinnamon
- 1/4teaspoonground nutmeg
- 1largeegg, at room temperature
- 2teaspoonsvanilla extract
- 1/4teaspoonalmond extract
- 2 3/4cupsall-purpose flour
- 1/2teaspoonbaking powder
- 1/4teaspoonbaking soda
Instructions:
1. For filling: Place peaches, brown sugar, butter, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt to a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring frequently, until mixture is boiling and sugar is dissolved, about 5 minutes.
2. Stir lemon juice and cornstarch together in a small bowl until thoroughly combined; pour into the peaches and stir to thoroughly incorporate. Continue to cook, stirring constantly, until thickened, 2 to 3 minutes. Pour mixture into a heatproof container and refrigerate until thoroughly chilled, about 1 hour, or up to 2 days.
3. For cookie dough: Beat butter, brown sugar, 1/2 cup white sugar, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg together with an electric mixer until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Add in egg, vanilla, and almond extract and beat for 1 minute more. Add in flour, baking powder, and baking soda and mix on low speed until mixture comes together in a stiff dough.
4. Pour remaining 1/4 cup white sugar into a small bowl and set aside. Scoop out 1 1/2 tablespoons dough and roll it into a ball. Roll dough ball in white sugar until thoroughly coated. Using your thumb or the handle of a wooden spoon or spatula, press an indentation into the center of the cookie measuring about 3/4-inch wide and about 1/3-inch deep. Repeat process with remaining cookie dough.
5. Remove filling from the refrigerator. Place about 1 1/2 teaspoons filling into the indentation of each cookie, heaping the filling into the center of the cookies. Refrigerate filled cookies for 30 minutes.
6. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C) and line baking sheets with parchment. Place cookies about 2 inches apart on the prepared baking sheets.
7. Bake cookies, 1 pan at a time, in the preheated oven until edges begin to turn golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes. Cool cookies on the pan for 5 minutes; remove to a wire rack to cool completely. Store cooled cookies in the refrigerator.

========================================

Title: Dubai Chocolate Bar Watergate Salad
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/dubai-chocolate-bar-watergate-salad-recipe-11746754
Ingredients:
- 24frosted mini wheats,or as needed, divided
- 1(3.4 ounce) packageinstantpistachio pudding mix
- 2cupschocolate milk
- 2cupsmini marshmallows
- 1/2cupmilk chocolate chips
- 2cupswhipped topping
- 1/2cupshelledpistachios, chopped
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Allrecipes / Abbey Littlejohn
2. Add frosted mini wheats to a plastic bag and crush with your hands or a rolling pin. You should have about 2 cups. Set aside.Allrecipes / Abbey Littlejohn
3. Whisk pistachio pudding and chocolate milk together in a large bowl for 2 minutes. Add mini marshmallows and chocolate chips. Gently fold in whipped topping. Sprinkle 1 1/2 cups crushed frosted mini wheats into the mixture and continue to fold gently until combined.Allrecipes / Abbey Littlejohn
4. Sprinkle remaining 1/2 cup crushed frosted mini wheats and chopped pistachios over the top. Refrigerate until set and fully chilled, 1 to 2 hours.Allrecipes / Abbey Littlejohn

Title: Apple Cider Hawaiian Roll Donuts
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/apple-cider-hawaiian-roll-donuts-recipe-11786958
Ingredients:
- 1(12-count) package)Hawaiian rolls
- 1cupapple pie filling
- 2(0.74 ounce)pouchesapple cider powdered drink mix (such as Alpine Spiced Apple Cider®)
- 5tablespoonsbutter, divided
- 1/2cupsugar
- 1teaspooncinnamon
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
2. Separate Hawaiian rolls and cut a 1/2-inch slit in the side of each one. Use a finger or the end of a spoon to create a larger opening and a space large enough to fill each roll with about 1 tablespoon filling.
3. Roughly chop apple pie filling and add to a bowl. Stir in 1 packet apple cider mix. Spoon filling into the prepared rolls.
4. Melt 4 tablespoons butter and brush each roll on all sides with melted butter. Place rolls on a lined baking sheet.
5. Bake rolls in the preheated oven until lightly toasted and golden brown, 12 to 14 minutes.
6. Meanwhile, stir together remaining apple cider packet, sugar, and cinnamon in a shallow dish and melt remaining butter.
7. Brush tops of rolls evenly with melted butter and coat each roll in sugar mixture.Peyton Beckwith

Title: Hawaiian Butter Mochi
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/84857/ono-butter-mochi/
Ingredients:
- 1poundmochiko (glutinous rice flour)
- 2 ½cupswhite sugar
- 1teaspoonbaking powder
- ½cupbutter, melted
- 3cupswhole milk
- 5largeeggs
- 1teaspoonvanilla extract
- 1cupsweetened, flaked coconut
Instructions:
1. Gather ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
2. Whisk eggs, vanilla, and milk together in a medium bowl. Stir rice flour, sugar, and baking powder together in a separate larger bowl.
3. Stir egg mixture into flour mixture until blend. Mix in melted butter and coconut. Pour into the prepared pan.
4. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 1 hour. Cool completely in the pan on a wire rack until mochi has set. The texture will improve as it cools. Use a sharp, greased knife to cut into squares.

Title: Orange Dreamsicle Salad
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/orange-dreamsicle-salad-recipe-11771968
Ingredients:
- 1(3 ounce) packageorange-flavored gelatin, such as Jell-O®
- 3/4cupboilingwater
- 2(15 ounce) cansmandarin oranges in light syrup
- 1(3.4 ounce) packagevanilla instant pudding and pie filling, such as Jell-O®
- 1(8 ounce) containerfrozen whipped topping, thawed, such as Cool Whip®
- 2cupsminiaturemarshmallows, plus more for garnish
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Stanfield / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
2. Whisk together orange-flavored gelatin and boiling water in a large, heatproof bowl until fully dissolved.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Stanfield / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
3. Drain mandarin oranges and set aside at room temperature; reserve 1/2 cup of the light syrup. Whisk the 1/2 cup syrup into gelatin mixture (discard remaining syrup, or reserve for another use). Chill gelatin mixture, uncovered, until cool to the touch, about 15 minutes.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Stanfield / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
4. Whisk instant pudding into cooled gelatin mixture until combined. Return bowl to refrigerator and chill until slightly thickened, about 10 minutes.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Stanfield / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
5. Gently fold in whipped topping until just combined.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Stanfield / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
6. Add mandarin oranges and marshmallows, and fold until evenly distributed. Cover and chill mixture until set and slightly thickened, about 3 hours.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Stanfield / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
7. Serve in chilled bowls; garnish with more marshmallows.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Stanfield / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee

Title: Easy "No Measure" S'mores Bars
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/246237/easy-no-measure-smores-bars/
Ingredients:
- cooking spray
- ¾cupbutter, melted
- 2individual packagesgraham crackers, crushed
- ½(12 ounce) bagchocolate chips, or more to taste
- ½(12 ounce) packagebutterscotch chips
- ½(10.5 ounce) packageminiature marshmallows
- ½(14 ounce) cansweetened condensed milk, or more to taste
Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8x8-inch square pan with cooking spray.
2. Mix melted butter and graham cracker crumbs together; press into an even layer at the bottom of the pan. Top with chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, and marshmallows. Drizzle sweetened condensed milk on top.
3. Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly, 17 to 20 minutes.
4. Let cool, about 30 minutes. To make it easier to cut into bars, cover with plastic wrap and chill, about 30 minutes.

Title: Banana Bread Tiramisu
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/banana-bread-tiramisu-recipe-11786624
Ingredients:
- 1/2cupwhole milk
- 1/4cupgranulated sugar
- 1/2teaspoonground cinnamon
- 1/4cupspiced rum (such as Captain Morgen) (optional)
- 1mediumripebanana
- 1/2cupgranulated sugar
- 1cupheavy whipping cream, chilled
- 1(8-ounce)packagemascarpone cheese, at room temperature
- 2teaspoonsvanilla extract
- 1(7 ounce) packageSavioardiladyfingers (about 24)
- 5mediumripe bananas,sliced, divided
- 2teaspoonsground cinnamon
- 1/2teaspoonground nutmeg
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Photographer: Victor Protasio / Food Styling: Julian Hensarling / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
2. Prepare the Cinnamon Milk: combine milk, sugar, and cinnamon in a jar; shake until sugar has dissolved, about 1 minute. Add rum, if using, and shake once more to combine. Set aside.Photographer: Victor Protasio / Food Styling: Julian Hensarling / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
3. Prepare the Banana Mascarpone: combine banana and sugar in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a whisk attachment. Beat on medium-high speed until smooth, about 1 minute. Add cream and beat on high speed until stiff peaks form, about 2 minutes. Add mascarpone and vanilla extract; beat on medium speed until soft and billowy, about 20 seconds. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use.Photographer: Victor Protasio / Food Styling: Julian Hensarling / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
4. When ready to assemble, working with 1 ladyfinger at a time, dip half of the ladyfingers into the spiced milk, letting it sit in milk about 2 seconds total. Transfer to an 8-x8-inch baking dish and arrange ladyfingers in a single layer, trimming ladyfingers as needed to fit neatly.Photographer: Victor Protasio / Food Styling: Julian Hensarling / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
5. Top ladyfingers with 2 of the sliced bananas in an even layer.Photographer: Victor Protasio / Food Styling: Julian Hensarling / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
6. Top bananas with half of the banana mascarpone (about a scant 2 cups), and, using a flexible or offset spatula, spread into an even layer. Repeat with remaining ladyfingers, 2 of the sliced bananas, and banana mascarpone.Photographer: Victor Protasio / Food Styling: Julian Hensarling / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
7. Stir together cinnamon and nutmeg in a small bowl; spoon into a fine mesh sieve. Dust top with cinnamon mixture. Loosely cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 8 hours or up to 3 days. When ready to serve, top with remaining sliced banana. Cut into squares and serve.Photographer: Victor Protasio / Food Styling: Julian Hensarling / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong

========================================

Title: Caramel-Apple Brandy Cheesecake
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/caramel-apple-brandy-cheesecake-recipe-11796463
Ingredients:
- 1cupgraham cracker crumbs(14 graham cracker squares)
- 1/2cuptoastedpecans, finely chopped, plus more for serving
- 1/4cupbutter, melted
- 2tablespoonsplus1/4cup packedbrown sugar, divided
- 2 1/2teaspoonsapple pie spice, divided
- 1/4cupbutter
- 4mediumapples, peeled and thinly sliced
- 3(8-ounce) packagescream cheese, softened
- 3/4cupwhite sugar
- 2tablespoonsapple brandy
- 3largeeggs
- high-qualitycaramel sauce
Instructions:
1. Stir together graham cracker crumbs, pecans, 1/4 cup melted butter, 2 tablespoons brown sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon apple pie spice in a medium bowl until combined. Press into bottom and 1 inch up sides of a 9-inch springform pan.
2. Melt 1/4 cup butter in a very large skillet over medium heat. Add apples; cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 1/2 cup brown sugar and 2 teaspoons apple pie spice. Let cool. (Note: There will be free liquid present.)
3. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Beat cream cheese, white sugar, and apple brandy in a large bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed until smooth. Beat in eggs until just combined. Pour half of cream cheese mixture into crust. Spoon half of apple mixture with any juices over cream cheese mixture. Repeat with remaining cream cheese mixture and apple mixture. Gently swirl apples with a spoon to expose cream cheese mixture. Place cheesecake in a shallow baking pan.
4. Bake in the preheated oven for 50 to 60 minutes, or until outer edge of cheesecake is set and slightly puffed, just the center jiggles, and an instant-read thermometer inserted into center registers 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).
5. Cool cheesecake in pan on a wire rack 15 minutes. Run tip of a knife around edges of pan. Remove pan sides and let cheesecake cool on rack to room temperature, about 1 hour. Chill until completely cool, at least 4 hours (or up to overnight). Serve slices with caramel sauce and additional pecans. (To store, chill cheesecake, covered, up to 3 days.)

========================================

Title: Apple Whoopie Pies
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/apple-whoopie-pies-recipe-11796455
Ingredients:
- 1cup packedbrown sugar
- 3/4cupunsweetened applesauce
- 1/2cupvegetable oil
- 1largeegg
- 1/2teaspoonvanilla extract
- 1 3/4cupsall-purposeflour
- 1/2teaspoonsalt
- 1/2teaspoonbaking powder
- 1/2teaspoonbaking soda
- 1/2teaspoonapple pie spice
- 1/2cupfinely chopped unpeeled red bakingapple
- marshmallow-apple spice buttercream(recipe below)
Instructions:
1. Arrange racks in upper and lower thirds of oven; preheat to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line 2 (10x15-inch) rimmed baking sheets with parchment paper.
2. Stir together brown sugar, applesauce, oil, egg, and vanilla in a large bowl. Mix with an electric mixer at low speed until combined. Add flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, and apple pie spice. Beat until just combined. Fold in apple.
3. Working in batches as needed, drop dough on prepared baking sheets using a 1 1/2-tablespoons scoop, spacing 2 inches apart.
4. Bake in the preheated oven until cookies are set and lightly browned on edges, 10 to 12 minutes. Transfer to wire racks to cool completely, about 30 minutes.
5. Spoon marshmallow-apple spice buttercream into a zip-top plastic bag. Snip off a corner of bag. Turn half of cookies upside down; pipe about 1 1/2 tablespoons buttercream onto each. Top with remaining cookies to form sandwiches. (To store, chill unfilled cookies in a single layer in an airtight container up to 3 days or freeze up to 3 months. Fill cookie sandwiches just before serving.)Marshmallow-Apple Spice ButtercreamBeat 1/2 cup softened butter in a medium bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed 30 seconds. Beat in 1 (7-ounce) container marshmallow creme, 2 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1/2 teaspoon apple pie spice, and a pinch of salt until fluffy. Beat in 1 1/2 cupspowdered sugar. Makes about 1 1/2 cups.

Title: Copycat Orange Dreamsicle Frosty
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/copycat-orange-dreamsicle-frosty-recipe-11770412
Ingredients:
- 1cupfreshly-squeezedorange juice
- 1cupwhipped creamor whipped topping
- 2tablespoonssweetened condensed milk
- 1teaspoonvanilla extract
Instructions:
1. Pour orange juice into ice cube trays and freeze until solid, about 3 hours.
2. Place orange ice cubes, whipped cream, sweetened condensed milk, and vanilla in a blender and blend until smooth, thick, and creamy. Serve immediately.

Title: Banana Bread Rice Pudding
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/banana-bread-rice-pudding-recipe-11789156
Ingredients:
- 1teaspoonground cinnamon, plus more for garnish
- 5tablespoonslight brown sugar, divided
- 4tablespoonsunsalted butter, divided
- 2mediumbananas, sliced into 1/4-inch rounds
- 1/4cupchopped walnuts
- 1 1/2cupscookedwhite short-grain rice(such as Arborio or sushi rice)
- 1/2teaspoonkosher salt
- 1/2teaspoonground nutmeg
- 2cupswhole milk, divided
- 1largeegg yolk
- 1/2teaspoonvanilla extract
- maple syrup (optional)
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Photographer: Morgan Hunt Ward / Food Styling: Margaret Monroe Dickey / Prop Styling: Josh Hoggle
2. Combine cinnamon, 3 tablespoons of the brown sugar, and 2 tablespoons of the butter in a large skillet. Cook over low, whisking constantly, until sauce is well combined, 1 to 2 minutes.Photographer: Morgan Hunt Ward / Food Styling: Margaret Monroe Dickey / Prop Styling: Josh Hoggle
3. Place bananas in an even layer directly over sauce. Cook over medium-low, flipping and stirring banana slices once halfway through, until bananas are golden brown and softened, about 6 minutes total.Photographer: Morgan Hunt Ward / Food Styling: Margaret Monroe Dickey / Prop Styling: Josh Hoggle
4. Set aside 1/2 cup of the banana mixture in a small bowl; stir in walnuts.Photographer: Morgan Hunt Ward / Food Styling: Margaret Monroe Dickey / Prop Styling: Josh Hoggle
5. Mash banana mixture in skillet with a potato masher, over medium-low, until thick and mostly smooth, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in rice, salt, nutmeg, 1 1/2 cups of the milk, and remaining 2 tablespoons brown sugar. Cook over medium heat, stirring often, until thickened and most of the liquid is absorbed, about 5 minutes.Photographer: Morgan Hunt Ward / Food Styling: Margaret Monroe Dickey / Prop Styling: Josh Hoggle
6. Whisk together egg yolk and remaining 1/2 cup milk in a small bowl until well combined. Stirring constantly, slowly drizzle into egg mixture. Cook, stirring constantly, until pudding has thickened slightly and an instant-read thermometer reaches 165 degrees F (73 degrees C), about 2 minutes. Remove skillet from heat; stir in vanilla and remaining 2 tablespoons butter until creamy and glossy, 1 to 2 minutes.Photographer: Morgan Hunt Ward / Food Styling: Margaret Monroe Dickey / Prop Styling: Josh Hoggle
7. Divide pudding evenly between 2 bowls and top each bowl with 1/4 cup of the reserved banana mixture. Serve with maple syrup, and garnish with cinnamon just before serving, if desired. Serve warm, or let cool completely to room temperature before chilling overnight to serve cold.Photographer: Morgan Hunt Ward / Food Styling: Margaret Monroe Dickey / Prop Styling: Josh HoggleRecipe developed by Giovanna Vazquez.

========================================

Title: The 15 Easiest Pumpkin Desserts You’ll Ever Make
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/easiest-pumpkin-desserts-11808961
Ingredients:
Instructions:

========================================

Title: Pineapple Coconut Dream Cake
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/pineapple-coconut-dream-cake-recipe-11772684
Ingredients:
- cooking spray
- 3(20 ounce) canscrushed pineapple with juice, divided
- 1(13.25 ounce) packageyellow cake mix
- 1/2cupunsalted butter,melted
- 3largeeggs
- 1 1/4cupsshreddedsweetened coconut, toasted, divided
- 1tablespoonwhite sugar
- 1(3.4 ounce) packagevanilla instant pudding
- 1(8 ounce) containerfrozenwhipped topping,such as Cool Whip®, thawed
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Coat the bottom of a 13x9-inch baking pan with cooking spray. Set aside.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Giovana Vazquez / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
2. Drain crushed pineapple, reserving juice. Whisk together cake mix, butter, eggs, and 1 cup  pineapple juice in a large bowl until mixture just combined, about 1 minute. Fold in 3/4 cup coconut. Pour batter into the prepared baking pan, and spread into an even layer.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Giovana Vazquez / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
3. Bake in the preheated oven until a wooden pick inserted in center of cake comes out clean, about 20 minutes. Transfer pan to a wire rack, and let cool slightly, about 30 minutes.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Giovana Vazquez / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
4. Meanwhile, stir together sugar and 1/3 cup pineapple juice in a small, heatproof bowl; microwave on High until sugar is dissolved, about 60 seconds. Set aside until ready to use.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Giovana Vazquez / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
5. Whisk together pudding mix and 1/4 cup pineapple juice in a large bowl until smooth. Stir in 3 cups crushed pineapple.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Giovana Vazquez / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
6. Poke holes into cake using a fork. Drizzle sugar-pineapple juice mixture evenly over cake. Spread pudding mixture in an even layer over cake. Chill cake uncovered until pudding mixture is slightly firm, at least 30 minutes or up to overnight.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Giovana Vazquez / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
7. Spoon whipped topping over the pudding layer and spread into an even layer. Top with remaining 1/2 cup coconut and 1/2 cup crushed pineapple.From the EditorHere's all you need to know totoast coconut.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Giovana Vazquez / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong

Title: 16 Bright and Citrusy Dessert Recipes Made With Lemonade

Ingredients:
Instructions:

========================================

Title: Fresh Cherry Crumb Bars
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/fresh-cherry-crumb-bars-recipe-11792744
Ingredients:
- 4cupsfresh cherries, pitted
- 1/2cupwhite sugar
- 2tablespoonslemon juice
- 2tablespoonscornstarch
- 1/2teaspoonlemon zest
- 2cupsall-purpose flour
- 1/2cupfirmly packedbrown sugar
- 1/2cupwhite sugar
- 3/4teaspoonbaking powder
- 1/2teaspoonsalt
- 1/4teaspoonground cinnamon
- 1/4teaspoonground nutmeg
- 3/4cupunsalted butter,melted
- 1 1/2teaspoonsvanilla extract
- 1/2teaspoonalmond extract
Instructions:
1. For filling, place cherries and sugar in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring often, until cherries are softened and release their juices, about 10 minutes.
2. In a small bowl, stir lemon juice and cornstarch together until combined. Gradually pour cornstarch slurry into cherries, stirring constantly. Stir in lemon zest. Continue to cook and stir until mixture is thickened, 1 to 2 minutes more. Remove from heat, and allow to cool completely.
3. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Line a 9x9-inch square pan with enough parchment to have overhang on all sides.
4. For crust and topping, whisk flour, brown sugar, white sugar, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg together in a large bowl until combined. Pour in melted butter, vanilla, and almond extract and mix with a fork until mixture is thoroughly moistened, combined, and somewhat crumbly.
5. Pour about 2 cups of crumb mixture into the prepared pan. Press mixture firmly and evenly into the bottom of the pan. Pour cooled cherry filling over crust, and spread into an even layer. Sprinkle remaining crumb mixture evenly over the cherries.
6. Bake in the preheated oven until edges of bars begin to brown, 30 to 40 minutes. Cool completely in the pan, about 1 hour. Remove using the parchment overhang and cut into 16 bars.

========================================

Title: Orange Creamsicle Bars
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/orange-creamsicle-bars-recipe-11776011
Ingredients:
- 1 1/2cupsfinely groundgraham cracker crumbs
- 1tablespoonfirmly packedbrown sugar
- 1pinchsalt
- 6tablespoonsunsalted butter,melted
- 1cupheavy cream,chilled
- 3tablespoonsconfectioner's sugar
- 1 3/4teaspoonsvanilla extract, divided
- 1(0.25 ounce) packetunflavoredpowdered gelatin
- 1/2cupfreshly squeezedorange juice,divided
- 2(8 ounce) packagescream cheese
- 1(14 ounce) cansweetened condensed milk
- 1tablespoonfreshly squeezedlemon juice
- 1pinchsalt
- 1tablespoonfinely gratedorange zest
- 1/2teaspoonfinely gratedlemon zest
- 2dropsorange food coloring, optional
Instructions:
1. Line a 9x9-inch square pan with enough parchment paper to have overhang on all sides.
2. In a small bowl, stir graham cracker crumbs, brown sugar, and salt together until combined. Add in melted butter and stir until mixture resembles wet sand. Pour crust mixture into the prepared pan and press firmly and evenly into the bottom of the pan. Place crust into the freezer to chill while you make the filling.
3. In a large bowl, beat heavy cream, powdered sugar, and 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract with an electric mixer until mixture holds stiff peaks; refrigerate until needed.
4. Place gelatin into a small microwave-safe bowl. Pour 1/4 cup orange juice over gelatin and allow it to bloom for 5 minutes.
5. Meanwhile, place cream cheese, condensed milk, remaining 1/4 cup orange juice, lemon juice, remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract, and salt into the cup of a high speed blender. Blend ingredients on high speed until thoroughly smooth and combined, stopping to scrape down the sides as needed, 1 to 2 minutes.
6. Heat bloomed gelatin in the microwave until melted, about 30 seconds. Stir gelatin until thoroughly mixed and dissolved. With the blender running, pour melted gelatin into the cream mixture and continue to blend on High speed until thoroughly incorporated, about 30 seconds.
7. Remove whipped cream from the refrigerator. Pour cream cheese mixture over whipped cream and fold until thoroughly combined.
8. Remove crust from the freezer. Pour half of filling mixture over chilled crust; smooth into an even layer. Place pan back into the freezer until filling just begins to set, about 15 minutes.
9. To the remaining filling, add orange zest, lemon zest, and orange food coloring. Fold together until evenly combined.
10. Remove the pan from the freezer and carefully pour the orange layer over cream layer. Spread orange layer evenly over cream layer, making sure to cover completely. Refrigerate in the pan until bars are set, at least 4 hours to overnight.
11. To serve, lift bars out of the pan using the parchment paper. Carefully peel the parchment paper off, and cut into 16 bars. If desired, serve topped with an extra dollop of whipped cream and a small slice of orange. Store bars in the refrigerator.

========================================

Title: Toaster Pastry Cookies
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/toaster-pastry-cookies-recipe-11775434
Ingredients:
- 1/2cupbutter,softened
- 1cupwhite sugar
- 1/2teaspoonbaking powder
- 1/4teaspoonbaking soda
- 1/4teaspoonsalt
- 1/2cupsour cream
- 1largeegg
- 1/2teaspoonvanilla extract
- 2 2/3cupsall-purpose flour
- 1/4cupsoftenedbutter
- 1/2cup packeddark brown sugar
- 4teaspoonsall-purpose flour
- 1/2teaspoonground cinnamon
- 1/8teaspoonsalt
- 1cupconfectioner'ssugar
- 1tablespoonmilk, plus more as needed
- 1/4teaspoonvanilla extract
- food coloring
- sprinkles or sanding sugar
Instructions:
1. Beat butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed 30 seconds. Beat in sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Beat in sour cream, egg, and vanilla. Beat in as much flour as you can with the mixer. Stir in remaining flour. Divide dough in half. Chill, covered, until easy to handle, 1 to 2 hours.
2. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
3. On a well-floured work surface, roll half of dough at a time to 1/8-inch thickness. Cut out squares with a 2-inch cookie cutter. Place half of squares on ungreased cookie sheets.
4. Prepare Brown Sugar-Cinnamon filling (or prepare desired filling from Cook's Note, below). Beat butter in a small bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed 30 seconds. Add dark brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, and salt. Beat until combined.
5. Spoon 1/2 teaspoon filling onto center of each. Top with remaining squares. Seal edges using floured fork tines.
6. Bake until edges are firm and bottoms are very lightly browned, 6 to 8 minutes. Transfer cookies to a wire rack; cool.
7. For glaze, whisk confectioner's sugar, milk, and vanilla extract together in a small bowl. For brown sugar-cinnamon variation, add a dash of ground cinnamon.
8. Tint glaze with a few drops of food coloring as desired; spread on cooled cookies, leaving a 1/2-inch border. Add desired sprinkles or sanding sugar. Let stand until set.Cook’s NoteVariationsWild BerryFor filling, bring 1 cup frozen mixed berries to a simmer in a small saucepan over medium heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, mashing occasionally, until softened, about 2 minutes. Stir together 1/4 cup sugar and 1 tablespoon cornstarch in a small bowl; add to berry mixture. Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened and bubbly, about 5 minutes (mixture will go from cloudy to translucent, and purple color will deepen once starch is fully cooked). Transfer mixture to a small bowl; chill until fully cooled, about 30 minutes. Tint 1/3 of glaze teal and tint remaining glaze purple. Spread cookies with purple glaze and drizzle with teal glaze.StrawberryFor filling, simmer 1 cup chopped strawberries in a small saucepan over medium heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, mashing occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir together 1/4 cup sugar and 1 tablespoon cornstarch in a small bowl; stir into strawberries. Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened, about 5 minutes (mixture will go from cloudy to translucent, and red color will deepen once starch is fully cooked). Transfer mixture to a bowl; chill until cooled, about 30 minutes. Spread pastries with untinted glaze.Hot Fudge SundaeFor dough, in Step 1, reduce flour to 2 1/2 cups. Add 2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder to dough along with flour.For filling, beat 4 ounces softened cream cheese in a small bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed 30 seconds. Add 1/4 cup powdered sugar and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Beat until smooth. Spread cookies with untinted glaze and drizzle with hot fudge ice cream topping.

Title: Birthday Cake Dip
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/birthday-cake-dip-recipe-11803153
Ingredients:
- 1(8-ounce) packagecream cheese, softened
- 1(3.4-ounce) packagevanilla or cheesecake instant pudding mix
- 2/3cupmilk
- 1(8-ounce) tubfrozen whipped dessert topping, thawed
- 1/4cupmulticolored sprinkles(such as rainbow jimmies), divided
- animal crackers, graham crackers, strawberries or apple wedges for dipping
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Photographer: Jake Sternquist / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Kristen Schooley
2. Combine cream cheese, instant pudding mix and milk in a large bowl and beat with an electric mixer until smooth and thickened, about 1 minute.Photographer: Jake Sternquist / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Kristen SchooleyFold in one-third of the whipped topping to lighten the mixture. Fold in remaining whipped topping.Photographer: Jake Sternquist / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Kristen Schooley
3. Gently fold 1/4 cup sprinkles into the mixture. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.Photographer: Jake Sternquist / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Kristen Schooley
4. Garnish with additional sprinkles. Serve with animal crackers, graham crackers, strawberries or apple wedges.Photographer: Jake Sternquist / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Kristen Schooley

Title: The 15-Minute No-Bake Bars That Taste 'Just Like a PB&J!'
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/no-bake-pb-and-j-bars-recipe-11806533
Ingredients:
- 3 1/2cupsminipretzels
- 1/4cupwhitesugar
- 9tablespoonsunsalted butter,melted
- 1/4teaspoonkosher salt
- 1(8 ounce) packagecream cheese, at room temperature
- 1cupcreamy peanut butter
- 1cupconfectioner's sugar
- 1/4teaspoonkosher salt
- 1(8 ounce) containerfrozen whipped topping, thawed, such as Cool Whip®
- 1(13 ounce) jarstrawberry preserves
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Photographer: Stacy k. Allen / Food Styling: Julia Levy / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
2. For pretzel crust, process pretzels in a food processor until small crumbs form, 15 to 30 seconds. Add sugar, butter, and salt; pulse until evenly combined, about 5 pulses.Photographer: Stacy k. Allen / Food Styling: Julia Levy / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
3. Transfer pretzel mixture to an 8-inch square baking dish, and press firmly into an even layer. Chill, uncovered, until firm, about 10 minutes.Photographer: Stacy k. Allen / Food Styling: Julia Levy / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
4. For peanut butter filling, beat cream cheese, peanut butter, confectioner's sugar, and salt in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed until smooth and creamy, 1 to 2 minutes, stopping to scrape down sides of bowl as needed.Photographer: Stacy k. Allen / Food Styling: Julia Levy / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
5. Fold in whipped topping until evenly distributed, about 1 minute. Spread filling evenly over cooled crust.Photographer: Stacy k. Allen / Food Styling: Julia Levy / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
6. Spread strawberry preserves evenly over filling.Photographer: Stacy k. Allen / Food Styling: Julia Levy / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
7. Cover and chill until set, at least 4 hours or up to 12 hours. Slice into 9 equal portions and serve chilled.Photographer: Stacy k. Allen / Food Styling: Julia Levy / Prop Styling: Abby ArmstrongRecipe developed by Amanda Holstein

========================================

Title: My Mum's Cranberry Summer Pudding Is the Star of Our Holiday
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/mum-s-summer-pudding-recipe-11811313
Ingredients:
- 6ouncescranberries, fresh or frozen
- 1/4cupdarkmaple syrup
- 1/4cupwhitesugar
- 1/4cupwater
- 12ouncesfrozenberry mix
- 8ouncesfreshblackberries(optional)
- 8sliceswhite bread, crusts removed, or more as needed
- 1cupheavy cream
- 2tablespoonsdarkmaple syrup
- 1/4teaspoonground ginger
- 1pinchsalt
- pomegranate seeds,for garnish (optional)
Instructions:
1. Line a 7 to 8-inch pudding bowl with plastic wrap so there is overhang on all sides. Set aside.
2. Add cranberries, 1/4 cup maple syrup, sugar, and water to a saucepan, set over medium heat, and bring to a simmer. Simmer for 10 minutes, then add frozen berries and blackberries. Keep the heat on low to medium until all the fruit is soft and you have lots of juice in the pan, about 10 minutes more.
3. Strain juice into a large bowl. Set fruit aside.
4. If you’re in a rush here and need the dessert to be ready in under 4 hours, check the footnotes  before the next step.
5. Dip 1 side of bread in fruit juices for 2 seconds and start lining the bowl with dipped slices, with some overlap, and the dipped side facing out.
6. Once the entire bowl is covered with bread - you don’t want any gaps! - pour in the fruit and cover the top of the bowl with a couple more dipped bread slices. Wrap the plastic wrap overhang over the top and place a plate with something heavy on top of the bowl. Place in the fridge for at least 4 hours or up to 24 hours to set.
7. Just before serving, whip cream with 2 tablespoons maple syrup, ground ginger, and a pinch of salt. Turn the bowl out onto a serving dish, and use plastic wrap to ease the pudding  out of the dish. It should be a bright pink dome. Cut slices from the dome and serve with whipped cream, and any extra juice you have left. Sprinkle with pomegranate seeds for garnish.Peyton BeckwithCook’s NoteIf you are hoping to chill for only 4 hours, dip both sides of the bread, 1 second each side.If you prefer a cinnamon whipped cream, just switch the ground ginger out for the same amount  of cinnamon.

Title: Maple Streusel Cake
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/maple-streusel-cake-recipe-11814593
Ingredients:
- 1 cup plus 3tablespoonsunsalted butter
- 1cupall-purpose flour
- 3/4cupfirmly packedbrown sugar
- 1 1/2teaspoonsground cinnamon
- 1/8teaspoonground nutmeg
- 1/8teaspoonsalt
- 1/2teaspoonmaple extract
- 2/3cupfirmly packedbrown sugar
- 1teaspoonsalt
- 1/2teaspoonground cinnamon
- 1/4teaspoonground nutmeg
- 2largeeggs, at room temperature
- 1/2cuppuremaple syrup
- 1cupfull fatplain Greek yogurt,at room temperature
- 1teaspoonvanilla extract
- 1teaspoonmaple extract
- 1 1/2cupsall-purpose flour
- 1teaspoonbaking powder
- 1/4teaspoonbaking soda
Instructions:
1. Place butter into a light-colored saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring constantly, until butter begins to smell nutty and browned bits begin to form in the bottom of the pan, 7 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat and pour browned butter into a heat-safe glass measuring cup. This should yield approximately 1 cup browned butter (it's ok if it's slightly more). Allow to cool for 15 minutes.
2. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Line an 8x8-inch square cake pan with enough parchment paper to have overhang on all sides.
3. For topping, stir flour, brown sugar, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt together in a small bowl until thoroughly combined. Add 1/2 cup browned butter and maple extract. Mix together with a fork until crumbly and no dry bits of flour remain. Set aside.
4. For cake, combine remaining 1/2 cup browned butter, brown sugar,salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a large bowl. Whisk together until combined. Add eggs, maple syrup, Greek yogurt, vanilla, and maple extract and whisk until completely smooth and combined. Add flour, baking powder, and baking soda and mix until just incorporated and no large pockets of flour remain.
5. Pour batter into the prepared pan and spread into an even layer. Tap pan on the counter several times to pop any larger air bubbles in the batter. Sprinkle crumb mixture evenly over cake batter.
6. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out with a few moist crumbs, 40 to 50 minutes. Cool cake in the pan for 10 minutes, then lift out using the parchment overhang to a wire rack to cool completely.

Title: S’Mores Pie
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/s-mores-pie-recipe-recipe-11791515
Ingredients:
- 1 recipeGraham Cracker Crust
- 1(5.9-ounce) boxchocolate instant pudding and pie filling mix
- 2 1/2cupshalf and half
- 2teaspoonsvanilla extract
- 1(7-ounce) containermarshmallow creme
- semisweet chocolate shavings
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Lexi Juhl
2. Follow directions for theGraham Cracker Crustrecipe using a deep-dish broiler-safe pie plate. Reserve 2 tablespoons of the crust mixture for garnish.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Lexi Juhl
3. Prepare pudding mix according to package directions using the half-and-half, and adding vanilla. Add pudding to cooled crust.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Lexi Juhl
4. Cover and chill at least 4 and up to 24 hours.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Lexi Juhl
5. Spread marshmallow creme over the chilled pudding.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Lexi Juhl
6. Use a culinary torch to toast the marshmallow creme, or place 4 to 6 inches beneath a preheated broiler. Broil until lightly toasted, 30 to 60 seconds.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Lexi Juhl
7. Garnish with reserved graham cracker crust mixture and chocolate shavings, if desired.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Lexi Juhl

Title: Strawberry Churro Roll Ups
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/strawberry-churro-roll-ups-recipe-11768320
Ingredients:
- 12slicesHawaiian, brioche, or white sandwich bread
- 6tablespoonscream cheese, softened (3 ounces)
- 1/4cupstrawberry jelly
- 2largeeggs
- 2tablespoonsmilk
- 1/4cupsugar
- 1teaspoonground cinnamon
- 2tablespoonssalted butter
- strawberry syrup (optional)
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Photographer: Jacob Fox / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Natalie Ghazali
2. Trim crusts from bread and flatten each slice with a rolling pin until about 1/8-inch thick.Photographer: Jacob Fox / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Natalie Ghazali
3. Place 1 1/2 teaspoons of cream cheese and 1 teaspoon of jelly on one bread slice in a straight line about 1-inch away from one side of the bread.Photographer: Jacob Fox / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Natalie Ghazali
4. Starting with the side closest to the filling, roll the bread up and set aside, seam side down. Repeat with remaining bread, cream cheese, and jelly.Photographer: Jacob Fox / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Natalie Ghazali
5. In a shallow bowl whisk together eggs and milk. In another shallow bowl combine sugar and cinnamon.Photographer: Jacob Fox / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Natalie Ghazali
6. Melt 1 tablespoon of the butter in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over low heat, Coat bread rolls in egg mixture. Place 6 roll-ups in skillet, seam side down and cook until golden brown on all sides, turning occasionally, 4 to 5 minutes. Repeat with remaining butter and roll-ups.Photographer: Jacob Fox / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Natalie Ghazali
7. Transfer warm roll-ups to cinnamon-sugar mixture and roll to coat.Photographer: Jacob Fox / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Natalie Ghazali
8. Serve with strawberry syrup, if desired.Photographer: Jacob Fox / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Natalie Ghazali

Title: Krispy Kreme Banana Pudding
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/krispy-kreme-banana-pudding-recipe-11765910
Ingredients:
- 2(3.4 ounce) boxesinstant Frenchvanilla pudding mix
- 2cupsmilk
- 1(8 ounce) packagecream cheese, softened
- 1(14 ounce) cancondensed milk
- 16ounceswhipped topping
- 12donuts, cut into 1-inch pieces
- 5bananas,sliced, or more as needed
Instructions:
1. Prepare pudding according to package directions and set aside.
2. Combine cream cheese and condensed milk in a separate bowl, and beat using a hand mixer until smooth.
3. Add pudding to the cream cheese mixture and stir until well combined.
4. Layer half of pudding mixture in a 9x13 dish, then add a layer of bananas and half of donuts. Pour remaining pudding mixture over bananas and donuts, then top with whipped topping and remaining donuts. Keep refrigerated until ready to serve.Peyton Beckwith

Title: Apple Pie Cinnamon Roll Bubble Up
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/apple-pie-cinnamon-roll-bubble-up-recipe-11812020
Ingredients:
- 2(8 ounce) cansrefrigerated cinnamon rolls, such asGrands!® cinnamon rolls
- 1/4cupheavy cream
- 1cupapple pie filling
- 4tablespoonsmeltedbutter
- 1/2cupall-purpose flour
- 1/2cupbrown sugar
- 1/4cupquick oats
- 1teaspoonground cinnamon
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Cut cinnamon rolls into quarters.
2. Pour heavy cream into a pie dish and add cinnamon rolls on top.
3. Add apple pie filling over the top of cinnamon rolls.
4. In a small mixing bowl, combine melted butter, flour, brown sugar, and oats together until mixture is dry and crumbly. Crumble evenly on top of apple pie filling.
5. Bake in the preheated oven until lightly golden, puffed, and bubbly, 45 to 50 minutes.
6. Drizzle with icing from cinnamon rolls can before serving.Peyton Beckwith

Title: Easy Pumpkin Cheesecake Crescent Bars
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/easy-pumpkin-cheesecake-crescent-bars-recipe-11810022
Ingredients:
- cooking spray
- 2(8 ounce) packagescream cheese, softened
- 1cupwhitesugar
- 2largeeggs
- 1cuppumpkin puree
- 2teaspoonspumpkin pie spice
- 2(8 ounce) cansrefrigeratedcrescent rolls
- 1largeegg white
- 1tablespoonwater
- 3/4cupconfectioners sugar
- 2tablespoonsmilk
- 1teaspoonvanilla extract
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch pan with cooking spray.
2. Beat cream cheese in a bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. Add white sugar and egg and beat until smooth. Beat in pumpkin and pumpkin spice.
3. Lay 1 package crescent roll dough in the prepared pan and pinch openings together. Pour cream cheese filling over dough and spread until smooth with a spatula.
4. Carefully roll out the remaining package crescent roll dough over filling. Pinch openings together.
5. Whisk egg white and water together in a small bowl. Using a pastry brush, spread the mixture over the top of crust.
6. Bake until a toothpick poked into the center comes out clean, 40 to 45 minutes.
7. For glaze, whisk confectioner's sugar, milk, and vanilla together in a bowl until smooth. Let the cake cool for 20 minutes, then drizzle with glaze. Serve warm or cold.

========================================

Title: Danish Dream Cake
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/danish-dream-cake-recipe-11792855
Ingredients:
- 1/2cupunsalted butter
- 3/4cupwhole milk
- 3largeeggs, at room temperature
- 1cupwhite sugar
- 3/4teaspoonsalt
- 1/4teaspoonground nutmeg
- 1 1/2teaspoonsvanilla extract
- 1/2teaspoonalmond extract
- 1 1/2cupsall-purpose flour
- 1 1/2teaspoonsbaking powder
- 5tablespoonsunsalted butter
- 1/4cupwhole milk
- 1/2cupfirmly packed brown sugar
- 1pinchsalt
- 1pinchground nutmeg
- 1cupunsweetened shredded coconut
- 1/2teaspoonvanilla extract
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Line an 8x8-inch square pan with enough parchment to have overhang on all sides.
2. For cake, place butter and milk in a microwave-safe bowl. Cook, stirring often, until butter is melted and mixture is hot, 2 to 2 1/2 minutes.
3. Add eggs, white sugar, salt, and nutmeg to a large bowl, and beat with an electric mixer on medium-high speed until mixture has lightened in color and tripled in volume, 3 to 5 minutes. Add in vanilla extract and almond extract and beat until combined. Add flour and baking powder and mix on low speed until nearly incorporated, but some dry bits of flour still remain. With mixer running on low speed, gradually pour in hot butter-milk mixture and beat until incorporated. Pour batter into the prepared pan.
4. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, 35 to 45 minutes.
5. Meanwhile, for topping, place butter, milk, brown sugar, salt and nutmeg into a high-sided microwave-safe bowl. Cook, stirring after every 1 minute, until sugar is dissolved and mixture is bubbling, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from the microwave and stir in coconut flakes and vanilla.
6. Remove cake from the oven and preheat the oven's broiler. Carefully pour topping over the hot cake, and gently spread into an even layer, covering the top of the cake.
7. Place cake under the broiler; broil until topping is bubbling and slightly browned, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove cake from the oven; cool in the pan for about 15 minutes, then use parchment overhang to remove to a wire rack to cool completely.

========================================

Title: Caramel Apple Cinnamon Rolls
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/caramel-apple-cinnamon-rolls-recipe-11793041
Ingredients:
- 3/4cupwhole milk
- 1/4cupwater
- 4cupsbread flouror all-purpose flour
- 1/3cupwhitesugar
- 1(0.25 ounce) packageactivedry yeast
- 1teaspoonsalt
- 2largeeggs, lightlybeaten
- 1/3cupbutter,melted
- 2/3cup packedbrown sugar
- 1 1/2teaspoonsground cinnamon
- 2/3cuphigh-qualitycaramel sauce,such as Mrs. Richardson's®, warmed, plus 1/2 cup for drizzling
- 1apple, peeled and finely chopped
Instructions:
1. Stir together milk and water in a glass measuring cup. Microwave mixture until it reaches 105 to 115 degrees F (40 to 46 degrees C), 30 to 60 seconds.
2. Whisk together 2 cups flour, sugar, yeast, and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Add eggs, melted butter, and milk mixture. Beat at low speed until combined. Beat at high speed 15 seconds. Switch to dough hook attachment. Add remaining 2 cups flour, 1/2 cup at a time, mixing until a soft dough forms and begins to pull away from sides of bowl, 3 to 5 minutes—dough will be sticky. Transfer dough to a lightly greased bowl, turning to coat. Chill, covered, until dough is easy to handle, at least 2 hours or up to overnight.
3. Grease 2 (9 inch) round cake pans or 2 (8 inch) square baking pans. Stir together brown sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl; set aside. Punch down dough. Divide dough in half. Roll one portion of dough on a lightly floured surface into a 6x16-inch rectangle. If dough springs back when rolling, cover and let rest for 5 to 10 minutes, then try rolling again. Spread 1/3 cup caramel sauce over rolled-out dough portion; sprinkle with half the cinnamon-sugar and apples.
4. Starting on a long side, roll up dough to form a log; pinch seam to seal. Slice dough log into 8 (2-inch-thick) pieces. Put rolls, cut sides down, in one of the prepared pans. Repeat with remaining dough, 1/3 cup caramel sauce, cinnamon-sugar, and apples. Let rolls rise, covered, in a warm place until nearly double in size, about 30 minutes.
5. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
6. Bake rolls in the preheated oven until golden brown, 20 to 24 minutes. Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Drizzle rolls with 1/2 cup caramel sauce and serve warm.Make 'Em MiniPrepare as directed, except in Step 4, slice each dough log into 16 (1-inch-thick) pieces. Bake rolls until golden brown, 17 to 22 minutes. Cool and serve as directed.Recipe TipIf you like, substitute 2 (1 pound) packages frozen bread dough, thawed, for the homemade dough and skip ahead to Step 3.

Title: Copycat Cracker Barrel Fried Apples
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/copycat-cracker-barrel-fried-apples-recipe-11808171
Ingredients:
- 6tablespoonsbutter
- 4Golden delicious apples, sliced, or more as needed
- 2teaspoonsground cinnamon
- 1/2cupwhite sugar
- 1/2cupcoldwater
- 1 1/2tablespoonscornstarch
Instructions:
1. Melt butter in a deep skillet over medium-high heat.
2. Add apples, cinnamon and sugar and stir until well coated in sugar mixture,. Bring mixture to a simmer. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook, covered until apples are very tender, about 20 minutes.
3. Whisk together cold water and cornstarch until dissolved. Stir cornstarch mixture into apple mixture and return to a simmer. Cook until thickened, about 2 minutes; remove from heat.Peyton Beckwith

========================================

Title: Crinkle Cake with Apples and Camembert
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/crinkle-cake-with-apples-and-camembert-recipe-11775476
Ingredients:
- 1(16 ounce) packagefrozenphyllo dough, thawed
- 1cupbutter, melted
- 1(8 ounce) wheelCamembert cheese
- 3/4cupmilk
- 2largeeggs
- 1teaspoonvanilla extract
- 1/4teaspoonkosher salt
- 1Fuji apple, cored and thinly sliced
- 1teaspoonchoppedfresh thyme
- 1/4cuphoney
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Line a 9x13-inch baking pan with parchment paper.
2. Stack 2 phyllo sheets; starting with a short end, fold accordion-style into a strip, using approximately 1 ½-inch folds. Arrange folded phyllo along a short end of prepared pan. (Keep remaining phyllo covered with a clean, damp kitchen towel while you work.) Repeat stacking and folding with remaining phyllo, evenly spacing strips in the pan.
3. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and drizzle with butter. Continue to bake 10 minutes more.
4. Meanwhile, cut Camembert wheel in half crosswise, leaving rind intact. Slice each half into thin slices, about 1/4 inch thick. Whisk milk, eggs, vanilla, and salt together in a 2-cup measuring cup until combined.
5. Use a small spatula or table knife to separate phyllo layers, tucking apple and Camembert slices into folds, dispersing them evenly between folds. Sprinkle with thyme. Pour egg mixture over top. Bake until top is golden, 35 to 40 minutes.
6. Cool on a wire rack 15 minutes. Drizzle with honey and serve warm.

========================================

Title: Copycat Big Boy Strawberry Pie
Category: dessert
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/copycat-big-boy-strawberry-pie-recipe-11763764
Ingredients:
- 4cupsfresh strawberries
- 1frozenpie crust, baked according to package directions
- 3/4cupwhite sugar
- 3tablespoonscornstarch
- 1cuplemon-lime soda
- 1/2cupwater
- 1(3 ounce) packagestrawberry-flavored gelatin
- whipped cream,for serving
Instructions:
1. Wash, dry, and remove stems from strawberries. Arrange strawberries, tip-side up, in the prepared pie crust. Cut larger strawberries in half if needed to fit evenly. Strawberries should be piled high inside the crust.
2. In a saucepan, whisk together corn starch and sugar. Add lemon-lime soda and water, and whisk to combine.
3. Bring to a boil over medium heat, whisking frequently, until sugar is dissolved and mixture has thickened slightly.
4. Remove from heat and whisk in the strawberry gelatin until fully dissolved.
5. Let the mixture cool slightly, about 5 minutes, then carefully pour over the strawberries in the pie crust, covering evenly.
6. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or until the filling is completely set.
7. Slice and serve chilled. Top with whipped cream.Peyton Beckwith

Title: Coffee Brandy Alexander
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/coffee-brandy-alexander-recipe-11769274
Ingredients:

- 2ouncesstrongbrewed coffee, cooled
- 1ouncebrandy

Instructions:

Title: Big Batch Freezer Margaritas
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/big-batch-freezer-margaritas-recipe-11710790
Ingredients:
- 1litertequila (and bottle)
- 3/4cupfreshlime juice
- 1/2cuptriple sec
- 3tablespoonsagave
- 1/8teaspoonsalt
- ice as neededfor serving
Instructions:
1. Pour 1 1/4 cups tequila from the bottle and reserve for another use.
2. Add lime juice, triple sec, agave, and salt to the bottle of tequila and place top on the bottle. Tilt bottle to lightly shake mixture until agave has been well incorporated.
3. Place bottle in the freezer for at least 8 hours or until ready to serve.
4. To serve, add 1 cup ice to a shaker or glass and top with about 1/2 cup of margarita mix.  Shake mixture or pour margarita between two glasses until well blended and slightly frothy. Serve immediately with more ice if desired. This step is important to balance the taste through slight dilution from the ice.Peyton Beckwith

Title: Passion Fruit Margarita
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/passion-fruit-margarita-recipe-7499354
Ingredients:
- 1tablespooncoarsesalt, or as needed
- 1lime wedge
- 1 1/2cupsice, divided, or as needed
- 5ouncespassion fruit juice(such as Goya®)
- 2fluidouncessilvertequila
- 3/4fluidouncestriple sec
- 3/4fluidounceslime juice
Instructions:
1. Sprinkle salt onto a plate. Moisten the rim of a glass with lime wedge and press the moistened rim into the salt; fill the glass with ice.
2. Fill a cocktail shaker half-full with ice. Add passion fruit juice, tequila, triple sec, and lime juice to the shaker. Seal and shake vigorously until outside is frosted, 10 to 15 seconds. Strain mixture into the glass and stir. Garnish with lime wedge.

Title: Peppermint White Russian
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/peppermint-white-russian-recipe-11811979
Ingredients:
- 1cupvodka
- 15peppermint candies
- peppermint candies,as needed
- marshmallow fluff,as needed
- ice as needed
- 1.5fluid ouncespeppermint vodka
- 1fluid ouncecoffee liqueur
- 1fluid ounceheavy cream
Instructions:
1. For peppermint infusied vodka, add peppermint candies to a pint jar and top with vodka. Place the lid on the jar and shake gently. Cover and let sit for a minimum of 4 hours or overnight.
2. Strain the peppermint vodka infusion into an airtight container. Discard any undissolved peppermints.
3. To prepare the garnish, place a few peppermint candies inside a plastic bag. Crush with a rolling pin into fine pieces.
4. Rim the cocktail glass with marshmallow fluff and dip in crushed peppermint.
5. Add ice to the rimmed glass, then pour in peppermint vodka and coffee liqueur.
6. Using the back of a spoon, slowly pour heavy cream on top to suspend the cream on top of the alcohol.
7. Garnish the top with extra crushed peppermint candies. Enjoy!Peyton BeckwithCook’s NoteCandy canes can be substituted for peppermint candiesStore bought peppermint vodka can be used instead of making the peppermint vodka infusion.From the EditorNutrition data for this recipe includes the full amount of peppermint vodka. The actual amount of vodka consumed will vary.

2. Top with Cava and stir. Garnish with an orange slice or twist.France Cevallos

Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/whipped-vodka-lemonade-recipe-11728056
Ingredients:
- 1/2cuplimoncello cream liqueur
- 1/3cupfreshly squeezedlemon juice
- 1/3cupsweetened condensed milk
- 1/4cupheavy cream
- 2fluid ounceslemon and elderflower vodka
- 2cupsice, or as needed
- vanilla whipped cream(optional)
- lemon zest
- lemon wheels,dried or fresh (optional)
Instructions:
1. Combine limoncello cream, lemon juice, sweetened condensed milk, heavy cream, and lemon & elderflower vodka in a blender. Add ice; blend on Whip or Frozen Cocktail setting until ice is blended.
2. Pour into glasses; garnish with vanilla whipped cream, lemon zest, and dried or fresh lemon wheel.Cook’s NoteIf you prefer 2 stronger cocktails, use 1 cup ice.

Title: State Fair Pickle Lemonade
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/state-fair-pickle-lemonade-recipe-11781666
Ingredients:
- 1lemon, cut into 6 to 8 wedges
- 1dill pickle spear, such as Grillo's®,chopped
- 1/4cupwhite cane sugar
- 1 (32 ounce)pickle container or deli container with lid
- wooden muddler
- ice as needed
- 2cupscoldwater
- 1/4cuppickle juice
- lemon slices or pickle spearsfor garnish (optional)
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
2. Combine lemon wedges, chopped pickle spear, and sugar together in a deli container. Muddle firmly for 1 minute, or until the lemon rinds are broken down and juice is fully extracted. The mixture should be aromatic and syrupy.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
3. Add ice, water, and pickle juice to the muddled mixture. Place lid on the container and shake well.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
4. Insert a straw and enjoy directly from the container, or, strain the mixture through a mesh strainer for a smoother lemonade.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
5. Garnish with a lemon slice and pickle spear. Enjoy!Allrecipes / Qi Ai

Title: Apple Cider Spritz
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/apple-cider-spritz-recipe-11769214
Ingredients:
- 4ouncesprosecco
- 1 1/2ouncesclub soda
- 1⁄2ounceApple Cider Syrup(see Footnote)
- apple slices and cinnamon stick,for garnish
Instructions:
1. Add prosecco and club soda to a glass. Top off with Apple Cider Syrup. Garnish with apple slices and a cinnamon stick.Apple Cider SyrupTie 2 whole cloves, 1 star anise, and 1 small cinnamon stick in cheesecloth to make a spice bag. Place in a large saucepan; add 6 cups apple cider. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium; simmer, uncovered, 30 minutes. Discard spice bag. Simmer until reduced to 3⁄4 cup, about 1 hour. Let cool completely. Chill, covered, until ready to serve (or up to 3 weeks).

Title: Guava Margarita
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/guava-margarita-recipe-7495284
Ingredients:
- 3cupsice, or as needed
- 3lime wedges
- 2tablespoonscoarsesalt, or as needed

- 1 1/2fluid ounces triplesec
- 1 1/2fluidounceslime juice
Instructions:

2. Fill a cocktail shaker half-full with ice. Add tequila, triple sec, and lime juice to the shaker. Seal and shake vigorously until outside is frosted, 10 to 15 seconds. Strain mixture evenly between the glasses and stir. Garnish with remaining lime wedges.

Title: Frozen Peach Bellini
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/frozen-peach-bellini-recipe-11751640
Ingredients:
- 1(16 ounce) bagfrozen peaches
- 1 1/2cupspeach juice,such as Simply Peach®
- 2teaspoonslemon juice, or to taste
- 1tablespoonhoney,or to taste
- 1(750 mL) bottlesparkling wine, chilled
- fresh peach slices, for garnish (optional)
Instructions:
1. Place frozen peaches, peach juice, lemon juice, and honey in the cup of a high speed blender; blend until smooth and combined, stopping to scrape down the sides of the cup as necessary. If mixture is too thick, add more peach juice as needed.
2. Pour into 5 or 6 champagne flutes, filling them each about 1/2 full.
3. Pour sparkling wine over peach mixture in each flute, filling them to just below the top. Carefully stir each bellini to combine. Garnish with a peach slice, if desired. Serve immediately.Cook’s NoteSugar can be used instead of honey.

Title: Red Snapper Cocktail
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/red-snapper-cocktail-recipe-11816669
Ingredients:
- 1teaspooncelery salt, or as needed
- 1lime wedge
- 2cupsice cubes, or as needed
- 2fluid ouncesLondon Drygin
- 1/2fluid ouncefreshly-squeezedlemon juice
- 5dashesTabasco sauce, or to taste
- 3dashesWorcestershire sauce, or to taste
- 1(5.5 ounce) cantomato juice
- 1celery stick, for garnish

Title: Strawberry Matcha Latte
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/strawberry-matcha-latte-recipe-11747561
Ingredients:
- 1/3cupfinely chopped fresh strawberries (about 4 to 5 strawberries)
- 1tablespoonwhite sugar, or to taste
- 1/4cupboilingwater
- 1teaspoonmatcha green tea powder
- ice as needed
- 1/2cupunsweetened vanilla almond milk, or milk of your choice
Instructions:
1. Combine strawberries and sugar in a small bowl. Use a fork to lightly crush and mix (or use a muddler), and spoon into a glass.
2. Whisk boiling water and matcha powder in a bowl or cup until well combined and smooth; set aside.
3. Top crushed strawberries with a handful of ice. Slowly pour milk on top of the strawberry-ice mixture, followed by matcha. Stir and serve with a wide straw.Cook’s NoteThe amount of sugar is dependent on the sweetness of the berries, as well as your personal taste preference. If you’d like the latte to have a stronger matcha flavor, just use more of the powder.

3. Pour lemonade through a fine mesh strainer into a pitcher and discard solids.Allrecipes/Qi Ai
4. Stir in ice and remaining 2 cups of water.Allrecipes/Qi Ai

Title: Coconut Rum Punch
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/coconut-rum-punch-recipe-11695386
Ingredients:

- 2fluid ouncesrum
- 2fluid ouncespineapple coconut juice

- 1lime slice
- 1/3 pineapple ring
Instructions:

Title: Snickerdoodle Protein Shake
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/snickerdoodle-protein-shake-recipe-11702452
Ingredients:
- 1cupwater
- 1cupice
- 1(40 gram) scoopvanilla protein powder
- 1tablespoonsugar free cheesecake flavor pudding mix
- 1tablespoonsugar-free vanilla syrup
- 1/4teaspoonground cinnamon
- 1/4teaspoonbutter flavor extract, such as Watkins®
Instructions:
1. Add water and ice into a high powered blender. Blend on high until combined. Add the remaining ingredients and blend until smooth. Pour into a glass and serve immediately.

========================================

Title: Big Batch Freezer Strawberry Cosmopolitans
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/big-batch-freezer-strawberry-cosmopolitans-recipe-11733218
Ingredients:
- 8ouncesstrawberries, roughly chopped
- 1cupwhitesugar
- 1cupwater, divided
- 1(1 liter) bottlevodka
- 3/4cuporange liqueur,such as Cointreau®
- 1/2cupfreshlime juice
- sliced limes, for garnish
Instructions:
1. Combine strawberries, sugar and 3/4 cup water in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until mixture has thickened slightly and reduced a little, about 10 minutes.
2. Strain strawberry mixture into a jar and discard solids. Let cool completely and refrigerate until ready to use.
3. Pour 1 3/4 cups vodka from bottle and reserve for another use. To the remaining vodka, add 1/2 cup cooled strawberry simple syrup, orange liqueur, lime juice, and remaining 1/4 cup water.  Seal the bottle and tilt it gently to mix the ingredients.
4. Place bottle in freezer for at least 6 hours or until ready to serve.
5. Lightly shake bottle before serving in a martini glass and garnish individual cosmos with a slice of lime if desired.Peyton Beckwith

Ingredients:
Instructions:

Title: Big Batch Espresso Martinis
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/big-batch-espresso-martinis-recipe-11781701
Ingredients:
- 1(750 ml bottle)vodka
- 1cupcoffee liqueur
- 4tablespoonsinstantespresso powder, plus more for garnish
- 2tablespoonssimple syrup
- 1pinchsea salt(optional)
- water, as needed
- iceas needed
- coffee beans for garnish (optional)
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
2. Pour out 1 ¼ cups of the vodka bottle. Reserve poured-out vodka for another use.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
3. Pour 1/2 of the remaining vodka from the bottle into a small saucepan and warm over low heat for 1 to 2 minutes (do not boil). Remove from heat and immediately whisk in the espresso powder until fully dissolved and no lumps remain. Allow the mixture to cool for 5-10 minutes before proceeding.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
4. Add the cooled vodka espresso mixture, coffee liquor, simple syrup, and a pinch of sea salt to the vodka bottle. Cap and shake gently to mix.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
5. Freeze for at least 4 hours before serving. Note: mixture will not fully freeze due to the alcohol content.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
6. To serve, fill  a cocktail shaker with ice and add 3 ounces of the mixture. Dilute with ½ ounce water per individual serving. Shake vigorously for 15 to 20 seconds. Strain into a chilled martini or coupe glass. Garnish with 3 coffee beans or a dusting of espresso powder, if desired.Allrecipes / Qi Ai

Title: Blueberry Lemonade Martini
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/blueberry-lemonade-martini-recipe-11798375
Ingredients:
- 2fluid ounceslemon infused vodka
- 2fluid ouncesblueberry lemonade
- 1/2fluid ounceagave syrup or simple syrup
- 1teaspoonfreshly squeezedlime juice
- 1wedge plus 1 slicelemon or lime, divided,for garnish
- chili lime seasoning, such as Tajin® (optional)
Instructions:
1. Add vodka, blueberry lemonade, agave syrup, and lime juice to a cocktail shaker.
2. Fill the cocktail shaker with ice and shake until the outside is frosted, about 30 seconds.
3. Sprinkle Tajin seasoning on a plate, rub the rim of your favorite glass with a lemon or lime wedge, and dip the glass in seasoning to coat the rim. Strain the cocktail into the glass.

Title: Green Tea and Honey-Rhubarb Punch
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/green-tea-and-honey-rhubarb-punch-recipe-11686862
Ingredients:
- 1 2/3cupschopped freshrhubarb
- 2/3cuphoney
- 2/3cupwater
- 1tablespoongratedfresh ginger
- 2cupswater
- 4 bags green tea or2tablespoonsloosegreen tea
- 1bunchfresh mint (about 1 cup), plus more for garnish
- 2cupsvodka
- 1cupfresh lime juice(from about 8 limes)
- 2cupschilledclub soda
- ice, as needed
- rhubarb stalks,for garnish
Instructions:
1. For syrup, stir rhubarb, honey, water, and ginger together in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil; reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, for 15 minutes. Remove from heat; let cool completely, about 1 hour.
2. Strain through a fine-mesh sieve into an airtight container or jar; discard solids. Syrup can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.
3. For green tea punch, bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Remove from heat and add tea bags. Steep, covered, 5 minutes. Remove tea bags, or strain to remove loose tea. Let tea cool completely, about 1 hour.
4. Muddle mint in a large pitcher. Add cooled tea, vodka, honey-rhubarb syrup, and lime juice. Chill at least 30 minutes, or up to 12 hours.
5. Add club soda to a pitcher and stir gently. Serve over ice and garnish with fresh mint and rhubarb stalks.From the Editor:For a single drink, fill a cocktail shaker half full with ice. Add 1 1/2 fluid ounces strong brewed green tea, 1 1/2 fluid ounces vodka, 3/4 fluid ounce Honey-Rhubarb Syrup, and 3/4 fluid ounce fresh lime juice. Cover and shake until the outside of the shaker is frosted, about 30 seconds. Strain into an ice-filled glass. Top with 1 1/2 fluid ounces chilled club soda. Place a sprig of fresh mint on your hand and clap it firmly to express oils. Add mint to glass.

Title: Orange Creamsicle Margarita
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/orange-creamsicle-margarita-recipe-11744666
Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons orange zest, salt, and sugar mix (for sugar rim) (optional, see Note)
- 1lime wedge
- 3ouncestequila
- 2ouncesfresh-squeezedorange juice
- 1ouncefresh-squeezedlime juice
- 1ouncetriple sec
- 1ouncevanilla ice cream, softened
- ice as needed
- 2slicesorange or lemon, for garnish
Instructions:
1. Gather all your ingredients.Allrecipes/Diana Chistruga
2. Mix orange zest, sugar, and salt together on a small plateAllrecipes/Diana Chistruga
3. Rim 2 glasses with lime wedge and rotate in the orange zest mixture.Allrecipes/Diana Chistruga
4. Combine tequila, orange juice, lime juice, triple sec, and ice cream in a cocktail shaker.Allrecipes/Diana Chistruga
5. Fill cocktail shaker with ice and shake very well. Strain into the orange-rimmed glasses and garnish with an orange or lemon sliceAllrecipes/Diana ChistrugaSugar rimFor the sugar rim mixture a classic ratio is 4 parts sugar, 1 part salt, and 1 part orange zest, but you can change the amounts to your liking

Title: Juneteenth 'Red Punch' Strawberry Lemonade
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/juneteenth-red-punch-strawberry-lemonade-recipe-11738621
Ingredients:
- 2cupssliced fresh orfrozen strawberries
- 1/2cupsugar
- 1cupfresh-squeezed lemon juice(from about 8 lemons) or1(12-ounce) canlemonade concentrate, thawed
- 7cupscoldwater
- ice, as needed
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Allrecipes/Julia Hartbeck
2. Add strawberries, sugar, lemonade concentrate, and water to a blender in that order. Pulse the mixture a few times. Then blend at low speed for 2 minutes. Gradually turn the speed up to medium. Blend until smooth.Allrecipes/Julia HartbeckRecipe TipIf you don’t have a blender, add strawberries, sugar, lemonade concentrate, and water to a large mixing bowl. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed until well combined and punch is smooth.
3. Pour strawberry lemonade  into a large pitcher or punch bowl. Serve over ice.Allrecipes/Julia Hartbeck

Title: London Fog
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/london-fog-recipe-11729062
Ingredients:
- 3/4cupwater
- 1Earl Greyteabag
- 3/4cupmilk
- 3/4tablespoonvanilla syrup, such as Torani®
- 1teaspoonlavender (optional)
Instructions:
1. Bring water to a boil. Remove from heat and add tea bag; steep for 5 minutes.
2. Meanwhile, heat milk in a microwave-safe cup until hot, 1 to 2 minutes. Add vanilla syrup. Froth milk with a frother or immersion blender until milk is foamy.
3. Pour tea into a cup; carefully pour foamy milk over the top. Sprinkle lavender over foam.Cook’s NoteI froth milk 1/4 cup at a time, pouring over tea 3 times.

Garnish with an orange slice and a maraschino cherry. Serve immediately.Cook’s NoteIf you chill the ingredients, you will not need ice cubes.You may want to transfer grenadine to a squeeze bottle for better control.

Title: Passion Fruit Mojito
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/passion-fruit-mojito-recipe-8774704
Ingredients:
- 1fluid ouncelime juice
- 1 1/2fluidouncessimple syrup
- 8mint leaves
- 2fluidounceswhiterum
- 2cupsice cubes,or as needed
- 2ouncesfrozenpassion fruitpulp (with or without seeds, thawed)
- 2fluidouncesclub soda
Instructions:
1. In a cocktail shaker, combine lime juice, simple syrup and 6 mint leaves. Use a muddler to crush the leaves for about 10 seconds. Add rum and 1 cup ice. Seal shaker and shake vigorously until outside is frosted, 10 to 15 seconds.
2. Strain mojito into a glass. Add passion fruit pulp and club soda and gently stir. Fill glass with crushed ice and garnish with remaining mint leaves.

Title: Maple Pancake Shot
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/maple-pancake-shot-recipe-11792460
Ingredients:
- 2stripsbacon, cut in half
- 1tablespoonmaple syrup
- 4fluidounceswhiskey
- 2fluidouncesbutterscotch schnapps
- 1cuporange juice
Instructions:
1. Add bacon to a skillet over medium heat, and cook until nearly crisp, about 7 minutes. Pour syrup over bacon, and cook until syrup is reduced, about 30 seconds more. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Syrup will harden like candy.
2. Pour 1 ounce whiskey and 1/3 ounce butterscotch schapps into each of 4 shot glasses.
3. Pour 2 ounces orange juice into each of 4 shot glasses or small glasses. Serve each whiskey shot with a shot of orange juice as a chaser, and a piece of bacon on the side.Peyton Beckwith

Title: Iced London Fog
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/iced-london-fog-recipe-11752200

2. Fill a tall glass with ice; pour in milk, then tea. Stir well. Sweeten with vanilla syrup to taste.

Title: Pink Lemonade Jello Shots
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/pink-lemonade-jello-shots-recipe-11711372
Ingredients:
- 6lemons
- 2(1 ounce) packetsunflavoredgelatin
- 1cuppink lemonade
- 1/2cuplemon vodka, such as Deep Eddy’s®
- 1/2cupvodka, such as Tito’s®
- sanding sugar,as needed, for garnish (optional)
- edible glitter powder(optional)
Instructions:
1. Cut lemons into halves lengthwise. Use a paring knife to loosen the pith from the rind and carefully remove the insides from lemon halves; reserve the hollowed peels.
2. Add pink lemonade to a small sauce pan over medium heat, and stir in gelatin; heat just until gelatin is completely dissolved, about 5 minutes.
3. Add pink lemonade mixture, vodka, and lemon vodka to a bowl and stir to combine.
4. Place lemon peel halves onto a plate or small rimmed baking sheet, side by side, to ensure they stay upright. Secure lemons with foil or ramekins as needed to hold them upright.
5. Carefully pour pink lemonade mixture into lemon peels, filling each one to the top.
6. Place filled lemons into the refrigerator and chill until firmly set, at least 3 hours.
7. Slice lemons into wedges; keep chilled until ready to serve. Sprinkle with sanding sugar and edible glitter before serving.Peyton Beckwith

Title: Pineapple Jalapeño Margarita
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/pineapple-jalapeno-margarita-recipe-11747484
Ingredients:
- 2slicesfresh pineapple, plus more for garnish
- 2 slicesfreshjalapeno,or more to taste, plus 1 slice for garnish
- 2ouncestequila
- 2ouncesfresh pineapple juice
- 1ouncefreshlime juice
- 1ouncefreshorange juice
- 1ozice
- 1lime wedge
- 2tablespoonstajin seasoning, for glass
Instructions:

2. Place tajin on a plate.  Rub one side of glass with lime slice and roll in tajin. Strain margarita into the prepared glass and garnish with pineapple slice and jalapeno slice if desired.

Title: Paloma Martini
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/paloma-martini-recipe-11713787

Title: Cucumber Mint Green Iced Tea
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/cucumber-mint-green-iced-tea-recipe-11744850
Ingredients:
- 4cupswater
- 4green tea bags
- 1/2cupchopped freshmint leaves
- 3tablespoonshoney, or to taste
- 1/2lemon, juiced
- 1mediumenglish cucumber, thinly sliced
- fresh mint, cucumber slices, and lemon slices for garnish (optional)
- ice cubesas needed
Instructions:
1. Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Remove from heat, add tea bags and mint leaves, and allow to steep for about 5 minutes.
2. Strain brewed tea into a pitcher. Stir in honey and lemon juice while tea is still warm, and allow to cool to room temperature.
3. Add cucumber slices, and set aside for about 10 minutes.
4. Fill glasses with ice cubes and pour cold tea over the cubes. Garnish with additional mint, lemon, and cucumber slices to serve.

Title: Orange Creamsicle Shake
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/orange-creamsicle-shake-recipe-11697327
Ingredients:
- 1cupfreshly-squeezedorange juice
- 1/2cupsugar-free French Vanilla creamer,or as needed
- 3/4cupsugar-free whipped cream, such as Zero Sugar Reddi Wip®
Instructions:
1. Pour orange juice into the wells of an ice cube tray, and freeze until solid, about 4 hours.
2. Place orange ice cubes and French vanilla creamer in a blender and blend until smooth. If too thick, add additional creamer, 1 tablespoon at a time.
3. Pour 1/3 of orange mixture into a glass. Top with 1/4 cup whipped cream. Repeat layers twice. Serve immediately.

Title: Peach Whiskey Sour
Category: drinks
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/peach-whiskey-sour-recipe-8781153
