Title: Sheet Pan Egg in a Hole with Bacon and Brussels Sprout Slaw
Category: pork
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/sheet-pan-egg-in-a-hole-with-bacon-and-brussels-sprout-slaw-recipe-11770254
Ingredients:
- 6tablespoonsbutter, softened
- 6slicesthick-cutsourdough bread
- 6slicesthick-cut bacon
- 1/3cupmayonnaise
- 1tablespoonDijon mustard
- 1tablespoonpuremaple syrup
- 1tablespooncider vinegar
- 1/8teaspoontablesalt
- 1/8teaspoonfreshly groundblack pepper, plus more for garnish
- 1(9-10-ounce) packageshaved Brussels sprouts
- 1shallot, thinly sliced
- 6largeeggs
- flaky salt and/or freshlygrated Parmesan cheese, for garnish
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a 13x18-inch rimmed sheet pan with parchment paper or foil.
2. Spread butter on both sides of bread slices; arrange in an even layer on the prepared sheet pan. Bake for 7 minutes; turn slices and bake until lightly toasted, about 3 minutes more.
3. Using a 2 1/2-inch biscuit cutter or straight-sided glass, remove a hole from the center of each toast slice. Set toast slices and rounds aside.
4. Arrange bacon in an even layer on the same sheet pan. Bake, turning halfway through, until crisp, 15 to 20 minutes.
5. Meanwhile, for slaw, whisk together mayonnaise, mustard, maple syrup, vinegar, table salt, and pepper in a bowl. Add Brussels sprouts and shallot; toss to coat.Make aheadChill slaw up to 1 day if you are making it in advance.
6. Transfer bacon to a paper towel-lined plate; let cool. Pour off excess drippings from the pan, leaving parchment or foil in place. Return toast slices to pan, reserving rounds. Crack an egg into each hole.
7. Bake until whites are set and yolks are desired doneness, 7 to 9 minutes.
8. Crumble bacon; sprinkle evenly over eggs. Top with slaw. Garnish with flaky salt, Parmesan cheese, and/or additional pepper. If you like, top with reserved toast rounds.

Title: Carrot Ribbon Salad
Category: pork
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/carrot-ribbon-salad-recipe-11699252
Ingredients:
- 1/4cupmayonnaise
- 1 1/2tablespoonswhite sugar
- 1tablespoonapple cider vinegar
- 1/4teaspoonkosher salt
- 4carrots, peeled into wide ribbons using a vegetable peeler (about 4 cups)
- 1/3cupcrumbled cookedbacon
- 1/3cupthinly slicedshallots
- 3tablespoonsdried sweetenedcranberries
- 3tablespoonshoney-roasted pecan pieces
- 2tablespoonschopped fresh flat-leafparsley,plus more for garnish
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Hostein / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
2. Whisk together mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar, and salt in a 1-quart container with a lid.Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Hostein / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
3. Add carrots, bacon, shallots, cranberries, pecan pieces, and parsley; cover and shake until carrots are evenly coated in mayonnaise mixture.Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Hostein / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
4. Transfer to a serving bowl and garnish with parsley.Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Hostein / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGheeFrom the Editor:Here's afoolproof way to cook bacon in the microwave.Recipe developed by Amanda Holstein and tested by Giovanna Vazquez.

Title: Neiman Marcus Chicken Casserole
Category: pork
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/neiman-marcus-chicken-casserole-recipe-11693255
Ingredients:
- 4cupsshredded cooked chicken
- 1(10.5 ounce) cancream of chicken soup
- 1cupsour cream
- 2cupsshredded Cheddar cheese
- 1/2cupsliced green onions
- 1/2cupslivered almonds
- 6slicesbacon, cooked and crumbled
- 1 ½teaspoonshot sauce, such as Tabasco® or to taste
- 1sleevebuttery crackers, such as Ritz® crackers, crushed
- 1/2cupbutter, melted
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
2. Place chicken, chicken soup, sour cream, cheese, green onions, almonds, bacon, and hot sauce into a large mixing bowl and stir to combine.  Pour mixture into the prepared dish.
3. Stir crushed crackers and butter together until combined; spread mixture evenly over casserole.
4. Bake in the preheated oven until browned and bubbly, 40 to 45 minutes.Peyton BeckwithFrom the Editor:Here's a foolproof way toCook Bacon in the Microwave.

Title: Bacon Jalapeño Corn
Category: pork
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/bacon-jalapeno-corn-recipe-11764770
Ingredients:
- 3slicesbacon
- 1tablespoonunsalted butter
- 3cupsfreshcorn kernels
- 1/2cupdicedbell pepper,any color
- 1/3cupdicedred onion
- 1jalapeno,seeded and diced
- 1/2teaspoondried basil
- salt and freshly ground black pepperto taste
- fresh basil, for garnish (optional)
Instructions:
1. Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels. Pour out all but 1 tablespoon bacon fat.
2. Add butter to the skillet and allow to melt. Stir in corn, bell pepper, red onion, and jalapeño. Cook until corn is becoming tender but still slightly crisp, about 5 minutes. Season with dried basil, salt, and pepper and stir until well combined.
3. Crumble or chop bacon, and stir half into the corn mixture. Sprinkle the remainder over the top, garnish with fresh basil, and serve.

Title: Jalapeno Popper Twists
Category: pork
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/jalapeno-popper-twists-recipe-11736107
Ingredients:
- 1poundbacon
- 2sheetsfrozenpuff pastry, thawed according to package directions
- 1/2(8 ounce) packagecream cheese, softened
- 8ouncesCheddar cheese, shredded
- 2jalapenos -seeded, quartered, and sliced, or more to taste
- 1largeegg, beaten
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment.
2. Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels. Chop bacon when cool enough to handle.
3. Lightly flour a work surface, and roll out each pastry sheet until folds are smoothed out.
4. Place one pastry puff sheet on the prepared baking sheet. Spread cream cheese in a thin layer over pastry; sprinkle with 2/3 shredded Cheddar, half the bacon and half the jalapenos.
5. Place second sheet of pastry on top, aligning the edges. Using a sharp knife or pizza cutter, cut the assembled pastry in half lengthwise, then cut into 1.5-inch strips crosswise.
6. Brush pastry with beaten egg using a pastry brush. Twist each strip; touch up each twist with more egg wash as needed. Space twists out on the baking sheet; sprinkle with remaining Cheddar cheese, bacon, and jalapenos.
7. Bake in the preheated oven until puffed and golden brown, 12 to 15 minutes.Peyton Beckwith

Title: Swamp Cabbage
Category: pork
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/swamp-cabbage-recipe-11792488
Ingredients:
- 8ouncesthick-cut bacon, chopped
- 6ounceshickory-smoked sausage, sliced into 1/2-inch-thick half moons
- 1yellow onion, chopped
- 1green bell pepper, chopped
- 2stalkscelery, chopped
- 1 1/2tablespoonsminced garlic
- 1(2 pound)green cabbage, coarsely chopped
- 1 1/2teaspoonskosher salt
- 3/4teaspoononion powder
- 1/2teaspoonfreshly groundblack pepper
- 1(14.5 ounce) candiced tomatoes
- 1(14 ounce) canhearts of palm, drained and roughly chopped
- 1/2cupvegetable broth
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Photographer: Brittney Cottrell / Food Styling: Amanda Holst / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
2. Heat a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add bacon and cook, stirring occasionally, until most of bacon starts to turn brown, about 8 minutes; add sausage and continue cooking, stirring often, until bacon and sausage are crisp, 2 to 3 minutes.Photographer: Brittney Cottrell / Food Styling: Amanda Holst / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
3. Add onion, bell pepper, celery, and garlic; cook, stirring often, until tender, about 5 minutes.Photographer: Brittney Cottrell / Food Styling: Amanda Holst / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
4. Add cabbage, salt, onion powder, and black pepper; cook, stirring often, until cabbage starts to wilt, 2 to 3 minutes. Add diced tomatoes, hearts of palm, and broth; stir until evenly combined.Photographer: Brittney Cottrell / Food Styling: Amanda Holst / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
5. Bring mixture to a simmer over medium heat; cover and cook, stirring every few minutes, until cabbage is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed, 15 to 20 minutes.Photographer: Brittney Cottrell / Food Styling: Amanda Holst / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee

Title: Easy Bacon Pancake Sticks
Category: pork
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/easy-bacon-pancake-sticks-recipe-11694154
Ingredients:
- 2cupscompletepancake mix
- 1 1/3cupswater, plus more as needed
- 3tablespoonsbutter, divided
- 8slicesthick cut bacon,cooked until crisp and sturdy
- syrup for dipping (optional)
Instructions:
1. Combine pancake mix and water in a medium bowl and stir until just blended (there may be a few lumps).
2. Heat half of the butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat until melted.
3. Dip half of the bacon in the batter until evenly coated and place in the skillet.  Cook undisturbed until lightly browned and slightly puffed, about 2-3 minutes.  Flip and cook for another 2-3 minutes or until the pancake is cooked through.
4. Repeat with remaining bacon and batter.  Serve with syrup if desired for dipping.Peyton Beckwith

Title: Hash Brown Crust Bacon Quiche
Category: pork
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/hash-brown-crust-bacon-quiche-recipe-11681752
Ingredients:
- 5medium-sizedrusset potatoes, scrubbed and peeled
- salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
- 1pinchcayenne pepper, or to taste
- 1pinchgarlic powder, or to taste
- 6tablespoonsbutter,divided
- 5largeeggs,divided
- 4slicesbacon, cooked until crisp, then crumbled
- 2green onions,chopped
- 1/2cupshreddedsharp Cheddar cheese
- 1/2cupshredded mozzarella cheese
- 1cupheavy cream
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Lightly grease an ovenproof pie pan.
2. Shred potatoes, then place in a cheesecloth. Lightly salt potatoes, then wring out as much water as possible. Pat with a paper towel, then place in a bowl.
3. Melt 5 tablespoons butter, add to potatoes, and season with salt, pepper, cayenne, and garlic powder.
4. Add 1 egg to potatoes, then mix well. Pour into prepared pie pan; press potatoes into the bottom and up the sides to form a crust, making bottom crust fairly thin so that it will cook completely. Place on a baking sheet.
5. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes.
6. Meanwhile, whisk 4 eggs together in a bowl; season with salt and pepper. Stir in cream and green onions.
7. Remove crust from oven; reduce the temperature 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Sprinkle bacon into the crust, then top with cheese. Carefully pour egg mixture evenly over cheese carefully.
8. Bake in the preheated oven until a fork inserted in the middle comes out clean and the quiche is puffed and golden, about 30 minutes. Let cool 5 minutes before serving.

========================================

Title: Creamy Banana Pepper Bacon Chicken
Category: pork
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/creamy-banana-pepper-bacon-chicken-recipe-11680006
Ingredients:
- 5slicesbacon, chopped
- 4boneless skinless chicken breasts, pounded to an even thickness
- 1teaspoonkosher salt
- 1/2teaspoonfreshly ground black pepper
- 1/2teaspoongarlic powder
- 1/2red onion, thinly sliced
- 1/2cupsliced banana peppers
- 2tablespoonsbrine from banana pepper jar
- 1cupheavy cream
- 1/2cupfeta cheese, plus more for garnish
- chopped fresh parsley for garnish (Optional)
Instructions:
1. Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium heat, until crisp, stirring often. Remove bacon from skillet and set aside, leaving drippings in the pan.  Increase heat to medium-high.
2. Season chicken evenly with salt, pepper, and garlic powder and add them to the hot skillet.  Cook, undisturbed until chicken is browned and easily releases from the pan, about 5 minutes. Flip the chicken and cook, 2 to 3 more minutes.  Remove chicken from skillet and set aside, keep warm.
3. Add onion, banana peppers, and brine to the skillet and cook, stirring constantly, until onion softens. Pour in heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Return chicken to skillet along with any juices that have accumulated. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until chicken is cooked through and mixture thickens slightly, 5 to 7 minutes.
4. Transfer chicken to serving dish and stir feta cheese into the skillet. Remove from heat and spoon creamy pepper mixture and sauce over chicken. Top with reserved bacon and garnish with additional feta and parsley if desired.Peyton Beckwith

Title: Smash Dumpling Tacos
Category: pork
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/smash-dumpling-tacos-recipe-11781222
Ingredients:
- 1cucumber, chopped
- 1tablespoonrice vinegar
- 1/2teaspoonsalt
- 1/4teaspoonchili flakes
- 1poundground pork
- 2clovesgarlic, minced
- 1tablespoontoasted sesame oil
- 1tablespoonlower-sodiumsoy sauce
- 2teaspoonsrice vinegar
- 1teaspoonginger paste
- 2green onions, chopped
- 12streettaco-size flour tortillas
- choppedcilantro, toasted sesame seeds, and Sriracha for garnish (optional)
Instructions:
1. Combine cucumber, rice vinegar, salt, and chili flakes in a small bowl. Set aside.
2. For taco filling, combine pork, garlic, sesame oil, soy sauce, rice vinegar, ginger paste, and green onions in a bowl; mix gently with your hands or a fork.
3. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Spread 2 tablespoons filling over a tortilla in a flat, even layer.
4. Place tortilla in the skillet filling side down. Using a spatula, press and cook for 3 minutes. Flip and cook 2 minutes more. Repeat with remaining tortillas.
5. Top with pickles; garnish with cilantro, sesame seeds, and Sriracha.

Title: Chicken Bacon Ranch Potato Bake
Category: pork
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/chicken-bacon-ranch-potato-bake-recipe-11790658
Ingredients:
- 2 1/2poundsYukon gold potatoes, scrubbed and cut in 1-inch chunks
- 2tablespoonsolive oil
- 1(1-ounce)packetranch dry salad dressing mix,divided
- 8slicesbacon
- 1/2cupchoppedonion
- 3tablespoonsall purpose flour
- 1 1/2cupswhole milk
- 1tablespoonlemon juiceor white wine vinegar
- 2poundsskinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
- 1cupshreddedCheddar cheese, divided
- 1/4cupchoppedgreen onions
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
2. Place potatoes in the prepared baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with 1 tablespoon ranch dressing mix; toss to coat. Roast potatoes until lightly browned and tender, stirring twice, about 30 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
3. Meanwhile, cook bacon in a 12-inch skillet over medium heat until crisp, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon on paper towels. When cool enough to handle, crumble bacon. Drain all but 3 tablespoons bacon grease from the skillet.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
4. Add onion to the skillet. Cook until tender, 5 minutes. Stir in flour. Cook and stir for 1 minute more. Add milk. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Stir in lemon juice and remaining ranch dressing mix.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
5. Place chicken over the potatoes in the baking dish. Top with bacon and 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese. Pour sauce over the mixture. Bake until chicken is no longer pink, 15 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
6. Top with remaining 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese. Bake until melted, about 5 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
7. Serve garnished with green onions.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco

========================================

Title: Apple Cider Pork Tenderloin With Sweet Potatoes
Category: pork
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/apple-cider-pork-tenderloin-with-sweet-potatoes-recipe-8774666
Ingredients:
- 1/2teaspoongranulated garlic
- 1/2teaspoonsalt
- 1/4teaspoonfreshlyground black pepper
- 1/2teaspoondried thyme
- 1teaspoonsmoked paprika
- 1(1pound)pork tenderloin, silver skin removed
- 2Fuji applesor other firm cooking apples, cored and cut into eighths
- 1red onion, cut into 1-inch pieces
- 1white-fleshed sweet potato, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces
- 4tablespoonsunsalted butter,divided
- 2cupsapple cider
- 1tablespoonred wine vinegar
- 2tablespoonsDijon mustard
- fresh thyme sprigs for garnish (optional)
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) and line a sheet pan with parchment. Combine garlic, salt, pepper, thyme and smoked paprika in a small bowl.
2. Pat tenderloin dry with paper towels. Coat all sides with half of seasoning mixture, using fingertips to rub into the meat. Let seasoned tenderloin stand at room temperature while other ingredients are being prepped.
3. Combine apples, red onion, and sweet potato in a bowl. Sprinkle with remaining seasoning mixture and stir to combine. Melt 2 tablespoons butter, pour over seasoned mixture, and stir to coat. Spread in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet.
4. Roast in the center of the preheated oven, uncovered, for about 10 minutes.
5. Meanwhile, melt remaining butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. When butter stops sizzling, add tenderloin to the skillet and brown on all sides, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Nestle tenderloin into the middle of the sheet pan with apple mixture.
6. Return pan to the oven and roast while glaze is prepared, 10 to 15 minutes.
7. Meanwhile, for glaze, to the same skillet add apple cider, red wine vinegar, and Dijon mustard. Increase heat to medium-high and bring to a full rolling boil. Allow liquid to reduce to about 1 cup, and spoon generously over tenderloin and apple mixture.
8. Continue roasting until the internal temperature of the thickest part of pork reaches 140 degrees F (60 degrees C), 5 to 10 minutes more.
9. Remove from the oven and tent with foil. Allow to rest about 5 minutes. Residual cooking should bring pork up to 145 degrees F (63 degrees C), when tested with an instant read thermometer.
10. To serve, slice pork into 1/2-inch slices, garnish with fresh thyme, and serve with roasted vegetables and apples.

========================================

Title: Viking Stew
Category: pork
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/viking-stew-recipe-11711198
Ingredients:
- 4 1/2poundsbonelesspork shoulder roast, cut into 2- to 3-inch chunks
- 3teaspoonskosher salt, or to taste
- 1/4cuphoney
- 1cupfreshblackberries,or other fresh berries
- 2tablespoonslingonberry jam
- 6cupscoldwater
- 3clovesgarlic, peeled
- 1teaspoondried thyme
- 1teaspoonground coriander
- 1yellow onion,cut into large dice
- 2leeks, washed thoroughly, cut into 1-inch pieces
- 10largebrownmushrooms, halved
- 1smallgreen cabbage, cut into 1-inch pieces
- 3largecarrots, peeled and cut into 2-inch pieces
- 2fennel bulbs,halved and cut into 1/4-inch strips
- 1/4cuptorncilantro leaves
- 1/4cupchoppedfresh dill
- 2tablespoonsfresh thyme leaves
Instructions:
1. Add pork to a large soup pot or Dutch oven. Add salt, honey, berries, lingonberry jam, and cold water, and turn the heat to high.
2. While stew is coming to a boil, add garlic, dry thyme, and ground coriander. When mixture comes to a rolling boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer gently for 45 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. Stir in onion, leeks, and mushrooms, and simmer until meat is almost, but not quite fork tender,  about 45 minutes more.
4. Stir in cabbage, carrots, and fennel; continue to simmer until vegetables and meat are very tender, about 30 minutes.
5. Season to taste with salt. Serve with fresh herbs scattered over the top.John MitzewichChef's Note:This stew can be made with any meat.For best results, purée the black berries, and pass through a strainer to catch the seeds before adding to the stew.Other root vegetables such as turnips, beets, and rutabagas were common ingredients used by the Vikings, and can all be added to this stew as well.

Title: BLT Chicken Salad
Category: pork
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/blt-chicken-salad-recipe-11761494
Ingredients:
- 2/3cupmayonnaise
- 1/2cupchoppedgreen onions

- 1 1/2cupsgrape tomatoes, quartered
- 8stripsbacon, crisp-cooked and crumbled
- 1avocado - peeled, pitted, and chopped (optional)
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Photographer: Jacob Fox / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Natalie Ghazali
2. Combine mayonnaise, green onions, buttermilk and pepper in a bowl.Photographer: Jacob Fox / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Natalie Ghazali
3. Add chicken, tomatoes, and bacon. Stir to combine.Photographer: Jacob Fox / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Natalie Ghazali
4. If using, fold in avocado just before serving.Photographer: Jacob Fox / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Natalie Ghazali
5. Serve immediately or cover and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.Photographer: Jacob Fox / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Natalie GhazaliCooking BaconHere's a fool-proof method oncooking bacon in the oven.

Title: Bacon Wrapped Cheeseburger Bites
Category: pork
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/bacon-wrapped-cheeseburger-bites-recipe-11685653
Ingredients:
- 1poundground beef, 80/20 preferred
- 1 1/2tablespoonsItalian-seasoned breadcrumbs
- 1largeegg
- 1/2teaspoononion powder
- 1/4teaspoongarlic powder
- 1teaspoondried parsley
- 1teaspoonsalt
- 1tablespoonketchup
- 1tablespoonyellow mustard
- 4dill pickle chips, chopped
- 4ouncesCheddar cheese, cut into 1/2 inch cubes
- 9slicesbacon
- 1teaspoonsesame seeds, or as needed for garnish
Instructions:
1. Preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
2. Combine ground beef, breadcrumbs, egg, onion powder, garlic powder, parsley flakes, salt, ketchup, mustard, and dill pickle in a bowl and mix until just combined.
3. Pinch 1 generous tablespoon of meat mixture and wrap around 1 cube of cheese. Roll to form a ball, then place on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Continue with remaining meat mixture and cheese.
4. Cut bacon slices in half widthwise, then cut each piece in half lengthwise, making 4 strips from each bacon slice.
5. Wrap 1 bacon strip around each meatball, securing with a toothpick or pressed tightly into the meat to stay in place. Any extra strips of bacon can be used to do a second wrap on some of the meatballs.
6. Line the bottom of the air fryer with half of the meatballs, then fry for 6 minutes. Turn them over and fry for another six minutes. Remove and repeat with remaining meatballs.
7. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve with your choice of dipping sauce.Cook’s NoteBecause I used toothpicks, some cheese did pool out during cooking. The next morning, we put these on parchment after warming them up in the microwave a bit. We added some more cheese on top, then broiled them. Absolutely wonderful!

========================================

Title: Crunchy Tex-Mex Casserole with Spicy Ranch Drizzle
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/crunchy-tex-mex-casserole-recipe-with-spicy-ranch-drizzle-11787036
Ingredients:
- 2 (8.5-ounce) boxescornbread muffin mix
- 1cupchicken broth
- 3cupsshreddedrotisserie chicken
- 1(15-ounce) jarsalsa (mild or medium)
- 1(12-ounce) bagfrozencorn kernels, thawed
- 2cupsshredded Cheddar cheese
- 1cuplightly crushednacho-flavored tortilla chips
- 1(2.25 ounce) canslicedblack olives, drained
- 3mediumgreen onions, chopped
- 1cupranch dressing
- 1teaspoonhot sauce, or to taste
Instructions:
1. Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) and spray a 9x13-inch glass or ceramic casserole dish with nonstick cooking spray.Photography: Carson Downing / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Dera Burreson
2. Combine cornbread muffin mix and chicken broth in a bowl and stir well. Spread cornbread mixture evenly over the bottom of the casserole dish.Photography: Carson Downing / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Dera Burreson
3. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.Photography: Carson Downing / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Dera Burreson
4. Add shredded chicken on top of the cornbread layer. Use a spoon to dot chicken with salsa. Sprinkle corn evenly over chicken, followed by shredded cheesePhotography: Carson Downing / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Dera Burreson
5. Bake in the preheated oven on the center rack for an additional 15 minutes, or until the bottom crust is golden brown.Photography: Carson Downing / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Dera BurresonRemove from the oven and sprinkle with the crushed tortilla chips, sliced olives, and green onions.Photography: Carson Downing / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Dera Burreson
6. Mix together ranch dressing with hot sauce in a small bowl and drizzle over the top of casserole.Photography: Carson Downing / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Dera Burreson
7. Cut into 6 or 8 rectangles to serve.Photography: Carson Downing / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Dera Burreson

Title: Carrot Apple Pancakes
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/carrot-apple-pancakes-recipe-11804389
Ingredients:
- 1cupgrated carrot
- 5tablespoonsunsalted butter, divided
- 1/8teaspoonsalt
- 1teaspoongratedginger root
- 1/4teaspoongroundcinnamon
- 1teaspoonwhite sugar
- 1large egg
- 1/2lemon, juiced
- 1apple, unpeeled
- 1/3cupchopped walnuts(optional)
- 1/2cupself-rising flour
Instructions:
1. Peel and grate enough carrot to fill a 1-cup measuring cup, unpacked. Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add grated carrots and salt, and cook, stirring, until carrot begins to lose its raw character and softens only slightly, about 2 minutes.
2. Transfer carrots into a bowl, and add ginger, cinnamon, white sugar, egg, and lemon juice.  Stir well to combine. Grate apple into the bowl, and stir to combine.
3. Add self-rising flour, and stir until it disappears. Let batter rest about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter in the same skillet used for carrots over medium heat.
4. Once the butter melts, transfer in about 1/4 cup batter per pancake, and flatten slightly with the back of the spoon. Cook pancakes until browned and cooked through, about 3 minutes per side.
5. Serve topped with an optional spoon of yogurt, maple syrup, and chopped walnuts if desired.John MitzewichFrom the EditorHere'show to make self-rising flour.

Title: Balsamic Caprese Grilled Steak
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/balsamic-caprese-grilled-steak-recipe-11804623
Ingredients:
- 2tablespoonsolive oil
- 1tablespoonbalsamic vinegar
- 1/2teaspoonherbs
- 1/8teaspoongarlic
- 8ouncestrip steak
- 3mozzarella pearls
- 3cherry tomatoes
- 3freshbasil leaves
- 1teaspoonbalsamic glaze, or to taste
Instructions:
1. Add olive oil, balsamic vinegar, herbs, and garlic to a resealable plastic bag. Pat the strip steak dry and add steak into the marinade. Reseal the bag; marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight.
2. Brush grill grates with oil or grill spray. Preheat a gas grill with burners on High and lid closed for 10 to 15 minutes.
3. Remove steak from marinade, and allow excess to drip off; discard marinade. Place steak directly on grill grates over High heat. Sear with lid closed, 2 to 3 minutes per side. Rotate steak 45 degrees halfway through cooking on each side for crosshatch grill marks.
4. Move steak to indirect heat and cook to your preferred doneness, 1 to 2 minutes per side for a rare strip steak or 2 to 3 minutes per side for medium rare. Remove to a platter and keep warm.
5. Quarter mozzarella pearls and cherry tomatoes, and slice basil leaves into very thin strips. Place topping on steak and drizzle with balsamic glaze to serve.Cook’s NoteThe snack-size portions of mozzarella by Belgioso are the perfect size for the caprese topping.I do not recommend grilling the steak beyond medium rare. The balsamic vinegar in the marinade may go from caramelized to burned if cooked longer.

========================================

Title: One-Pan Stuffed Pepper Casserole
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/one-pan-stuffed-pepper-casserole-recipe-11806363
Ingredients:
- 1tablespoonolive oil
- 1poundground beef
- 1onion, diced
- 2tablespoonsunsalted butter
- 3cloves garlic,minced
- 2teaspoonskosher salt
- 1teaspoonfreshly groundblack pepper
- 1/2teaspoonsmoked paprika
- 1/2teaspoongarlic powder
- 1pinchcayenne
- 2green bell peppers, seeded, cut into 1-inch pieces
- 1red bell peppers, seeded, cut into 1-inch pieces
- 1orange bell pepper,seeded, cut into 1-inch pieces
- 1cupraw basmati or other long grain white rice
- 2teaspoonsWorcestershire sauce
- 2cupstomato sauce or tomato puree
- 1 1/2cupsbeef broth
- 6ouncesCheddar cheese, shredded, divided
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
2. Place an ovenproof pan over high heat, add olive oil, then the beef, and a big pinch of salt, and cook for about 1 minute, breaking the meat into smaller pieces. Add onions, and continue cooking, crumbling the meat, until it starts to brown and onions turn translucent. about 5 minutes. Brown the meat deeply for the best flavor.
3. Reduce heat to medium-high, or to medium if the pan seems very hot, and add butter and garlic. Cook, stirring, until butter melts, about 1 minute. Add black pepper, paprika, garlic powder, and cayenne. Cook and stir for about 1 minute. Add bell peppers, and cook and stir until just heated through, 2 to 3 minutes.
4. Add rice and stir until it is coated with the fats from the pan, about 1 minute. Add remaining salt, Worcestershire sauce, tomato sauce, and beef broth, and raise the heat to high. Stir together and wait for the mixture to simmer. Turn off heat, and sprinkle with some of the cheese, saving about 1/2 cup for the top. Use a spoon to poke and stir the cheese in evenly. Cover the pan tightly.
5. Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes. Remove from the oven, uncover, and check rice for tenderness in a few spots. If rice is not tender, cover and continue to bake. Once rice is tender, remove the casserole, uncover, sprinkle over the rest of the cheese, and turn on the oven’s broiler.
6. Broil casserole until cheese is melted, and starting to brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Let rest at least 10 minutes before serving.John Mitzewich

========================================

Title: Sheet Pan Chicken Pot Pie
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/sheet-pan-chicken-pot-pie-recipe-11796924
Ingredients:
- 5tablespoonsbutter
- 1cupchoppedonion
- 1/2cupchopped celery
- 1teaspoonkosher salt
- 1/2teaspoonfreshly ground blackpepper
- 1/2teaspoongarlic powder
- 1/2cupall=purposeflour
- 3cupschicken broth
- 1cupheavy cream
- 4cupschoppedcooked chicken
- 16ouncesfrozen mixed vegetables
- 1(17.3 ounce) boxpuff pastry,thawed according to package directions
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
2. Heat butter in a large deep skillet over medium heat. Add onion and celery and cook until tender, about 4 minutes
3. Sprinkle onion mixture with salt, pepper, and garlic powder and cook for 1 minute. Add flour and cook, stirring constantly, about 1 minute. Whisk in broth and cream and bring mixture to a simmer, stirring often. Cook, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes. Mix in chicken and vegetables and cook 2 minutes.  Adjust seasoning if necessary and remove from heat.
4. Lightly grease a rimmed baking sheet.  Pour chicken mixture into the prepared baking sheet.
5. Lighty roll pastry sheets to fit the baking sheet if needed.  Lay pastry on top of baking sheet to cover chicken mixture.
6. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and bubbly, 25 to 30 minutes.Peyton Beckwith

Title: Chili Shepherd's Pie
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/chili-shepherd-s-pie-recipe-11791554
Ingredients:
- 6mediumrusset potatoes (2 pounds), peeled and quartered
- 3tablespoonssalted butter
- 1/2cupsour cream
- 1/3cupwhole milk
- 1/2teaspoonsalt
- 1/4teaspoonground black pepper
- 1cupshredded Cheddar cheese, divided
- 3tablespoonschoppedgreen onion, plus more for garnish
- 1poundground beef
- 3(15-ounce) canschili
- 1(11-ounce)canwhole kernel corn with sweet peppers (Mexican-style) drained
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
2. Place potatoes in a large saucepan with enough salted water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes; drain and return to saucepan.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
3. Add butter and let stand for 2 minutes. Mash until smooth.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
4. Add sour cream, milk, salt and pepper; mash until combined.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
5. Fold in 3/4 cup Cheddar cheese and green onion.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
6. Meanwhile, cook ground beef in a large saucepan until browned, about 8 minutes; drain fat. Add chili and corn; heat until it comes to a simmer, about 5 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
7. Add chili mixture to the prepared baking dish.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
8. Spoon mashed potatoes over the chili and smooth to an even layer. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup Cheddar cheese.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
9. Bake until hot and bubbly, about 15 minutes. Garnish with additional green onions.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell

Title: Hibachi Chicken and Rice Casserole
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/hibachi-chicken-and-rice-casserole-recipe-11798799
Ingredients:
- 2tablespoonsolive oil
- 5skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces
- 6tablespoonslow-sodium soy sauce
- 3tablespoonsbrown sugar
- 2tablespoonsrice wine vinegar
- 1teaspoonfreshlyground black pepper
- 1tablespoongratedfresh ginger,or 1 teaspoon ground ginger
- 1cupdicedonion
- 1cupdicedzucchini
- 1cupdicedbroccoli
- 2clovesgarlic, minced
- 1 1/2cupsinstant rice
- 2cupslow-sodium chicken broth
- 1/2cupyum yum sauce, or as needed
- 1/4cupslicedgreen onions, or as needed
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
2. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat, add chicken, and cook until it begins to brown, 3 to 4 minutes.
3. Add soy sauce, brown sugar, rice wine vinegar, black pepper, and ginger and cook on medium heat until the sauce starts to thicken. Pour chicken mixture into a large bowl and set aside.
4. Bring the skillet back to medium heat and saute onions, broccoli and zucchini for 3 to 4 minutes.
5. Add chicken mixture, garlic, rice, and broth to the skillet and stir to combine. Place lid on the skillet.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Remove lid and cook until the top is golden brown,  5 to 10 minutes more.
7. Drizzle with yum yum sauce and sprinkle with green onions before serving.Peyton Beckwith

Title: Dallas' Spicy Habanero Salsa
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/dallas-spicy-habanero-salsa-recipe-11799448
Ingredients:
- 3tablespoonsextra-virgin olive oil, divided
- 3habanero peppers
- 2Roma tomatoes
- 2garlic cloves, peeled
- 1/4white onion
- 1 1/2teaspoonschicken bouillon powder,such as Knorr®
Instructions:
1. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a cast iron skillet. Once heated, add habaneros, tomatoes, garlic, and onion. Roast until charred., about 8 minutes
2. Place roasted veggies, remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil, and chicken bouillon in a blender cup and blend until smooth.

Title: Cheesy Cauliflower Cakes
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/cheesy-cauliflower-cakes-recipe-11803145
Ingredients:
- 3cupscauliflower florets
- 2largeeggs, beaten
- 1/4cupItalian seasonedpanko bread crumbs
- 1/2cupshreddedmozzarella cheese
- 1/2cupfinely shreddedParmesan cheese
- lemon wedges, for serving
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.Photographer: Jake Sternquist / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Kristen Schooley
2. Cook cauliflower in a large pot of lightly salted boiling water, until fork tender, 8 to 10 minutes. Drain and let stand until cool enough to handle.Photographer: Jake Sternquist / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Kristen Schooley
3. Lightly mash cooked cauliflower with a potato masher or fork into small pieces in a large bowl.Photographer: Jake Sternquist / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Kristen Schooley
4. Add eggs, breadcrumbs, mozzarella cheese, and Parmesan cheese. Stir just until combined.Photographer: Jake Sternquist / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Kristen Schooley
5. Form mixture, using your hands, into 1 1/2- to 2-inch balls. Lightly flatten between palms and place onto the prepared baking sheets.Photographer: Jake Sternquist / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Kristen Schooley
6. Bake until golden brown and cooked through, 20 to 25 minutes. Serve with lemon wedges.Photographer: Jake Sternquist / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Kristen SchooleyRecipe developed by Barrett Heald

Title: Southern Fried Corn
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/southern-fried-corn-recipe-11812425
Ingredients:
- 6earsfreshsweet corn
- 2tablespoonsbacon grease
- 3tablespoonsunsalted butter
- salt and freshly ground black pepper
- 1pinchwhite sugar(optional)
Instructions:
1. Remove the husks and silk from the corn cobs.
2. Hold each ear up with the cob touching the bottom of a large bowl. Slice kernels off using a sharp knife. Scrape the cob with the back (dull) side of the knife to release the corn milk into the bowl. This step adds flavor and texture to the corn.
3. In a large skillet, preferably cast iron, over medium heat, melt bacon grease and butter together, getting the pan nice and hot.
4. Add corn, and cook, stirring occasionally, until bright yellow, plump, and tender, 7 to 12 minutes. Cooking time will depend on how fresh the corn is. If it’s just picked, it will cook quickly—start tasting for tenderness at about 7 minutes.
5. Season with salt, pepper, and sugar, and serve immediately.

========================================

Title: Jalapeno Popper Potato Skins
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/jalapeno-popper-potato-skins-recipe-11808261
Ingredients:
- 6small to mediumrusset potatoes,scrubbed and thoroughly rinsed
- 1tablespoonvegetable oil
- 4stripsbacon
- 8largejalapeno peppers, or more as needed
- 1(8 ounce) packagecream cheese, softened
- 6ouncesCheddar cheese, grated
- 1/4teaspoonsalt, or to taste
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a sheet pan with foil.
2. Prick potatoes all over with the tip of a knife. Coat potatoes all over with oil, and place on the prepared sheet pan.
3. Bake in the preheated oven until centers of potatoes are soft when pierced with a knife, about 1 hour. Let cool until just warm, about 10 minutes.
4. Meanwhile, place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels; chop when cool enough to handle, and set aside.
5. Slice the large center parts of jalapenos into 36 thick rings, and remove the seeds. Dice remaining parts of peppers, and additional peppers as needed to make about 1/2 cup, or more if desired.
6. Add cream cheese and diced jalapeno to a bowl. Set aside about 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese for sprinkling on top of poppers, and add remaining cheese to the bowl. Mix well and set aside.
7. Lay each potato down on its widest, flattest side on a cutting board, and cut in half lengthwise. Scoop out cooked potato into a bowl, leaving about 1/8-inch of cooked potato attached to the skin.
8. Line a sheet pan with foil and coat with oil. Transfer scooped potato skins onto the sheet and season each one with salt. Divide cheese filling between the 12 potato skins, and spread out with a spoon.
9. Top cheese filling with bacon, and then place 3 jalapeno rings on top of each skin. Scatter reserved cheese over the top.
10. Increase the oven temperature to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C).
11. Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is bubbling, and the edges of the potatoes are crispy, 25 to 30 minutes.John Mitzewich

========================================

Title: The Potluck Pasta Salad Everyone Will Be Begging You to Bring Next Time
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/green-goddess-pasta-salad-recipe-11710692
Ingredients:
- 16ouncespasta
- 1cupfrozen peas
- 12spearsgreen asparagus, chopped into bite-sized pieces
- 2 to 3green onions, chopped
- 1/2cupcrumbled feta, or to taste
- fresh herbsto garnish, chopped or torn (basil,parsley,mint,chives)
- 1cupbaby spinach
- 1cupfresh basil
- 1small handfulofchives
- 1smallshallot, roughly chopped
- 1/2teaspoongranulated garlic
- 1/4cupraw cashews
- 1/4cupgrated Parmesan cheese
- 2tablespoonsnutritional yeast
- 2lemons, juiced, or to taste
- 2tablespoonsrice vinegar
- 1/2cupolive oil, or as needed
- saltandfreshly ground black pepperto taste
Instructions:
1. Gather the ingredients.Allrecipes / Ana Cadena
2. Bring a pot of heavily salted water to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the pasta to the boiling water and cook according to package instructions, or until the pasta is al dente. Drain the pasta. Transfer the pasta to a large bowl to allow to cool.Allrecipes / Ana Cadena
3. Meanwhile, combine spinach, basil, chives, shallot, garlic, cashews, Parmesan cheese, nutritional yeast, vinegar, and lemon juice in the container of a blender. Pulse to start blending. Add olive oil in a stream to emulsify to desired consistency. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside.Allrecipes / Ana Cadena
4. Steam peas and asparagus until they slightly soften and become bright green, 2 to 3 minutes. (You can opt toblanch your vegetableshere as well, or simply microwave with a little water for the same amount of time.) Remove from heat, rinse with cold water, drain, and transfer on top of the pasta along with the green onions.Allrecipes / Ana Cadena
5. Add the dressing over the pasta and vegetables and toss gently to combine. You may or may not use all of it depending on how coated you like the pasta. Add feta and herbs, and taste for seasoning.Allrecipes / Ana Cadena
6. Enjoy immediately or refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving.Allrecipes / Ana Cadena

Title: Ground Beef Stir Fry
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/ground-beef-stir-fry-recipe-11798233
Ingredients:
- 1poundground beef
- 2clovesgarlic,chopped
- 2tablespoonscanola oil or avocado oil
- 1/2small headcabbage,thinly sliced
- 1mediumonion, peeled and vertically sliced
- 1bell pepper(any color), seeded and sliced into thin strips
- 4ouncesBaby Bella (cremini) mushrooms,sliced
- 2tablespoonscornstarch
- 2tablespoons plus 1/4 cuplower-sodiumsoy sauce,divided
- 3/4cupbeef broth
- 1tablespoonsesame oil
- 2tablespoonsfreshly gratedginger or ginger paste
- sesame seeds and sliced green onion for garnish (optional)
Instructions:
1. Heat a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add ground beef, and cook until browned and no longer pink, breaking up clumps with a wooden spoon, about 5 minutes. Stir in garlic, and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Drain fat, transfer to a plate, and set aside.
2. Heat oil in the same pot, and add cabbage, onion, bell pepper, and mushrooms. Stir and cook until veggies are crisp tender, about 5 to 7 minutes.
3. Meanwhile, whisk cornstarch and 2 tablespoons soy sauce in a small bowl to make a smooth paste. Whisk in beef broth, 1/4 cup soy sauce, sesame oil, and ginger until well combined.
4. Return cooked beef to the wok and combine with the veggies. Pour in sauce, and stir until everything is evenly coated. Cook, stirring constantly, just until sauce thickens and reduces slightly.
5. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and green onion, and serve.

Title: Garlic Butter Meatball Sub
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/garlic-butter-meatball-sub-recipe-11795623
Ingredients:
- 18largeprecookedmeatballs in marinara sauce
- 1/2cupbutter
- 3clovesgarlic, minced
- 3tablespoonschopped parsley
- salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
- 6French bread hoagie rolls
- 1cupKraft® creamyshredded mozzarella cheese
- freshly grated Parmesan cheese, as needed, for garnish
Instructions:
1. Warm meatballs according to package directions. Set aside.
2. Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and continue cooking until garlic is fragrant, about 30 seconds. Stir in parsley, season with salt and pepper, and remove from heat.
3. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Brush insides of the rolls with garlic butter and toast, buttered side down, in the skillet until golden brown. Set aside.
4. Working with 1 or 2 rolls at a time, sprinkle 1/2 cup mozzarella per roll into the skillet. Place roll face down onto the cheese and cook until cheese is melted. Set aside.
5. Place 3 meatballs into each roll. Garnish with fresh Parmesan and a light drizzle of garlic butter if desired.Peyton Beckwith

Title: The Best Swamp Soup
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/the-best-swamp-soup-recipe-11796972
Ingredients:
- 1poundsmoked sausage,such as Conecuh®, cut into 1-inch pieces
- 1cupfinely choppedonion
- 2jalapenos,seeded and chopped
- 4mediumgoldpotatoes,diced
- 1(28-ounce) canseasonedturnip greens
- 1(14-ounce) canHoppin' John or seasoned black-eyed peas
- 1(10-ounce) candiced tomatoes and green chiles
- 1cannavy beans, drained
- 2cupswater
- 2teaspoonschicken bouillon paste, such as Better Than Bouillon®, or 2 chicken bouillon cubes
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat and add sausage. Cook, stirring often, until sausage is browned and fat has rendered out, about 5 minutes.
2. Add onion and peppers and cook, stirring constantly until onion softens, about 4 minutes. Add potatoes and cook, stirring often, 2 minutes. Add turnip greens, Hoppin' John, diced tomatoes and green chiles, navy beans, water, and bouillon paste; stir to combine.
3. Bring mixture to a boil, cover, reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender, 25 to 30 minutes.Peyton BeckwithCook’s NoteThis could be cooked in a crockpot. Just brown sausage, then add remaining ingredients to a slow cooker and cook on Low for 4 to 6 hours.

Title: Greek Stuffed Peppers—the Delicious All-in-One Meal We'll Make on Repeat
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/greek-stuffed-peppers-with-orzo-recipe-11714302
Ingredients:
- 1/2cuporzo
- 2ouncesfresh spinach
- 1teaspoonGreek seasoning
- 2teaspoonsvegetable oil
- 1smallonion, minced
- 2clovesgarlic, minced
- 8ouncesground beef
- 1cuptomato sauce, divided
- 1tablespoonslemon juice, or to taste
- 1/2teaspoonminced fresh mint, or to taste
- 3bell peppers
- 1/3cupcrumbled feta cheese, or as needed
- 2tablespoonspine nuts, or as needed
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C). Lightly grease a casserole dish.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
2. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil; add orzo and cook for exactly 6 minutes. Place spinach in a strainer. Pour orzo into the strainer over spinach.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
3. Transfer orzo and spinach to a mixing bowl and stir in Greek seasoning; set aside.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
4. Meanwhile, add oil to a heavy skillet, and heat over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add onion, garlic, and ground beef. Cook and stir ground beef until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in 1/2 cup tomato sauce.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
5. Add beef mixture to orzo mixture; add lemon juice and mint, and stir to combine. Taste; adjust lemon juice and mint to taste.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
6. Cut bell peppers in half lengthwise; carefully remove stem, seeds, and ribs. Stuff peppers with beef orzo mixture. Spread remaining 1/2 cup tomato sauce in the bottom of the prepared casserole dish. Place each stuffed pepper into the dish; cover with foil.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
7. Bake in the preheated oven until peppers are tender, about 40 minutes. Remove foil. Sprinkle pine nuts and feta cheese over peppers.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
8. Bake until pine nuts are lightly toasted, about 10 minutes more. Serve immediately.Allrecipes / Qi Ai

Title: Trader Joe's Lobster Casserole
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/trader-joe-s-lobster-casserole-recipe-11794906
Ingredients:
- 1poundpenne pasta
- 1(8 ounce) packagecream cheese,softened
- 1(16 ounce) containerTrader Joe's®lobster bisque
- 1(12 ounce) packageTrader Joe's®frozen langostino tails, thawed
- 1cuphalvedcherry tomatoes
- 1/4cupbutter
- 3clovesgarlic,minced
- 1cupKraft® shredded creamymozzarella cheese
- salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
- lemon wedges,freshly grated Parmesan cheese, and chopped fresh parsley for garnish (optional)
Instructions:
1. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add penne and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 11 minutes.
2. Drain penne and return pasta to the pot; place over medium-high heat, and stir in cream cheese and bisque. Season with salt and pepper, and continue to stir until well combined. Remove from heat.
3. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Add butter to a 9x13 baking dish and place into the oven while it preheats until butter is melted.
4. Remove baking dish from the oven; add langostino tails and garlic. Toss until garlic is fragrant and golden brown.
5. Add penne mixture and tomatoes to the baking dish and carefully toss all the ingredients until combined. Top with cheese.
6. Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and casserole is bubbly, 10 to 15 minutes.
7. Garnish with a squeeze of lemon juice, a sprinkling of Parmesan and fresh parsley.Peyton Beckwith

Title: The Best Garlic Knots—No-Knead, No-Rise!
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/garlic-knots-recipe-11701932
Ingredients:
- 1 ¾cupsself-rising flour, plus more for kneading
- ¾teaspoongarlic powder, divided
- ½teaspoonsalt, divided
- ¼teaspoonItalian seasoning
- 1cupplain whole-milk Greek-style yogurt
- 1tablespoonunsalted butter, melted
- 1tablespoonolive oil
- ½teaspoondried parsley
- flaky sea salt, for garnish
Instructions:
1. Gather ingredients. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone baking mat.Allrecipes/Kim Shupe
2. Stir together flour, 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and Italian seasoning in a bowl. Stir in yogurt until mixture forms a shaggy dough.Allrecipes/Kim Shupe
3. Transfer dough to a well-floured work surface. Knead until mostly smooth, 3 to 4 minutes. If needed, add additional flour 1 teaspoon at a time to keep dough from being too sticky.Allrecipes/Kim Shupe
4. Shape dough into a ball; press down gently to form a disk. Divide disk into 8 even wedges (a bench scraper is handy). Roll each wedge into a rope about 10 inches long.Allrecipes/Kim Shupe
5. Tie each into a knot. Arrange knots about 2 inches apart on the prepared baking sheet.Allrecipes/Kim Shupe
6. Bake until knots are lightly browned, about 15 minutes.Allrecipes/Kim Shupe
7. Meanwhile, whisk together melted butter, oil, parsley, remaining 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt in a small bowl.Allrecipes/Kim Shupe
8. Brush still-warm knots with butter mixture and sprinkle with flaky salt. Cool 5 minutes before serving. Store cooled knots in an airtight container at room temperature up to 2 days.Allrecipes/Kim ShupeRecipe developed by Nicole Hopper

========================================

Title: Maple-Cider Slaw with Air-Fried Apples and Potatoes
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/maple-cider-slaw-with-air-fried-apples-and-potatoes-recipe-11793256
Ingredients:
- 1extra-largerusset potato, peeled and sliced 1/8 inch thick
- 2 teaspoonsplus 1/4cupvegetable oil
- 1/2teaspoonsalt
- 1/2teaspoonfreshly groundblack pepper
- 2apples,cut into 1/2-inch-thick wedges
- 3tablespoonscider vinegar
- 2tablespoonspuremaple syrup
- 7cupsshredded red and/orgreen cabbage
Instructions:
1. Preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 5 minutes. Toss potatoes with 2 teaspoons oil and 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper in a medium bowl. Transfer to air fryer basket. Cook for 8 minutes. Meanwhile, toss apples with 2 teaspoons oil in a bowl. Add to basket with potatoes; toss. Cook until potatoes are browned and tender, about 8 minutes more.
2. For slaw, whisk together vinegar, maple syrup, remaining 1/4 cup oil and 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper in a large bowl. Add cabbage and toss to coat. Serve potatoes and apples with slaw.

Title: Chicken Sorrentino
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/chicken-sorrentino-recipe-11787321
Ingredients:
- 1mediumeggplant
- 4tablespoonsextra virgin olive oil, divided
- 3/4teaspoonsalt, divided
- 3/4teaspoonfreshlyground black pepper, divided
- 1/4cupall purpose flour
- 4(5-ounce)chicken cutlets
- 1/4cupfinely choppedonion
- 2clovesgarlic, minced
- 1/2cupchicken stock
- 1/4cupmarsala wine
- 1(15-ounce) cancrushed tomatoes
- 4slicesprosciutto
- 1/2cupshredded fontina cheese
- 1/4cupfinely shreddedPecorino Romano cheese
- chopped fresh basil, for ganish
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
2. Slice eggplant lengthwise into four 1/4-inch thick slices. Reserve remaining eggplant for another use.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
3. Brush eggplant slices evenly with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Evenly season with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Set on the prepared baking sheet.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
4. Roast in the preheated oven until tender and lightly browned, 20 to 22 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
5. Add flour to a large shallow bowl. Season chicken with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Dredge chicken in flour until fully coated.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
6. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a 12-inch oven-proof skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken breasts to skillet and cook until lightly browned, 3 to 4 minutes. Flip and cook other side until lightly browned, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove chicken from skillet; set aside.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
7. Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in the skillet. Add onion and cook over medium heat until softened, about 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
8. Pour chicken stock and marsala wine into the skillet. Bring to a boil and cook until liquid is reduced by half, scraping any browned bits from the bottom of the skillet, about 4 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
9. Reduce heat and add crushed tomatoes. Season with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Simmer until sauce comes together, about 5 minutes. Reserve 1/4 cup sauce.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
10. Return chicken to the skillet. Top each chicken breast with 1 slice prosciutto, 1 slice cooked eggplant (folding to fit, if needed), 1 tablespoon reserved sauce, 2 tablespoons shredded fontina cheese, and 1 tablespoon grated Pecorino Romano.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
11. Transfer skillet to the oven and bake until cheese is melted and chicken is cooked through (165 degrees F or 74 degrees C), about 10 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
12. Serve topped with chopped herbs.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel GrecoRecipe developed by Barrett Heald

========================================

Title: Creamy Tomato Chicken and White Beans
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/creamy-tomato-chicken-and-white-beans-recipe-11790632
Ingredients:
- 1tablespoonolive oil
- 6bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs (about 2 1/2 pounds)
- 3/4teaspoonsalt, divided
- 1cupchoppedonion
- 3clovesgarlic, minced
- 1/3cupdrywhite wine or reduced sodium chicken broth
- 2(15-ounce) canscannellini beans, rinsed and drained
- 1pintgrape tomatoes
- 1/2cupreduced sodium chicken broth
- 2teaspoonschoppedfresh oregano, plus more for garnish
- 1/4teaspooncrushed red pepper
- 1/3cupshredded Parmesan cheese
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
2. Heat oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Season chicken with 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add chicken to skillet. Cook until browned, 4 to 5 minutes per side. Remove from skillet.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
3. Add onion to the skillet. Cook and stir over medium heat until tender, 5 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
4. Add garlic to skillet. Cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
5. Pour in wine and stir to break up any browned bits from the bottom of the skillet. Simmer until wine has nearly evaporated, 2 to 3 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
6. Add beans, tomatoes, broth, oregano, crushed red pepper, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt  to the skillet. Bring to a boil. Return chicken to the skillet. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer until chicken is done (175 degrees F or 80 degrees C), tomatoes begin to break down, and the bean mixture is creamy, about 20 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
7. If desired, lightly mash some of the beans in the skillet to absorb some of the liquid.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
8. Garnish with Parmesan cheese and additional oregano.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell

========================================

Title: Zucchini Corn Chowder
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/zucchini-corn-chowder-recipe-11814949
Ingredients:
- 2slicesbacon, diced
- 1/2cupdicedwhite onion
- 2garlic cloves,minced
- 1/4cupdicedcelery
- 1 1/2cupsdiced peeledYukon gold potatoes
- 1quartchicken bone broth
- 1/4teaspoonred pepper flakes
- 3earssweetcorn, kernels cut from the cob, or more to taste
- 4 1/2tablespoonsunsalted butter
- 1/4cupall-purpose flour
- 1/3cupheavycream
- 2/3cup2% high protein milk, such as Fa!rLife®
- 1zucchini, halved lenghtwise and sliced into half moons
- 1/4teaspoondried thyme
- salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Instructions:
1. In a large stock pot, cook bacon until crisp over medium-high heat, about 7 minutes. Remove pot from heat. Remove bacon on a plate lined with paper towels.
2. Add onion and celery to bacon fat in the pot and cook over medium heat until vegetables begin to take on color, about 10 minutes. Add garlic; cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes, stirring continuously. Add potatoes, bone broth, and red pepper flakes and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 10 minutes.
3. Stir in half the corn kernels and cook for a few minutes.
4. Melt butter in a small saucepan; whisk in flour until smooth. Cook over low heat, whisking constantly, about 5 minutes. Slowly whisk in cream and milk; pour into corn mixture. Cook soup for 5 minutes over medium heat and stir well. Allow soup to cool slightly; blend until smooth with an immersion blender.
5. Add remaining corn, bacon, zucchini, and thyme; bring to a low simmer, and cook until the zucchini is tender, about 5 minutes. Taste; season with salt and pepper.

========================================

Title: Caramelized Zucchini Pasta
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/caramelized-zucchini-pasta-recipe-11784765
Ingredients:
- 3tablespoonsolive oil
- 4garlic cloves, minced
- 1/4teaspoonred pepper flakes
- 1 1/2poundszucchini, trimmed and grated on the large holes of a box grater
- salt and freshly cracked black pepperas needed
- 1poundcurly or tube-shapedpasta, such as fusilli or rigatoni
- 1/2cupgrated finely grated Parmesan cheese or Pecorinoplus more for serving
- 1tablespooncoldbutter(optional)
- lemon zest(optional)
- fresh basil(optional)
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
2. Heat olive oil in a large cast iron skillet or heavy-bottomed Dutch oven over medium heat. When warm, add garlic and red pepper flakes and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add zucchini and season with 1 teaspoon salt and cracked black pepper. You may have to add zucchini in batches if it doesn't all fit in the pan.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
3. Stir every few minutes until zucchini is softened and liquid is drawn out of it, 5 to 10 minutes. Continue to cook until liquid is evaporated, and zucchini starts to brown, 10 to 15 minutes more.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
4. Meanwhile, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook pasta for 1 to 2 minutes less than the package states for al dente pasta. Reserve 1 cup pasta water, then drain pasta; set aside.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
5. Turn heat under the skillet to medium-low, and stir zucchini frequently in the final 5 to 10 minutes of cooking. As zucchini caramelizes, it may start to stick to the bottom of the pan. You can loosen it by adding a little more olive oil or a few tablespoons of water; use a wooden spoon to release the browned bits (or fond) on the bottom of the pan. Zucchini is done when it starts to clump together, and looks darkened in color and slightly browned.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
6. Turn heat down to low and add pasta to the skillet along with about 1/2 cup pasta water; stir to combine. Add cheese slowly; stir and add pasta water as needed if it gets too thick. When cheese is well incorporated, add butter, and stir until glossy and smooth. Season with salt and pepper.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
7. Garnish with black pepper, more cheese, lemon zest, and chopped fresh basil.Allrecipes / Qi Ai

========================================

Title: Sheet Pan Chicken with Apple-Honey Glaze
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/sheet-pan-chicken-with-apple-honey-glaze-recipe-11790628
Ingredients:
- 10ouncesrainbow or regularbaby carrots with tops - trimmed, peeled if needed, and halved lengthwise
- 1tablespoonolive oil
- 3/4teaspoonsalt
- 1/2teaspoonblack pepper
- 1/4cupapple jelly
- 1tablespoonhoney
- 1tablespoonDijon mustard
- 1/2teaspooncinnamon, plus more for garnish
- 2(6- to 8-ounces)boneless skinless chicken breasts, halved horizontally
- 2mediumapples, sliced
- sliced green onion, for garnish
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Arrange carrots in an even layer on one side of a 10x15-inch rimmed baking sheet. (If you like, for easy cleanup, line pan with foil.) Drizzle carrots with oil and sprinkle with 1/4 tsp. each salt and pepper; toss to coat. Roast 15 minutes.Meanwhile, for glaze, stir together apple jelly, honey, mustard, cinnamon, and 1/4 tsp. salt in a small bowl. Sprinkle chicken with remaining 1/4 tsp. each salt and pepper. Add apples in side of pan with carrots; drizzle with half of glaze and toss lightly to coat. Arrange chicken on other side; spoon remaining glaze over chicken.
3. Roast, turning halfway through, 10 to 15 minutes, or until carrots and apples are tender and an instant-read thermometer inserted into thickest parts of chicken registers 165°F. Drizzle with any glaze remaining in pan. Garnish with green onion and additional cinnamon.Recipe TipIf you prefer dark meat, you can substitute 4 boneless, skinless chicken thighs for the 2 chicken breasts (no need to halve them). Roast until the chicken thighs register 170 degrees F (76 degrees C).

========================================

Title: Veggie Breakfast Egg Bake
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/veggie-breakfast-egg-bake-recipe-11785580
Ingredients:
- 3Yukon Gold potatoes(about1pound), chopped into ¼-inch pieces
- 1tablespoonextra-virgin olive oil
- 1/2teaspoonsea salt
- freshlyground black pepper
- 12largeeggs
- 1cupmilk, any kind
- 1 1/4teaspoonssea salt
- 2tablespoonsextra-virgin olive oil, plus more for greasing
- 1/2yellow onion, chopped
- freshlyground black pepper
- 1red bell pepper, chopped
- 1green bell pepper, chopped
- 2garlic cloves, minced
- 1cupfresh spinach, roughly chopped
- 4green onions, chopped, divided
- 1 1/2cupsgrated Cheddar cheese
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients and preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (218 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
2. Place potatoes on the baking sheet and toss with olive oil, salt, and several grinds of pepper. Spread out evenly on the baking sheet and roast until tender and browned, 20 to 25 minutes.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
3. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish with olive oil. Whisk together eggs, milk, and ¼ teaspoon salt in a large bowl. Set aside.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
4. Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and season with 1 teaspoon salt, and several grinds of pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until onion is soft and translucent, 5 to 8 minutes. Add bell peppers and garlic; cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 minutes. Add spinach and ½ of the green onions and toss until spinach is just wilted.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
5. Spread out potatoes in an even layer in the prepared baking dish. Top with 1 cup Cheddar cheese, followed by the sautéed veggies. Pour egg mixture on top and sprinkle with remaining ½ cup Cheddar cheese and green onions.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
6. Bake in the preheated oven until eggs are set, 40 to 45 minutes.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
7. Let stand for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.Allrecipes / Qi Ai

========================================

Title: Apple-Grape Salad with Pecan-Crusted Goat Cheese
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/apple-grape-salad-with-pecan-crusted-goat-cheese-recipe-11790586
Ingredients:
- 1(8-ounce) loggoat cheese, softened
- 1teaspoonherbes de Provence or Italian seasoning
- 1 2/3cupspecan pieces
- 4tablespoonsbutter
- 1 1/4teaspoonssalt
- 1poundseedless red grapes
- 1mediumonion, cut into thin wedges
- 2tablespoonsdrywhite wine
- 1teaspoonchoppedfresh thymeor1/4teaspoondried thyme
- 1/2cupextra virgin olive oil
- 3tablespoonswhite balsamic vinegar
- 1tablespoonDijon mustard
- 1teaspoonhoney
- 1/2teaspoonblack pepper
- 1headred leaf or Bibb lettuce, torn into bite-sized pieces
- 2mediumRed Delicious apples, thinly sliced
Instructions:
1. Stir together goat cheese and herbes de Provence in a small bowl. Roll into 2 (4-inch) logs. Chill, covered, until ready to use.
2. Cook pecan pieces, 2 tablespoons butter, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a very large skillet over medium heat, stirring frequently, until pecans are toasted, about 5 minutes. Cool completely. Finely chop 1 cup pecans and spread in a shallow baking dish.
3. Slice each log into 6 slices. Roll slices in finely chopped pecans. Chill until ready to serve. (To serve goat cheese warm, see footnote below.)
4. Wipe out skillet. Add grapes, onion, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and remaining 2 tablespoons butter. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until onion is tender and grapes have started to blister, 5 to 7 minutes. Add wine and thyme. Simmer until wine is reduced and grapes are coated, about 1 minute.
5. For vinaigrette, put oil, vinegar, mustard, honey, pepper, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt in a screw-top jar. Cover and shake well.
6. Put lettuce in a large bowl. Drizzle 1/3 cup vinaigrette over lettuce, tossing to coat. Divide among 4 serving plates. Top with grapes, onion, apples, goat cheese, and remaining pecans. Serve with remaining dressing.

========================================

Title: Sheet Pan Lemon Chicken with Potatoes and Leeks
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/sheet-pan-lemon-chicken-with-potatoes-and-leeks-recipe-11811245
Ingredients:
- 2poundsbone-in, skin-onchicken thighs
- 1 1/2poundsbabyYukon gold potatoes
- 2largeleeks
- 1/4cupolive oil
- 2lemons (1 zested, 2 juiced)
- 4clovesgarlic, minced
- 1teaspoonDijon mustard
- 1teaspoonsalt
- 1/2teaspoonfreshlyground black pepper
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
2. Slice baby potatoes in half. If they are a bit large, cut into quarters. Slice white and light green parts of leeks into 1/2-inch thick rounds and rinse thoroughly. Pat chicken thighs dry.
3. Pour 2 tablespoons olive oil onto a large sheet pan and place in the oven to preheat for 2 to 3 minutes. Carefully remove the pan from the oven and add baby potatoes, cut side down.
4. Bake potatoes in the preheated oven to start cooking while you prepare the chicken, about 15 minutes
5. Meanwhile, in a large bowl, combine remaining olive oil, zest of 1 lemon, juice of 2 lemons, minced garlic, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper. Place chicken thighs and leeks in marinade and toss to coat; marinate for 10 to 15 minutes while potatoes cook.
6. Remove sheet pan from oven, toss potatoes on the pan and move them to the sides to create room for the chicken thighs.
7. Using tongs, place chicken thighs, skin side up, on the sheet pan. Arrange leeks around the pan and pour remaining marinade in the bowl all over potatoes and leeks.
8. Roast until chicken is no longer pink at the center and juices run clear, 35 to 40 minutes. An instant read thermometer inserted near the center should reach 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).Peyton BeckwithCook’s NotePotatoes should be in about 2 inch chunks. You can use large potatoes and cut them to size. No need to peel yukon gold potatoes. You can also use red potatoes, fingerling, or purple potatoes. If using russet potatoes, it would be best to peel them.

========================================

Title: Philly Cheesesteak Casserole
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/philly-cheesesteak-casserole-recipe-11786868
Ingredients:
- 16ouncesbowtie pasta
- 3tablespoonsolive oil, divided
- 1poundground beef
- 1poblano pepper or green bell pepper, thinly sliced
- 1red or yellow bellpepper, thinly sliced
- 1cupthinly slicedsweet onion
- 2clovesgarlic, minced
- 1teaspoondried oregano
- 3/4teaspoonsalt
- 1/4teaspooncrushed red pepper
- 3tablespoonsall purpose flour
- 1(14.5-ounce) canlower sodiumbeef broth
- 1(8-ounce) packagecream cheese, softened and cut up
- 1 1/2cupsshreddedprovolone cheese, divided
- 1cupsoftbread crumbs
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
2. Cook pasta according to package directions; drain. Add to the prepared baking dish.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
3. Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon of the oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium heat. Add ground beef, and cook for 4 minutes. Add peppers and onions. Cook until beef is browned and vegetables are tender, about 8 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
4. Season with garlic, oregano, salt and crushed red pepper. Cook until fragrant, 1 minute. Dust with flour and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
5. Mix in broth, and bring to a boil, stirring, until thickened and bubbly.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
6. Add cream cheese to the skillet. Cook and stir until melted.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
7. Stir in 1 cup provolone cheese until melted.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
8. Add mixture to the baking dish; stir to combine. Top with remaining 1/2 cup provolone cheese.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
9. Toss bread crumbs with remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil in a small bowl to coat. Spread over the mixture.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
10. Bake until browned and bubbly, 20 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
