Title: Pumpkin Chai Latte Bars
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/pumpkin-chai-latte-bars-recipe-11801788
Ingredients:
- 1 1/2cupshalf and half
- 3chai tea bags(such as Twinings® Chai)
- 1/2cupunsalted butter, softened
- 1/4cupwhite sugar
- 1teaspoonvanilla extract
- 1pinchsalt
- 1cupall-purpose flour
- 1(15 ounce) canpumpkin puree(not pie filling)
- 1/2cupfirmly packedlight brown sugar
- 1/4cupwhite sugar
- 1teaspoonvanilla extract
- 1teaspoonground cinnamon
- 1teaspoongroundcardamom
- 1/2teaspoonsalt
- 1/2teaspoonground ginger
- 1/4teaspoonground nutmeg
- 1/8teaspoonground cloves
- 1/8teaspoonground allspice
- 2largeeggs, at room temperature
Instructions:
1. Place half-and-half in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook until mixture just begins to simmer, 5 to 7 minutes, stirring often. Remove pan from heat and add in chai tea bags. Allow mixture to steep, stirring occasionally, for about 15 minutes.
2. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Line an 8x8-inch square pan with enough parchment paper to have overhang on all sides.
3. For crust, beat butter, white sugar, vanilla and salt together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth and combined. Add in flour and beat on low speed until mixture comes together to form a soft dough. Press dough firmly and evenly into the bottom of the prepared pan.
4. Bake in the preheated oven and until crust looks just set, 10 to 12 minutes. Allow to cool 5 minutes.
5. Meanwhile, for filling, in the same bowl you used for crust (no need to wipe out the bowl), beat together pumpkin, brown sugar, white sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, cardamom, salt, ginger, nutmeg, cloves, and allspice with an electric mixer until smooth and combined.
6. Remove tea bags from half-and-half mixture. Squeeze bags to remove as much moisture from them as possible; then discard tea bags. With the mixer running on low speed, gradually pour half-and-half mixture into pumpkin mixture; beat until all is thoroughly incorporated. Add in eggs and beat on low speed until just incorporated. Once crust has cooled for 5 minutes, pour filling evenly over the top.
7. Bake in the preheated oven until bars are puffed and there is only a slight jiggle in the center of the filling, 50 to 55 minutes. Allow bars to cool completely to room temperature, then refrigerate until chilled, at least 4 hours to overnight.
8. Once bars have chilled, lift them out of the pan using the parchment overhang. Cut into 12 bars.
9. If desired, served topped with a lightly sweetened whipped cream and an extra sprinkle of cinnamon.

========================================

Title: Pissaladière (Southern French “Pizza”)
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/pissaladiere-southern-french-pizza-recipe-11787803
Ingredients:
- 1 1/4cupswater
- 1teaspoondry active "rapid rise" yeast
- 1tablespoonolive oil, plus more for greasing parchment
- 3cupsall-purpose flour
- 1 1/2teaspoonskosher salt
- 4ouncesolive oil-packed anchovy filets
- 2tablespoonsolive oil
- 4tablespoonsunsalted butter
- 5largeyellow onions- peeled, halved, and thinly sliced
- 1/2teaspoonkosher salt
- 6fresh thymesprigs
- 2tablespoonssherry vinegar
- 1/4teaspoonfreshlyground black pepper
- 20pittedKalamata or Nicoiseolives, rinsed well, halved lengthwise
- finely chopped chives,for garnish (optional)
Instructions:
1. For dough, add water and yeast to a bowl; let stand for 10 minutes. Stir in olive oil, flour, and salt, and knead until a very sticky, elastic dough is formed, about 4 minutes. Cover and let rise in a warm spot until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
2. Punch down dough to remove the air bubbles, and transfer to a floured work surface. Form into a smooth ball of dough.
3. Grease a parchment paper sheet with olive oil; and transfer dough onto the sheet; grease another parchment sheet and lay it on top of the dough. Press out dough with your hands to form a rectangle, then switch to a rolling pin and roll dough out to cover nearly the entire surface of the paper.
4. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (235 degrees C). Transfer dough with both sheets of parchment onto a sheet pan. Carefully peel off the top sheet of paper, and then use a fork to prick the dough all over.
5. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Remove to cool on a rack; set aside until needed.
6. Transfer anchovies into a bowl and cover with 4 cups of cold water. Gently separate the fillets and let soak for 1 hour. Water may be changed halfway through to remove more salt from anchovies. Drain and pat dry on paper towels.
7. For caramelized onions, add butter and olive oil to a heavy-bottomed pot, and place over medium-high heat. Add onions and salt, and toss occasionally with a spatula, until onions just begin to slump down in the pot. Reduce heat to medium, cover, and cook for 10 minutes.
8. Uncover; reduce heat to medium low. Cook, stirring occasionally, until onions are a light golden brown, about 1 hour. Add thyme, sherry vinegar, and black pepper. For a slightly more intense version, a few anchovy fillets can be added to the onions at this point. Cook, stirring, for another 10 to 15 minutes. Turn off heat and let cool.
9. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (235 degrees C).
10. Line a baking sheet with a fresh sheet of parchment, and grease with olive oil. Place crust on the prepared sheet. For a crispier edge, brush 1-inch of the outside edge of dough with olive oil. Spread caramelized onions over crust, going nearly to the edge.
11. Place half of the anchovies in diagonal rows, spaced a couple inches apart, on top of the onions, then place the other half of anchovies in diagonal rows in the other direction to form the classic pissaladiere decoration. Place an olive half inside each opening in the grid formed by anchovies.
12. Bake in the preheated oven until edges of the crust are browned, and the bottom is golden, about 25 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to ool for about 5 minutes. Cut in squares and serve.John MitzewichChef's NotePie crust dough or frozen puff pastry can also be used for this, following the same procedure.Fresh marinated anchovies, also known as boquerones, can also be used instead of olive oil-packed anchovies.

========================================

Title: Chopped Chili Garlic Green Beans
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/chopped-chili-garlic-green-beans-recipe-11786299
Ingredients:
- 1tablespoonvegetable oil
- 2(1-pound) bagsfresh green beans, chopped
- 1cupchoppedgreen onions
- 1lime,zested and juiced, divided
- 1tablespoonssoy sauce
- 2clovesgarlic, minced, or more to taste
- 1teaspoonwhite sugar
- 1/2teaspoonsea salt
- 1teaspoonchili crisp
- 1teaspoontoasted sesame seeds,for garnish
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add green beans and green onions. Cook, stirring often, until green beans begin to turn bright green and slightly char, about 5 minutes. Season with lime juice, soy sauce, garlic, sugar, and salt and continue cooking until sauce starts to thicken, about 2 minutes; remove from heat.
2. Add chili crisp, lime zest, and sesame seeds to green beans and toss well before serving. Serve immediately or chill before serving.Peyton Beckwith

Title: This Copycat Pumpkin Cold Foam Tastes ‘Even Better Than Starbucks,’ According to Our Test Kitchen
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/pumpkin-cream-cold-foam-recipe-11803001
Ingredients:
- 1/4cupheavy whipping cream
- 2tablespoons2% reduced-fat milk
- 2tablespoonsvanilla syrup
- 1tablespooncanned pumpkin puree
- 1/8teaspoonpumpkin pie spice, plus more for dusting
Instructions:
1. Place heavy cream, milk, vanilla syrup, pumpkin puree, and pumpkin pie spice in a small measuring cup or jug. Using a handheld milk frother, froth until thick and creamy, about 1 minute.Dotdash Meredith Food StudiosRecipe TipIf you don't have a handheld frother, you can use a blender, immersion blender, or mini food processor, but results can vary. If you want to make cold foam often at home, it's worth investing in a handheld frother for the best results.
2. Pour desired amount of Pumpkin Cream Cold Foam over your iced drink of choice. Dust with additional pumpkin pie spice. Serve immediately.From the Test Kitchen"Creamy, sweet, with lots of warm spices and a hint of pumpkin. This version is a little less sweet than the original from Starbucks and feels a little less rich (less like drinking melted ice cream), but the flavor notes are all the same." —Nicole Hopper, Recipe Developer

Title: Jalapeno Spinach Dip
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/jalapeno-spinach-dip-recipe-11813685
Ingredients:
- 1tablespoonbutter or olive oil
- 2green onions, sliced, white part only
- 2freshjalapenos, seeded and chopped
- 1teaspoonminced garlic
- 1(8 ounce) bagfresh spinach,chopped
- 1teaspoonGreens seasoning,or more to taste
- 2tablespoonswater
- 1(8 ounce) packagecream cheese, softened
- 1/2cupmayonnaise
- 1/2cupshredded Parmesan, plus more for topping
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).Allrecipes / Qi Ai
2. Heat butter or olive oil in a cast iron skillet over medium heat. Add green onions, jalapenos, and garlic; cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
3. Add spinach, greens seasoning, and water. Cook and stir until spinach is wilted, about 3 minutes.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
4. Stir cream cheese and mayonnaise together in a separate bowl; stir in spinach and Parmesan cheese. Spread evenly into an oven safe dish. Sprinkle with a little Parmesan.Allrecipes / Qi Ai
5. Bake in the preheated oven until hot and bubbly, 20 to 30 minutes.Allrecipes / Qi Ai

Title: Garlic Butter Chicken Cutlets
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/garlic-butter-chicken-cutlets-recipe-11793804
Ingredients:
- 1 1/2teaspoonssalt
- 3/4teaspoonfreshly ground black pepper
- 2teaspoonsdriedItalian herb seasoning
- 6(4 ounce)chicken breast cutlets
- 1tablespoonolive oil
- 2tablespoonsunsalted butter
- 1 1/2tablespoonsminced freshgarlic
- 1/2cuplow-sodium chicken broth
- fresh parsley, for garnish (optional)
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga
2. Stir salt, black pepper, and Italian seasoning together in a small bowl.Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga
3. Pat each cutlet dry with paper towels. If cutlets are thick on one end, lightly pound thicker parts for more even cooking. Sprinkle cutlets on both sides with salt and herb mixture.Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga
4. Heat oil and butter together in a large skillet over medium-high heat until oil is hot and butter is melted. As the skillet heats, you may need to turn the heat down to medium.Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga
5. Place cutlets into the skillet in a single layer, working in batches if necessary, and cook just until browned on both sides, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Remove chicken from the skillet to a plate; keep warm.Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga
6. To the same skillet, add garlic and stir, scraping up any browned bits, and cook, stirring, just until garlic is fragrant, about 30 seconds. Quickly stir in chicken stock and bring mixture to a boil, 2 to 3 minutes.Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga
7. Add browned chicken tenders and any accumulated juices back to the skillet, turning to coat each tender in the sauce. Cook until chicken is no longer pink at the center and juices run clear. An instant read thermometer inserted near the center should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C),Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga
8. Remove chicken to a serving platter. Simmer juices in the pan until reduced further, 1 to 2 minutes. Pour pan sauce over chicken; garnish with fresh parsley.Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga

Title: “Cacio e Pepe” Corn Chowder
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/cacio-e-pepe-corn-chowder-recipe-11795105
Ingredients:
- 4cupsfreshcorn, cut from 4 large ears, cobs reserved
- 4cupschicken broth
- 2cupswater
- 2tablespoonsolive oil
- 4ouncespancetta,diced
- 2tablespoonsbutter
- 1cupdicedonion
- 1/2cupdicedcelery
- 3clovesgarlic,minced
- 1/3cupall-purpose flour
- 3/4cupwhole milk
- 1pinchcayenne pepper(optional)
- 1/3cupfreshly slicedgreen onion tops, plus more for garnish (optional)
- 1tablespoonground black pepper,or to taste, plus more for garnish
- 1cuppecorino Romano cheese,or to taste, plus more for garnish
Instructions:
1. Cut corn kernels off the cobs into a bowl and set aside. Add cobs to broth and water in a saucepan, and bring to simmer over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer gently for 1 hour. Remove from heat; set aside.
2. Add olive oil and pancetta to a soup pot and set over medium heat. Cook, stirring, until the pancetta fat renders, and pancetta begins to get crisp, about 4 minutes. Remove a few tablespoons and set aside to garnish the top.
3. Raise the heat to medium-high, and add butter, onions, celery, and garlic. Stir to combine. Add a large pinch of salt; cook and stir until vegetables soften, and onions turn translucent, 3 to 4 minutes.
4. Add in flour, and cook for about 2 minutes, stirring occasionally. Whisk in milk, and keep whisking until a thick paste forms. Pour in reserved corncob broth, and whisk to combine; discard corncobs.
5. Return soup to a simmer, whisking occasionally, then reduce heat to medium-low, and cook for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add a pinch of cayenne pepper if desired. Stir in fresh corn kernels, and increase heat to medium. Cook, stirring occasionally, until corn is as tender as you like, about 10 minutes.
6. Turn off the heat; add in sliced green onions, black pepper, and cheese. Stir everything together until evenly combined. Taste for seasoning and adjust with more salt, pepper, or cheese if desired.
7. Ladle chowder into bowls, and top with more green onion, black pepper, and cheese; sprinkle reserved pancetta on top.John MitzewichChef's NoteFor another optional garnish, set aside a few spoonfuls of fresh corn, and saute for just a few minutes. Sprinkle over the finished soup.You can also make this chowder vegetarian. Just omit the pancetta and caramelize some diced mushrooms in their place.

========================================

Title: Sheet Pan Orange Chicken and Broccoli
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/sheet-pan-orange-chicken-and-broccoli-recipe-11787317
Ingredients:
- cooking spray
- 1poundskinless,boneless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized chunks
- 2tablespoonsolive oil, divided
- 3/4teaspoonsalt, divided
- 3/4teaspoonground black pepper, divided
- 1/4cupall purpose flour
- 4cupsbroccoli florets
- 1cupfresh orange juice(about 3 large oranges)
- 1/4cupreduced-sodium soy sauce
- 1tablespooncornstarch
- 1tablespoonhoney or brown sugar
- 1tablespoonrice vinegar
- 1tablespoonSriracha
- 2clovesgarlic, minced
- 1teaspoontoasted sesame oil
- 1teaspoongratedfresh ginger
- cooked white rice, for serving
- orange slices (optional)
- sesame seeds (optional)
- orange zest (optional)
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a 13x18-inch baking sheet with foil. Coat with cooking spray.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
2. Toss together chicken, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper in a large bowl until coated.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
3. Sprinkle chicken with flour and toss to coat.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
4. Transfer chicken to one side of the prepared baking sheet in a single layer.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
5. Add broccoli to the other side of the baking sheet. Drizzle with remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil and toss to coat. Season broccoli with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
6. Bake until chicken is cooked and broccoli is lightly browned, 12 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
7. Meanwhile, whisk together orange juice, soy sauce, cornstarch, honey, rice vinegar, Sriracha, garlic, sesame oil, and ginger in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring often, until sauce thickens, 4 to 5 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
8. Toss together chicken and broccoli on the baking sheet and spread in an even layer. Pour sauce over the chicken and broccoli. Bake an additional 5 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
9. Serve over cooked white rice. Garnish with orange zest and/or orange slices and sesame seeds, if desired.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel GrecoRecipe developed by Barrett Heald.

Title: Jalapeño Popper Smashed Tacos
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/jalapeno-popper-smashed-tacos-recipe-11785758
Ingredients:
- 6slicesbacon
- 1poundground sirloin or ground round beef
- 1/2cupfinely chopped jalapeños
- 1/2teaspoongarlic powder
- 3/4teaspoonsalt
- 1 1/2cupsshredded Cheddar cheese,divided
- 10(6 inch)flour tortillas
- 2ouncescream cheese,softened
- 1/2cupsour cream
- 1tablespoonlime juice
- 1/4cupchopped cilantro, or as needed
- 1cupshredded lettuce, or as needed
Instructions:
1. Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 7 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels. Crumble when cool enough to handle.
2. Combine ground beef with jalapeños, garlic powder, salt, crumbled bacon, and 3/4 cup shredded cheese in a bowl. Spread beef mixture to the edges of each tortilla; set aside.
3. Preheat a griddle to medium-high heat. Meanwhile, mix cream cheese with sour cream, lime juice, and salt and set aside.
4. Place tacos meat-side down on hot griddle. Cook, undisturbed, until golden brown and slightly crisp, about 3 minutes. Flip and cook until lightly toasted, 30 seconds to 1 minute more. Fold tacos in half and top with sour cream mixture, remaining cheese, cilantro, and shredded lettuce.Peyton Beckwith

Title: Tomato Butter
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/tomato-butter-recipe-11789508
Ingredients:
- 1poundcherry tomatoes, halved
- 1cupbutter, softened
- 2clovesgarlic
- 1/2tablespoonsugar
- 1/2teaspoonsalt, or more to taste
- 1/4teaspoonblack pepper, or more to taste
- 1tablespoonfresh basil, or more to taste
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients. Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga
2. Set cherry tomatoes on the prepared backing sheet, cut side up and broil until they start to char and become soft, 5 to 8 minutes.Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga
3. Combine tomatoes, butter, garlic, sugar, salt and pepper in a food processor and process until smooth. Let cool.Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga
4. Once cooled, add basil leaves and process again.Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga

Title: One-Pan Sausage Gnocchi
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/one-pan-sausage-gnocchi-recipe-11794015
Ingredients:
- 2teaspoonsunsalted butter
- 1(12 oounce) packagegarlic and herbchicken sausage,sliced diagonally
- 14ouncesfrozen gnocchi
- 2tablespoonschicken bone broth
- 1clovegarlic,minced
- 2tablespoonsheavy cream
- 1/2cuptornspinach
Instructions:
1. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add sausage, and cook, stirring, until golden, about 5 minutes. Transfer sausage to a plate and keep warm.
2. Add gnocchi and chicken broth to the skillet; cover and cook for 4 minutes. Stir in whipping cream and spinach; cook until spinach is wilted, 1 to 2 minutes.
3. Return sausage to the skillet. Stir to combine. Serve immediately.Cook’s NoteYou can find frozen gnocchi at Trader Joe's. Target carries a 4-cheese frozen gnocchi.

Title: Ribollita (Tuscan Bread Soup)
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/ribollita-tuscan-bread-soup-recipe-11782482
Ingredients:
- 1clovegarlic, sliced
- 1pinchsalt
- 1/4cupolive oil
- 1(1 pound) loafItalian bread
- 2(15 ounce) canswhitecannellini beans,drained
- 1(28 ounce) canwhole peeled San Marzanotomatoes
- 2tablespoonsolive oil
- 1carrot,diced
- 2ribs celery, diced
- 1smallyellow onion, diced
- 3clovesgarlic, minced
- 1/4teaspoondried oregano
- 1/4teaspoondried thyme
- 1/4teaspoondried rosemary
- 1bay leaf
- 4cupschicken broth
- 1 1/2cupswater
- 2large buncheskale, tough ribs removed, roughly chopped
- 1/4cup choppedItalian parsley, plus more for serving
- 1/2teaspoonfreshlyground black pepper
- 1pinchcayenne
- 1 1/2teaspoonskosher salt, plus more to taste
- 1/4cupgratedParmigiano Reggiano cheese, plus more for serving
- 3tablespoonswhite wine vinegar, or freshly squeezed lemon juice, or to taste
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
2. Crush garlic and salt together in a mortar or small bowl, and stir in olive oil. Set aside.
3. Tear bread into about 2-inch pieces, and spread out on a baking sheet.  Drizzle over the garlic oil, and toss to combine.
4. Bake in the preheated oven until bread is dried out and getting crisp on the edges, 25 to 30 minutes.
5. Transfer 1 can beans into a mixing bowl, and mash with a potato masher until almost smooth. Add canned tomatoes, and use the masher to break into very small pieces. Set aside.
6. Add 2 tablespoons olive oil to a soup pot set over medium-high heat. Sauté onions, carrots, and celery with a big pinch of salt until onions start to turn translucent, about 4 minutes. Add garlic, oregano, thyme, rosemary, and bay leaf, and cook, stirring, for another minute.
7. Add chicken broth. Use about 1/2 cup water to rinse out the tomato can and add to the soup. Bring to simmer over high heat, then reduce to medium-low, and simmer for about 10 minutes.
8. Raise the heat back to high; when the soup is boiling, stir in kale and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
9. Add in parsley, remaining can of beans, crushed bean and tomato mixture, black pepper, and cayenne. Rinse the tomato bowl with about 1 cup water, and add that to the soup. Transfer in half the bread, and 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese. Stir everything to combine. When mixture comes back to a simmer, reduce heat to medium, and simmer until greens are very tender, stirring occasionally, about 15 minutes.
10. Taste for seasoning and add more salt if needed.
11. Turn off heat, and add half of the remaining bread to the top. Use a spoon or spatula to poke some bread into the surface.
12. Ladle soup into serving bowls; top with the extra toasted bread, a generous grating of Parmesan cheese, red chili flakes, freshly chopped parsley, and a drizzle of olive oil. Fresh lemon juice can also be squeezed over.John Mitzewich

========================================

Title: Garlic Butter Parmesan Chicken Meatloaf
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/garlic-butter-parmesan-chicken-meatloaf-recipe-11796238
Ingredients:
- 8clovesgarlic, minced, divided
- 1/4cupmincedonion
- 1largeegg
- 1largeegg yolk
- 1/3cuphalf and half
- 3tablespoonsfinely choppedfresh parsley
- 3/4cupgrated Parmesan cheese, divided
- 1poundground chicken
- 1pounduncooked Italian chicken sausage, casings removed
- 1 1/4teaspoonskosher salt
- 1/2teaspoonpepper
- 1/2cupItalian breadcrumbs
- 1/4cupwhite wine
- 1cupchicken broth
- 6tablespoonscoldbutter, cut into cubes
- 1/4teaspooncrushed red pepper
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Lightly grease a loaf pan.
2. Combine 6 cloves garlic, onion, egg, egg yolk, half and half, 2 tablespoons parsley and 1/4 cup grated Parmesan in a bowl; mix until well combined. Add ground chicken, sausage, 1 teaspoon salt, and pepper; mix until combined.  Fold in breadcrumbs until evenly mixed and form into a loaf shape.
3. Transfer mixture into the prepared pan and sprinkle the top evenly with 1 1/2 tablespoons Parmesan cheese.
4. Bake in the preheated oven until the internal temperature reaches 165 degrees F (73 degrees C), 35 to 40 minutes. Let rest while the sauce is prepared.
5. Meanwhile, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Add remaining 2 cloves garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Pour in wine and broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until reduced by about 3/4 (you should have about 1/3 cup remaining).
6. Turn off heat and gradually whisk in cubed butter. Stir in remaining Parmesan cheese and parsley. Season with remaining salt and crushed red pepper flakes.
7. Slice meatloaf and serve drizzled with garlic butter sauce.Peyton Beckwith

========================================

Title: Peach and Mango Habanero Chicken Thighs
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/peach-and-mango-habanero-chicken-thighs-recipe-11804525
Ingredients:
- 2 1/2poundsskinless, boneless chicken thighs
- 1/2teaspoonsalt
- 1/2teaspoonfreshlyground black pepper
- 1teaspoonsmoked paprika
- 3/4teaspoongranulated garlic
- 3/4teaspoongranulated onion
- 3/4cuppeach preserves
- 1/4cupmango ginger habanero sauce, such as Fischer & Wieser®, or more to taste
- 1lemon, zested
- fresh parsley sprigsand lemon slices for garnish (optional)
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C), and cover a sheet pan with foil or parchment. Place chicken thighs on a work surface and blot with paper towels.
2. In a small bowl, combine salt, black pepper, smoked paprika, granulated garlic, and granulated onion. Sprinkle both sides of chicken with seasoning mixture; place thighs in the prepared pan.
3. Bake in the center of the preheated oven for 15 minutes.
4. Meanwhile, for sauce, combine peach preserves, mango habanero salsa, lemon zest, and lemon  juice in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir frequently, until peach preserves are melted down, and mixture is heated through. When sauce bubbles, remove from heat.
5. Generously coat both sides of chicken thighs with sauce and return to the oven.
6. Return chicken to the oven and bake until chicken is no longer pink at the center and juices run clear, about 10 minutes more. An instant read thermometer inserted near the center should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
7. Garnish with parsley and lemon, and serve warm with remaining sauce.Cook’s NoteThe Fischer & Wieser Mango Ginger Habanero Sauce is quite spicy. Start with 1/4 cup, and increase to suit your taste up to 3/4 cup.

Title: Air Fryer Dilly-Roasted Japanese Eggplant and Squash
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/air-fryer-dilly-roasted-japanese-eggplant-and-squash-recipe-11800571
Ingredients:
- 1Japanese eggplant, sliced into 1/4-inch rounds
- 1yellow squash, sliced into 1/4-inch rounds
- 1/3cupoil and vinegar salad dressing, such as Newman's Own® Classic Oil and Vinegar Salad Dressing
- 1/2teaspoonfreeze-dried dill
Instructions:
1. Preheat an air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
2. Place eggplant and squash rounds into a large mixing bowl. Add salad dressing and dill. Toss until evenly combined.
3. Place veggie mixture into the basket of the air fryer. Cook 4 minutes, shake, and cook 4 minutes more.

Title: Meatball Gnocchi Sheet Pan Dinner
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/meatball-gnocchi-sheet-pan-dinner-recipe-11786387
Ingredients:
- 1(20 to 24 ounce) packagefrozen cooked Italian beef meatballs
- 1(12 to 16 ounce) packagerefrigerated or frozen potato gnocchi
- 2cupsminiaturesweet peppers
- 1red onion, cut into 1/2 inch wedges
- 2tablespoonsolive oil
- 1teaspoonItalian seasoning
- 1/2teaspoonsalt
- 1/4teaspooncrushed red pepper
- 1/3cupgrated Parmesan cheese
- sauce of choice for serving, e.g.basil pesto, Alfredo, or marinara sauce (optional)
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Line a large rimmed baking sheet with foil.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
2. Arrange meatballs, gnocchi, peppers, and onion on the prepared baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with Italian seasoning, salt, and crushed red pepper; toss to coat.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
3. Bake in the preheated oven until vegetables are tender and browned on the edges, stirring once, 15 to 20 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell
4. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve with sauce, if desired.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Sue Mitchell

Title: Crustless Zucchini Corn Quiche
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/crustless-zucchini-corn-quiche-recipe-11815928
Ingredients:
- 2tablespoonsunsalted butter, plus more for greasing the baking pan
- 1/2cupchoppedonion
- 1zucchini, halved lengthwise and sliced
- 3/4cupfrozencorn kernels, thawed
- 6largeeggs, lightly beaten
- 1/4cupcream
- 1/2teaspoonsalt, or to taste
- 1/4teaspoonblack pepper, or to taste
- 1/4teaspooncayenne pepper(optional)
- 1/2cupgratedGruyere or Swiss cheese
- 1cupchoppedfresh spinach
- 4red bell pepper slices
- fresh parsley for garnish(optional)
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) and grease a 9-inch pie pan with unsalted butter.
2. Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. When the butter bubbles, add onion and cook, stirring occasionally, 1 to 2 minutes.
3. Stir in zucchini and corn kernels, lightly season skillet contents with salt and pepper, and cook until vegetables are tender crisp, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat.
4. In a large mixing bowl, whisk eggs with cream, salt, pepper, and cayenne until well mixed. Stir in cheese, fresh chopped spinach, and skillet contents.
5. Pour egg mixture into the prepared pan, and place red bell pepper rings on top, pressing down into the quiche until the tops of the rings are even with the egg mixture.
6. Bake in the center of the preheated oven until lightly browned, and a knife inserted into the center comes out clean, 25 to 30 minutes. Cool on a rack for 5 to 10 minutes.
7. Garnish with fresh parsley sprigs, and serve warm.

========================================

Title: Grilled Corn and Avocado Salad
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/grilled-corn-and-avocado-salad-recipe-11783574
Ingredients:
- 3earsfreshsweet corn, husks removed
- 2tablespoonsextra virgin olive oil, plus more for grilling
- 1largelime, zested and juiced
- 1tablespoonhoney
- 1teaspoonbottled green hot pepper sauce, or more to taste
- 1/2teaspoonsalt
- 1/4teaspoonfreshlyground black pepper
- 2cupscherry or grape tomatoes, halved
- 1largeavocado, diced
- 1/2cupcrumbled feta orcotija cheese
- 2tablespoonschoppedfresh cilantro
- 2tablespoonschopped fresh basil
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat (325 degrees to 375 degrees F or 165 to 190 degrees C). Lightly oil grate.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
2. Place corn on grill rack directly over heat. Cover and grill corn, turning occasionally, until the corn is tender and browned specks appear, 15 minutes; set aside until cool enough to handle.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
3. Slice the kernels off of the cobs. You should have about 1 1/2 cups.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
4. Meanwhile, whisk together olive oil, lime zest, lime juice, honey, hot sauce, salt, and pepper in a large bowl.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
5. Add corn kernels, tomatoes, avocado, cheese, cilantro, and basil. Toss until well combined.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel GrecoRecipe developed by Barrett Heald.

Title: Air Fryer Potato Slices with Dipping Sauce
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/air-fryer-potato-slices-with-dipping-sauce-recipe-11799563
Ingredients:
- 3/4cupketchup
- 1/2cupbeer
- 1tablespoonWorcestershire sauce
- 1/2teaspoononion powder
- 1/4teaspooncayenne, or to taste
- 2baking potatoesunpeeled
- olive oil cooking spray
- 1/2teaspoongarlic powder
- salt and freshly ground black pepperto taste
Instructions:
1. Combine ketchup, beer, Worcestershire sauce, onion powder, and cayenne in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, and simmer for 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat, and cool. Cover and store in the refrigerator until ready to use.
2. Preheat the air fryer to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Spray the basket with cooking spray or line with a disposable parchment liner.
3. Slice potatoes 1/4-inch thick (use a mandoline if you have one), and place in a bowl. Spray potatoes with olive oil spray, and sprinkle with garlic powder, salt and pepper. Give the potatoes a good stir.
4. Place potatoes in a single layer in the air fryer, and cook, shaking occasionally, until they start to crisp up a bit and turn golden brown, 14 to 17 minutes. Cooking times can vary depending on the brand and size of the fryer, and you may have to cook in batches.
5. Remove from the fryer, and serve with beer ketchup dipping sauce.

Title: Marry Me Potato Gratin
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/marry-me-potato-gratin-recipe-11797002
Ingredients:
- 3tablespoonsunsalted butter
- 1/3cupchoppedsun-dried tomatoes in oil, thoroughly drained and patted dry
- 1 1/2tablespoonsminced garlic
- 2tablespoonsall-purpose flour
- 1 3/4cupschicken broth
- 1 1/2cupsheavy cream
- 3ounceslow-moisture part-skim mozzarella cheese,shredded
- 1/3cupgrated Parmesan cheese
- 1 1/2tablespoonstomato paste
- 1 1/2teaspoonsdried oregano
- 1 1/2teaspoonskosher salt
- 1teaspooncrushed red pepper
- 3poundsYukon Gold potatoes, scrubbed and sliced 1/8-inch thick
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C).Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Renu Dhar / Prop Styling: Josh Hoggle
2. Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add sun-dried tomatoes and garlic; cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in flour and cook, stirring constantly, until slightly darker in color, 1 to 2 minutes.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Renu Dhar / Prop Styling: Josh Hoggle
3. Gradually whisk in chicken broth until fully combined. Whisk in heavy cream, and bring to a gentle simmer over medium heat, whisking constantly, until slightly thickened, about 3 minutes.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Renu Dhar / Prop Styling: Josh Hoggle
4. Remove from heat and whisk in mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, tomato paste, oregano, salt, and crushed red pepper until fully combined and cheese is melted.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Renu Dhar / Prop Styling: Josh Hoggle
5. Spread 1 cup of the sauce mixture evenly over the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish. Top with an even layer of potatoes (about 3 1/2 cups).Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Renu Dhar / Prop Styling: Josh Hoggle
6. Repeat layers twice more; top with remaining 1 cup of sauce. Cover baking dish with aluminum foil.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Renu Dhar / Prop Styling: Josh Hoggle
7. Bake in the preheated oven until potatoes are tender, 1 hour 30 minutes to 1 hour 45 minutes.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Renu Dhar / Prop Styling: Josh Hoggle
8. Remove and discard foil, continue baking, uncovered, until bubbling around edges and top is browned, 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool at room temperature for 20 minutes before serving.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Renu Dhar / Prop Styling: Josh Hoggle

Title: Frito Cowboy Coleslaw
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/frito-cowboy-coleslaw-recipe-11805680
Ingredients:
- 1/3cupmayonnaise
- 1/3cupsour cream
- 2limes, juiced
- 2tablespoonsadobo sauce from canned chipotles in adobo, or more to taste
- 1tablespoontaco seasoning
- 1tablespoonranch seasoning
- 2(16 ounce) bagstri-colorcoleslaw mix
- 2(11 ounce) canscrisp yellow corn, drained
- 1(15 ounce)can black beans, drained
- 2pepperjalapenos, seeded and diced
- 1smallred bell pepper, chopped
- 3green onions, chopped
- 4slicesbacon, cooked and chopped
- 116 ounce) bagchili cheese corn chips, such as Fritos
Instructions:
1. To make the dressing: Whisk mayonnaise, sour cream, lime juice, adobo sauce, taco seasoning, and ranch seasoning together in a bowl.
2. Toss coleslaw mix, corn, black beans, jalapenos, bell pepper, green onions, and bacon together in a large bowl. Pour in dressing and stir until ingredients are completely coated.
3. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Immediately before serving, stir in Fritos or serve Fritos on the side.Peyton Beckwith

Title: Easy Pumpkin Cheesecake Crescent Bars
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/easy-pumpkin-cheesecake-crescent-bars-recipe-11810022
Ingredients:
- cooking spray
- 2(8 ounce) packagescream cheese, softened
- 1cupwhitesugar
- 2largeeggs
- 1cuppumpkin puree
- 2teaspoonspumpkin pie spice
- 2(8 ounce) cansrefrigeratedcrescent rolls
- 1largeegg white
- 1tablespoonwater
- 3/4cupconfectioners sugar
- 2tablespoonsmilk
- 1teaspoonvanilla extract
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch pan with cooking spray.
2. Beat cream cheese in a bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. Add white sugar and egg and beat until smooth. Beat in pumpkin and pumpkin spice.
3. Lay 1 package crescent roll dough in the prepared pan and pinch openings together. Pour cream cheese filling over dough and spread until smooth with a spatula.
4. Carefully roll out the remaining package crescent roll dough over filling. Pinch openings together.
5. Whisk egg white and water together in a small bowl. Using a pastry brush, spread the mixture over the top of crust.
6. Bake until a toothpick poked into the center comes out clean, 40 to 45 minutes.
7. For glaze, whisk confectioner's sugar, milk, and vanilla together in a bowl until smooth. Let the cake cool for 20 minutes, then drizzle with glaze. Serve warm or cold.

========================================

Title: Spiral Spicy Cucumber Salad
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/spiral-spicy-cucumber-salad-recipe-11814637
Ingredients:
- 6mini cucumbers
- 2teaspoonssalt
- 1/4cupchoppedred onions
- 1/4cupseasonedrice vinegar
- 3tablespoonshot honey,such as Mike’s Hot Honey®
- 2tablespoonssoy sauce
- 1teaspoonsesame oil
- 1teaspoonfish sauce
- 2clovesgarlic, minced
- 1/4teaspoonred pepper flakes, or to taste
Instructions:
1. To spiral the cukes, place one between 2 chopsticks, and cut down into thin straight slices on the top. Flip the cucumber and make cuts at a 45 degree angle (diagonally) on the other side. This procedure allows the cucumbers to fan. Be sure that with each cut, the knife is hitting the chopsticks, so you don’t cut all the way through. Repeat with remaining cukes.
2. Place spiraled cucumbers in a large bowl. Sprinkle with salt, and gently rub salt in. Set aside to draw out moisture, but no longer than 10 minutes to avoid over softening. Rinse well with cold water to remove salt, and pat dry with a paper towel. Return to the bowl, and add onions.
3. For dressing, whisk vinegar, honey, soy sauce, sesame oil, fish sauce, garlic, and red pepper flakes in a small bowl until well combined. Pour dressing over cucumber-onion mixture, and gently toss until well coated.
4. Let cucumbers sit at room temperature for about 5 to 10 minutes, or cover and move to the fridge until ready to serve. Gently toss again before serving.

========================================

Title: Ground Turkey and Zucchini Skillet
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/ground-turkey-and-zucchini-skillet-recipe-11805473
Ingredients:
- 1tablespoonolive oil
- 1pound93% lean ground turkey
- 2zucchini, quartered lengthwise and sliced 3/4-inch thick
- 1pepperbell pepper
- 1smallonion,diced
- 2cloves garlic, minced
- 1(15.25 ounce) canblack beans, undrained
- 1(14.5 ounce) canfire roasted tomatoes, undrained
- 1 (14 1/2 ounce)cannew potatoes, drained and rinsed
- 1teaspoondried basil
- 1teaspoondried thyme
- salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
- chopped fresh parsleyand a sprinkle of red pepper flakes for garnish (optional)
Instructions:
1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add ground turkey, and cook until meat is browned and crumbly, 4 to 5 minutes.
2. Add zucchini, bell pepper, and onion, and stirring occasionally, cook until the veggies are tender, about 5 to 6 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
3. Stir in black beans, tomatoes, potatoes, basil, and thyme. Season with salt and pepper, reduce heat, and simmer for about 5 minutes. Add a little water if it becomes too thick.
4. Garnish with parsley and red pepper flakes, and serve.

Title: Tzatziki Chicken Salad
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/tzatziki-chicken-salad-recipe-11784625
Ingredients:
- 1English cucumber, 1/2 cup grated and 1 1/2 cups finely diced
- 3/4cupplain whole milk Greek yogurt
- 6tablespoonsfreshlemon juice
- 1/4cupchoppedfresh dill,plus more for garnish
- 1/4cupmayonnaise
- 1 1/2tablespoonsextra-virgin olive oil
- 1teaspoongratedgarlic
- 3/4teaspoonfreshly groundblack pepper
- 3/4teaspoonkosher salt
- 4cupsshreddedrotisserie chicken
- 4ouncesfeta cheese, crumbled
- 3/4cupdicedred onion
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Photographer: Brittney Cottrell / Food Styling: Amanda Holstein / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
2. Place 1/2 cup grated cucumber between 2 paper towels, and gently squeeze to remove excess moisture. Transfer to a large bowl.Photographer: Brittney Cottrell / Food Styling: Amanda Holstein / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
3. Add yogurt, lemon juice, dill, mayonnaise, oil, garlic, pepper, and salt to bowl with cucumber and stir until fully combined.Photographer: Brittney Cottrell / Food Styling: Amanda Holstein / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
4. Fold in chicken, feta, onion, and 1 1/2 cups diced cucumber until evenly coated; garnish with additional dill.Photographer: Brittney Cottrell / Food Styling: Amanda Holstein / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong

Title: Sheet Pan Honey Mustard Salmon and Green Beans
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/sheet-pan-honey-mustard-salmon-and-green-beans-recipe-11776314
Ingredients:
- cooking spray
- 3(5 ounce) filetssalmon, with skin on and about 1-inch thick at thickest part
- salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
- 3cupssmall wholegreen beans, trimmed
- 2tablespoonsolive oil
- 1/4cuphoney
- 1/4cupDijon mustard
- 1/2lemon,zested and juiced
- 2clovesgarlic,minced
- 1/4teaspooncayenne pepper (optional)
- lemon slices,for garnish (optional)
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C), and place an oven rack in the center. Line a sheet pan with aluminum foil and spray with cooking spray.
2. Place salmon on a plate, pat both sides dry with paper towels, and season lightly with salt and pepper. Let stand at room temperature while other ingredients are prepared.
3. Bring a pot of lightly salted water to a boil over high heat. Add green beans and bring back to a boil. Immediately transfer green beans to an ice bath and cool for 2 to 3 minutes. Drain well, and blot as much water as possible with paper towels.
4. Stir olive oil, honey, Dijon mustard, lemon zest, lemon juice, garlic, and cayenne together in a medium bowl. Set 2 tablespoons of honey mustard aside in a small bowl.
5. Brush a small amount of honey mustard over both sides of salmon. Place filets on one end of the prepared pan, skin side down.
6. Toss green beans in the bowl with remaining honey mustard. Spread seasoned green beans on the sheet pan in an even layer, opposite the salmon.
7. Bake in the center of the preheated oven until the interior temperature of salmon is about 120 degrees F (49 degrees C), about 14 minutes. Allow more time for thicker filets.
8. Turn on the oven’s broiler, and broil salmon and beans until sauce is bubbly and salmon and beans begin to brown, about 2 minutes.
9. Remove from the oven, brush salmon with reserved honey mustard using a clean brush, garnish with additional lemon slices, and serve warm.Cook’s NoteIf you prefer softer green beans, boil beans for 3 to 5 minutes, or until they are as soft as you like.

========================================

Title: Swamp Cabbage
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/swamp-cabbage-recipe-11792488
Ingredients:
- 8ouncesthick-cut bacon, chopped
- 6ounceshickory-smoked sausage, sliced into 1/2-inch-thick half moons
- 1yellow onion, chopped
- 1green bell pepper, chopped
- 2stalkscelery, chopped
- 1 1/2tablespoonsminced garlic
- 1(2 pound)green cabbage, coarsely chopped
- 1 1/2teaspoonskosher salt
- 3/4teaspoononion powder
- 1/2teaspoonfreshly groundblack pepper
- 1(14.5 ounce) candiced tomatoes
- 1(14 ounce) canhearts of palm, drained and roughly chopped
- 1/2cupvegetable broth
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients.Photographer: Brittney Cottrell / Food Styling: Amanda Holst / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
2. Heat a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add bacon and cook, stirring occasionally, until most of bacon starts to turn brown, about 8 minutes; add sausage and continue cooking, stirring often, until bacon and sausage are crisp, 2 to 3 minutes.Photographer: Brittney Cottrell / Food Styling: Amanda Holst / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
3. Add onion, bell pepper, celery, and garlic; cook, stirring often, until tender, about 5 minutes.Photographer: Brittney Cottrell / Food Styling: Amanda Holst / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
4. Add cabbage, salt, onion powder, and black pepper; cook, stirring often, until cabbage starts to wilt, 2 to 3 minutes. Add diced tomatoes, hearts of palm, and broth; stir until evenly combined.Photographer: Brittney Cottrell / Food Styling: Amanda Holst / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
5. Bring mixture to a simmer over medium heat; cover and cook, stirring every few minutes, until cabbage is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed, 15 to 20 minutes.Photographer: Brittney Cottrell / Food Styling: Amanda Holst / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee

Title: Smash Dumpling Tacos
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/smash-dumpling-tacos-recipe-11781222
Ingredients:
- 1cucumber, chopped
- 1tablespoonrice vinegar
- 1/2teaspoonsalt
- 1/4teaspoonchili flakes
- 1poundground pork
- 2clovesgarlic, minced
- 1tablespoontoasted sesame oil
- 1tablespoonlower-sodiumsoy sauce
- 2teaspoonsrice vinegar
- 1teaspoonginger paste
- 2green onions, chopped
- 12streettaco-size flour tortillas
- choppedcilantro, toasted sesame seeds, and Sriracha for garnish (optional)
Instructions:
1. Combine cucumber, rice vinegar, salt, and chili flakes in a small bowl. Set aside.
2. For taco filling, combine pork, garlic, sesame oil, soy sauce, rice vinegar, ginger paste, and green onions in a bowl; mix gently with your hands or a fork.
3. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Spread 2 tablespoons filling over a tortilla in a flat, even layer.
4. Place tortilla in the skillet filling side down. Using a spatula, press and cook for 3 minutes. Flip and cook 2 minutes more. Repeat with remaining tortillas.
5. Top with pickles; garnish with cilantro, sesame seeds, and Sriracha.

========================================

Title: Swamp Rice
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/swamp-rice-recipe-11791704
Ingredients:
- 3tablespoonsolive oil
- 1/2cupdicedonions
- 2teaspoonskosher salt,divided, or to taste
- 2cupsfirmly packedbaby spinach
- 4jalapeno peppers, seeded, sliced into 1-inch pieces
- 1bunchItalian parsley, large stems removed
- 2clovesgarlic, peeled
- 1bunchgreen onions,sliced
- 2 1/2cupswater,chicken broth, or vegetable broth
- 2cupsbasmati rice
Instructions:
1. Add oil to a saucepan with a tight fitting lid, and place over medium heat. Add onions and a pinch of salt, and cook, stirring occasionally, until onions soften and turn translucent, about 5 minutes.
2. Meanwhile, combine spinach, peppers, parsley, garlic, green onions, and water or broth in a blender. Blend on high speed to liquefy; set aside.
3. Add rice and remaining salt to the saucepan, and stir until rice grains are coated with oil, about 1 minute.
4. Turn the heat up to high; pour in liquid from the blender. Stir for a few seconds to combine, and then wait for the mixture to start to boil around the edges. Stir once more, and then briefly shake the pan to settle the rice down into an even layer.
5. Wait for mixture to return to a boil around the edges, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Reduce heat to medium-low, and cover tightly. Set a timer for 20 minutes.
6. Turn off the heat, set the timer for 10 minutes more, and let rice rest, covered, for the full 10 minutes. Uncover, and use a fork to test the doneness of rice in the center. If rice is tender, use a fork to stir, toss, and fluff to separate the rice grains. If it is not quite tender enough, cover and place back over medium-low heat for 5 minutes, and then recheck for doneness. Fluff and serve.John Mitzewich

========================================

Title: Chicken Bacon Ranch Potato Bake
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/chicken-bacon-ranch-potato-bake-recipe-11790658
Ingredients:
- 2 1/2poundsYukon gold potatoes, scrubbed and cut in 1-inch chunks
- 2tablespoonsolive oil
- 1(1-ounce)packetranch dry salad dressing mix,divided
- 8slicesbacon
- 1/2cupchoppedonion
- 3tablespoonsall purpose flour
- 1 1/2cupswhole milk
- 1tablespoonlemon juiceor white wine vinegar
- 2poundsskinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
- 1cupshreddedCheddar cheese, divided
- 1/4cupchoppedgreen onions
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
2. Place potatoes in the prepared baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with 1 tablespoon ranch dressing mix; toss to coat. Roast potatoes until lightly browned and tender, stirring twice, about 30 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
3. Meanwhile, cook bacon in a 12-inch skillet over medium heat until crisp, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon on paper towels. When cool enough to handle, crumble bacon. Drain all but 3 tablespoons bacon grease from the skillet.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
4. Add onion to the skillet. Cook until tender, 5 minutes. Stir in flour. Cook and stir for 1 minute more. Add milk. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Stir in lemon juice and remaining ranch dressing mix.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
5. Place chicken over the potatoes in the baking dish. Top with bacon and 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese. Pour sauce over the mixture. Bake until chicken is no longer pink, 15 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
6. Top with remaining 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese. Bake until melted, about 5 minutes.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco
7. Serve garnished with green onions.Photographer: Grant Webster / Food Styling: Shannon Goforth / Prop Styling: Gabriel Greco

Title: Easy Pumpkin Sausage Pancakes
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/easy-pumpkin-sausage-pancakes-recipe-11781759
Ingredients:
- 2cupspancake mix
- 1(15 ounce) canpumpkin puree
- 1 1/2cupsmilk
- 2(8 count) packagesfully cookedsausage patties, such as Jimmy Dean®
- 1 cup syrup, or as needed for serving
Instructions:
1. Add pancake mix, pumpkin, and milk to a bowl and stir until well combined.
2. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Working in batches, dip each sausage patty into pancake batter, and cook in the skillet until golden, 3 to 4 minutes per side.
3. Serve immediately with syrup or refrigerate until ready to serve.Peyton Beckwith

Title: Air Fryer Turkey Stuffed Peppers
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/air-fryer-turkey-stuffed-peppers-recipe-11806210
Ingredients:
- 3bell peppers, any color
- 1tablespoonolive oil
- 3/4teaspoonsalt, divided, or to taste
- 1large egg
- 1/4cupketchup
- 1 1/2tablespoonsItalian herb seasoning blend
- 1/2teaspoonred pepper flakess, or to taste
- 1/2teaspoonfreshlyground black pepper
- 1poundground turkey
- 1cupcooked rice
- 1cup mincedonion
- 4garlic cloves,minced
- olive oil cooking spray
- 1/2cupshredded mozzarella cheese
- Italian flat-leafparsley, for garnish (optional)
Instructions:
1. Wash and dry peppers, and cut in half from top to bottom. Remove seeds and white membranes, and trim away stems.
2. Brush the outside of each pepper half with olive oil, and place on a work surface, cut side up; sprinkle the inside of each very lightly with salt, about 1/4 teaspoon total.
3. In a large bowl, combine egg, ketchup, Italian seasoning, red pepper flakes, black pepper, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt. Stir vigorously with a fork or small whisk, until ingredients are well blended.
4. Add ground turkey, cooked rice, minced onion, and minced garlic to the bowl. Using clean hands, mix the ingredients until evenly combined.
5. Divide turkey mixture evenly into the prepared bell pepper halves, and spray the tops with olive oil spray.
6. Preheat an air fryer to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C), if recommended by the manufacturer. Air fry for about 15 minutes. Sprinkle tops of peppers evenly with mozzarella and air fry until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes more. Peppers are done when an instant read thermometer inserted near the center reaches 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
7. Garnish with Italian flat-leaf parsley and serve warm.Cook’s NoteThis recipe was developed for a 5.3 quart basket-style air fryer. Different brands and models may require adjustments to the cooking time, and may yield different results.From the EditorHere's all you need to know abouthow to cook rice.

========================================

Title: Cottage Cheese and Egg Bake
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/cottage-cheese-and-egg-bake-recipe-11797248
Ingredients:
- cooking spray
- 1tablespoonunsalted butter
- 4ouncessliced mushrooms
- 3/4cupdicedred bell pepper
- 4green onions, sliced, white and green parts separated
- 1cuppacked choppedfresh spinach
- salt and freshly ground black pepperto taste
- 6largeeggs
- 3/4cupcottage cheese
- 3 to 5 drops tabasco, or to taste
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spray an 8x8-inch cake pan with cooking spray, and set aside.
2. Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms, red bell pepper, and white parts of green onions. Cook, stirring, until vegetables are tender, but not quite done, 3 to 5 minutes.
3. Stir in spinach; cook until wilted. Remove from heat and set aside. Season with salt and pepper.
4. Break eggs into a mixing bowl and stir until yolks and whites are well combined. Stir in cottage cheese and Tabasco sauce. Stir in cooked vegetables, and pour egg and vegetable mixture into the prepared pan.
5. Bake in the preheated oven until mixture is set, 30 to 35 minutes, or until the mixture is set. Remove from the oven and let stand about 5 minutes.
6. Garnish with reserved diced green onion tops and serve warm.

Title: Bulgogi Ground Beef Stir Fry
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/bulgogi-ground-beef-stir-fry-recipe-11797163
Ingredients:
- 1poundlean ground beef
- 1/2tablespoonlow-sodium soy sauce
- 1tablespoonbeef tallow or avocado oil
- 1white onion, cut in half and sliced
- 1red bell pepper, cut into small pieces
- 1headbaby bok choy, stalk and leaves chopped separately, divided
- 2cupssnow peas, stringed and corners trimmed
- 3clovesgarlic,minced
- 5ouncesbulgogi marinade(see Cook's Note)
- salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
- 2cupshotcooked white rice,for serving
- cilantro leaves (optional)
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat a cast iron skillet and a large wok-style pan to medium-high heat.Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga
2. Lightly season the beef with salt and pepper. Add beef to the cast iron skillet, and allow to lightly sear before gently breaking it up into small chunks, but not too fine.Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga
3. Add in soy sauce. Cook until beef is no longer pink, then set aside.Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga
4. Add beef tallow to the wok. Add onions and saute just to get some color on them. Add bell pepper and chopped bok choy stalks; stir fry for 1 to 2 minutes. Add in snow peas, then garlic. Cook, stirring regularly to ensure everything softens but also stays crisp.Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga
5. Add in bok choy leaves last. Give all the vegetables 1 full stir, then add bulgogi marinade. Stir, then stir beef into the mix.Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga
6. Serve over hot white rice; garnish with cilantro leaves.Allrecipes / Diana ChistrugaCook’s NoteThe order of the vegetables is key as you want the firmer ones to cook longer so they do soften but also stay somewhat crisp. Bulgogi marinade is sold commercially, but you can also use a homemade version. Feel free to add a dash of low-sodium soy sauce or some chili garlic sauce to the final dish.From the EditorHere's everything you need to know abouthow to cook rice.

Title: Green Goddess Corn Salad
Category: vegetables
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/green-goddess-corn-salad-recipe-11784575
Ingredients:
- 4earsfreshcorn, husks removed
- 1tablespoonolive oil
- 1cupchopped mixedfresh tender herbs,such as dill, tarragon, basil, and flat-leaf parsley, plus more for garnish
- 1/2cupmayonnaise
- 1/4cupsour cream
- 1 1/2teaspoonsDijon mustard
- 2largegarlic cloves, roughly chopped
- 3tablespoonsfresh lemon juice, divided
- 3/4teaspoonground black pepper, divided
- 1/2teaspoonkosher salt, divided
- 1ripeavocado, cut into 1/2-inch chunks
- 1/2cupfinely choppedshallot
- 2ouncesCotija cheese,crumbled
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat a large cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat until hot, about 5 minutes.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Holstein / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
2. Coat corn evenly with oil. Add corn to skillet; cook over medium-high, turning occasionally, until tender and lightly charred, 12 to 15 minutes. (Alternatively, preheat a gas grill to High [450 to 500 degrees F (230 to 260 degrees C)]. Place corn on oiled grill grates; grill, uncovered, rotating every few minutes until charred all over, about 10 minutes.) Transfer corn cobs to a cutting board and let cool 5 minutes.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Holstein / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
3. Meanwhile, combine herbs, mayonnaise, sour cream, mustard, garlic, 2 tablespoons of the lemon juice, 1/2 teaspoon of the pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt in a blender; process until smooth and a very light green color, scraping down sides as needed, about 1 minute.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Holstein / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
4. Cut kernels from corn; discard cobs, and place in a large bowl with avocado, shallot, remaining 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon salt, and toss to combine.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Holstein / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong
5. Pour 1/3 cup dressing over corn mixture and toss until evenly coated; garnish with additional fresh herbs and cotija. Save remaining dressing for another use.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Holstein / Prop Styling: Abby Armstrong

Title: Pumpkin Curry with White Fish
Category: fruits
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/pumpkin-curry-with-white-fish-recipe-11775430
Ingredients:
- 1tablespoonvegetable oil
- 1/2red onion, thinly sliced
- 1carrot, peeled and thinly bias-sliced
- 1red bell pepper, cut into thin strips
- 1jalapeno or serrano pepper,seeded and minced
- 2tablespoonsyellow Thaicurry paste
- 2teaspoonsgratedfresh ginger
- 2clovesgarlic,minced
- 1(14 ounce) canunsweetened coconut milk
- 2/3cupcanned pumpkin
- 1tablespoonpuremaple syrup
- 1tablespoonfish sauce
- 1poundhalibutor cod fillets, cut into 1-inch pieces
- 1/4cupchoppedfresh cilantro
- 2cupshotcooked rice, for serving
- lime wedges, for serving
- toasted pepitas, for garnish
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a very large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and carrot; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, 3 to 4 minutes. Add bell pepper and jalapeño; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 3 minutes.
2. Add curry paste, ginger, and garlic; cook and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add coconut milk, pumpkin, maple syrup, and fish sauce; bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium and simmer, uncovered, stirring occasionally, until thickened, about 5 minutes.
3. Arrange halibut in skillet. Simmer, covered, 3 to 5 minutes or until opaque and an instant-read thermometer inserted into thickest portion registers 145 degrees F (63 degrees C). Top with cilantro. Serve with rice and lime wedges. Garnish with pepitas.

========================================

Title: Carrot Apple Pancakes
Category: fruits
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/carrot-apple-pancakes-recipe-11804389
Ingredients:
- 1cupgrated carrot
- 5tablespoonsunsalted butter, divided
- 1/8teaspoonsalt
- 1teaspoongratedginger root
- 1/4teaspoongroundcinnamon
- 1teaspoonwhite sugar
- 1large egg
- 1/2lemon, juiced
- 1apple, unpeeled
- 1/3cupchopped walnuts(optional)
- 1/2cupself-rising flour
Instructions:
1. Peel and grate enough carrot to fill a 1-cup measuring cup, unpacked. Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add grated carrots and salt, and cook, stirring, until carrot begins to lose its raw character and softens only slightly, about 2 minutes.
2. Transfer carrots into a bowl, and add ginger, cinnamon, white sugar, egg, and lemon juice.  Stir well to combine. Grate apple into the bowl, and stir to combine.
3. Add self-rising flour, and stir until it disappears. Let batter rest about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter in the same skillet used for carrots over medium heat.
4. Once the butter melts, transfer in about 1/4 cup batter per pancake, and flatten slightly with the back of the spoon. Cook pancakes until browned and cooked through, about 3 minutes per side.
5. Serve topped with an optional spoon of yogurt, maple syrup, and chopped walnuts if desired.John MitzewichFrom the EditorHere'show to make self-rising flour.

========================================

Title: Chai-Spiced Apple Babka
Category: fruits
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/chai-spiced-apple-babka-recipe-11791604
Ingredients:
- 1cupwhole milk
- 1/4cupsugar
- 1/4cupbutter
- 1teaspoonsalt
- 1/4cupwarmwater(110 degrees F to 115 degrees F)(43 degrees C to 46 degrees C)
- 2 (0.25-ounce)packages activedry yeast
- 2largeeggs
- 4 1/2cupsflour
- 8tablespoonsbutter
- 4mediumapples - peeled, thinly sliced, and cut into bite-sized pieces (about 4 cups)
- 2teaspoonslemon juice
- 2cupspackedbrown sugar
- 1/2cupflour
- 1tablespoonDIY Chai Spice (see footnote) or store-bought chai spice
- 1tablespoonvanilla extract
- 2largeegg whites, lightly beaten
Instructions:
1. Make Dough:Heat and stir milk, sugar, butter, and salt in a small saucepan just until warm (110 degrees F to 115 degrees F/43 degrees C to 46 degrees C) and butter is almost melted. Pour 1/4 cup warm water into the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment. Sprinkle yeast over warm water. Stir to dissolve. Stir remaining milk mixture into yeast mixture.
2. Add eggs and 2 1/2 cups flour to mixer bowl. Beat at low speed until combined. Beat at high speed for 15 seconds. Switch to dough hook attachment. Add remaining 2 cups flour, 1/2 cup at a time. Mix until dough leaves sides of bowl, about 5 minutes. Transfer dough to a large, lightly greased bowl, turning dough to coat. Cover; let rise in a warm spot until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
3. Make Filling:Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add apples; cook, stirring frequently, until just beginning to soften, about 4 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in lemon juice.
4. Melt 4 tablespoons butter. Transfer to a bowl. Stir in brown sugar, flour, chai spice, and vanilla (mixture will be crumbly). Stir in egg whites.
5. Shape Babka:Punch dough down. Turn dough out onto a large, lightly floured surface, cover with a bowl, and let rest 10 minutes. Line 3 (4x8-inch) loaf pans with parchment paper, leaving a 2-inch overhang on long sides.
6. Divide dough into thirds. Roll out each third into a 12-inch square on a lightly floured surface. Spoon one-third of the brown sugar filling (about 2/3 cup) onto each dough square and spread to 1/2 inch from edges. Evenly sprinkle one-third of the apple filling (about 1 heaping cup) over each dough square. Roll up each square tightly to form a log. Pinch seam closed to seal. With your palms, roll logs back and forth to make uniformly cylindrical.
7. With a sharp knife or dough scraper, cut one log in half lengthwise, exposing striped interior. Lay one half over the other, striped sides out, in an X. Twist ends below cross together 2 or 3 times. Repeat with ends above cross, twisting in opposite direction to form a spiral. Fit into prepared pan, patting down any loose filling and tucking ends under. (It might look like a mess now, but it comes out beautifully!) Repeat with remaining logs and pans. Cover pans with a kitchen towel and let rise in a warm spot until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
8. Bake Babka:Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter; brush over loaf tops. Bake loaves until puffed, well-browned, and an instant-read thermometer inserted into centers registers 200 degrees F (93 degrees C), about 45 minutes, tenting with foil if tops get too brown before loaves are done. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then use parchment to lift loaves from pans to transfer to wire racks.
9. Cool completely on wire racks, about 1 hour, before slicing and serving. (To freeze babka, wrap tightly and freeze up to 2 months. Thaw at room temperature.)DIY Chai SpiceCombine 2 teaspoons ground cardamom; 1 teaspoon cinnamon; 1 teaspoon ground ginger; 1 teaspoon ground fennel seeds; 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves; and a dash of black pepper. (Store in an airtight container up to 6 months.)

========================================

Title: Chewy Brown Butter Banana Bread Cookies
Category: fruits
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/chewy-brown-butter-banana-cookies-recipe-11800616
Ingredients:
- 1cupunsalted butter
- 1cupchopped walnuts
- 1 3/4cupsroughly choppedbananas,divided
- 1 1/2teaspoonsground cinnamon
- 1teaspoonsalt
- 1/4teaspoonground nutmeg
- 1cupfirmly packeddark brown sugar
- 1/4cupwhite sugar
- 1largeegg yolk
- 2teaspoonsvanilla extract
- 2cupsall-purpose flour
- 1tablespooncornstarch
- 1/2teaspoonbaking soda
Instructions:
1. Melt butter in a light-colored saucepan over medium-low heat. Add in chopped walnuts and 1 cup bananas. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring frequently, until bananas disintegrate, and little browned bits of butter begin to form and stick to the bottom of the pan, 15 to 20 minutes. Pour mixture into a large bowl and allow to cool for 15 minutes.
2. Stir cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg into butter mixture. Stir in brown sugar and white sugar until thoroughly combined. Mix in egg yolk and vanilla. Add in flour, remaining 3/4 cup sliced bananas, cornstarch, and baking soda and stir until incorporated. Cover dough and chill in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
3. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment.
4. Scoop out 1 1/2 tablespoon-sized balls of dough; space balls about 1 1/2-inches apart on the prepared baking sheets.
5. Bake cookies in the preheated oven until edges are browned, 12 to 17 minutes (try not to under bake, or the cookies will be too soft). Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheets for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

========================================

Title: Easy Banana Bread Cinnamon Rolls
Category: fruits
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/easy-banana-bread-cinnamon-rolls-recipe-11792491
Ingredients:
- cooking spray
- 1(8 ounce) packagecrescent dough sheet, such as Pillsbury®
- 1smallripebanana, mashed
- 2tablespoonsunsalted butter, melted and slightly cooled
- 1/4cuplight brown sugar
- 1 1/2teaspoonsground cinnamon, plus more for garnish
- 1/4teaspoonground nutmeg
- 3tablespoonsfinelychopped walnuts, toasted
- 1/4cupcream cheese,softened
- 2tablespoonsunsalted butter,softened
- 1/4cupconfectioners sugar
- 1/2teaspoonvanilla extract
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (180 degrees C). Lightly grease an 8x8-inch baking pan with cooking spray; set aside.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Holstein / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
2. For rolls, roll out crescent dough sheet onto a clean work surface, and shape into an 8x12-inch rectangle.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Holstein / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
3. Stir mashed banana and melted butter together in a small bowl until evenly combined. Spread butter mixture evenly on top of crescent dough, leaving a 1/4-inch border along the longer side farthest from you.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Holstein / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
4. Combine brown sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a small bowl; sprinkle mixture evenly over  banana mixture. Sprinkle evenly with chopped walnuts.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Holstein / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
5. Roll dough up tightly and carefully to form a log, starting from the longer side closest to you. Pinch the seam gently to seal.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Holstein / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
6. Cut dough log into 9 slices, about 1 1/4-inches thick. Arrange slices, cut side down, about 1/2-inch apart on the prepared baking pan.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Holstein / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
7. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and let rest in baking pan.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Holstein / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
8. Meanwhile, for icing, beat cream cheese and butter together with an electric mixer on medium speed until combined, 1 to 2 minutes. Add confectioner’s sugar and vanilla extract; beat until smooth, about 1 minute.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Holstein / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee
9. Spread icing over warm rolls, garnish with cinnamon, and serve immediately.Photographer: Robby Lozano / Food Styling: Amanda Holstein / Prop Styling: Keoshia McGhee

Title: Lemon Chicken Gnocchi
Category: fruits
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/lemon-chicken-gnocchi-recipe-11810480
Ingredients:
- 1tablespoonunsalted butter
- 1tablespoonolive oil
- 1poundskinless, boneless chicken breasts
- 1teaspoonsweetpaprika
- 1/2teaspoondried oregano
- 1/2teaspoonsalt
- 1/4teaspoonfreshly groundblack pepper
- 1clovegarlic, minced
- 1poundgnocchi
- 3/4cupchicken bone broth
- 1/2cuphigh protein 1% milk
- 6tablespoonsheavy cream
- 1lemon,juiced, or to taste
- 3 1/2ouncesfreshlygrated Parmesan cheese
- salt and freshly ground black pepperto taste
- fresh basil, for garnish (optional)
Instructions:
1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Melt butter with olive oil in the skillet.
2. Thinly slice chicken breast at a 45-degree angle to create medallions. Stir paprika, oregano, salt, and pepper together in a small bowl; sprinkle seasoning over chicken medallions.
3. Cook medallions until lightly browned and no longer pink at the center, about 2 minutes on each side; transfer to a plate and keep warm.
4. For lemon cream sauce, saute garlic in the same skillet without wiping out the skillet. Add in gnocchi; bone broth, milk, and heavy cream and simmer for about 7 minutes. Stir in half of lemon juice and Parmesan cheese.
5. Taste the sauce, add in remaining lemon juice until desired flavor is achieved and season with salt and pepper. Return chicken medallions to the dish. Garnish with basil and serve immediately.

========================================

Title: Apple Dessert Pizza
Category: fruits
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/apple-dessert-pizza-recipe-11795720
Ingredients:
- flour for dusting
- 1(16.5 to 18-ounce) packagerefrigeratedsugar cookie dough
- 1tablespoonbutter
- 2mediumapples, peeled and thinly sliced
- 1/4cupdried cranberries
- 1/2teaspoonlemon zest, plus more for garnish
- 1(8-ounce) packagemascarpone cheese, softened
- 1tablespoonpuremaple syrup
- 1cuppowdered sugar
- 1tablespoonlemon juice, or more as needed
- 1/4cupchopped pistachios or desired nuts, toasted
Instructions:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a 12-inch pizza pan with foil or parchment paper. Dust lightly with flour.
2. Break or slice cookie dough into pieces and arrange on prepared pan. Let stand to soften slightly, 5 to 10 minutes. Use your fingers to flatten dough to form an even crust 1 inch from pan edges, building up outside edge slightly to create a 1/2-inch crust.
3. Bake until golden brown, 18 to 20 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Slide crust onto a serving platter.
4. Meanwhile, melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add apples and cranberries. Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in lemon zest. Transfer mixture to a medium bowl and cool completely.
5. Beat together mascarpone and maple syrup in a small bowl with an electric mixer at medium speed until combined. Spread mascarpone mixture to edges of crust. Top with cooled apple mixture.
6. Whisk together powdered sugar and 1 tablespoon lemon juice; whisk in additional lemon juice as needed to reach drizzling consistency. Drizzle icing over pizza. Sprinkle with pistachios and garnish with additional lemon zest. (Best if served within 1 hour.)

========================================

Title: Cowboy Cookie Bars
Category: fruits
URL: https://www.allrecipes.com/cowboy-cookie-bars-recipe-11803951
Ingredients:
- 1cupall purpose flour
- 1teaspoonsalt
- 1/2teaspoonground cinnamon
- 1/4teaspoonbaking powder
- 1cup packedlight brown sugar
- 1/2cupunsalted butter, melted
- 2largeeggs
- 2teaspoonsvanilla extract
- 3/4cuprolled oats
- 1/2cupshredded coconut
- 1/2cupsemi-sweet chocolate chips
- 1/2cupchoppedpecans
Instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line an 8x8-inch baking pan with parchment paper.Photographer: Jake Sternquist / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Kristen Schooley
2. Mix together flour, salt, cinnamon, and baking powder in a large bowl; set aside.Photographer: Jake Sternquist / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Kristen Schooley
3. Whisk together brown sugar, melted butter, eggs, and vanilla in a medium bowl. Add to flour mixture and stir until moistenedPhotographer: Jake Sternquist / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Kristen Schooley
4. Add oats, coconut, chocolate chips, and pecans to the dough. Fold with a spatula until well combined. (The mixture will be thick.)Photographer: Jake Sternquist / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Kristen Schooley
5. Transfer dough to the prepared baking pan and spread out evenly. Bake until the bars are golden brown and set on the edges, 25 to 30 minutesPhotographer: Jake Sternquist / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Kristen Schooley
6. Transfer pan to a wire rack and cool in the pan. Cut into 12 portions.Photographer: Jake Sternquist / Food Styling: Sammy Mila / Prop Styling: Kristen Schooley

Title: Berry Cottage Cheese Breakfast Bowl
